31 extern "C" {
32 // Forward declarartions.
33 static pi_result EventRelease(pi_event Event, pi_queue LockedQueue);
34 static pi_result QueueRelease(pi_queue Queue, pi_queue LockedQueue);

36  bool HostVisible, pi_event *RetEvent);

39 namespace {
40 
41 // Controls Level Zero calls serialization to w/a Level Zero driver being not MT
42 // ready. Recognized values (can be used as a bit mask):
43 enum {
44  ZeSerializeNone =
45  0, // no locking or blocking (except when SYCL RT requested blocking)
46  ZeSerializeLock = 1, // locking around each ZE_CALL
47  ZeSerializeBlock =
48  2, // blocking ZE calls, where supported (usually in enqueue commands)
49 };
50 static const pi_uint32 ZeSerialize = [] {
51  const char *SerializeMode = std::getenv("ZE_SERIALIZE");
52  const pi_uint32 SerializeModeValue =
53  SerializeMode ? std::atoi(SerializeMode) : 0;
54  return SerializeModeValue;
55 }();
56 
57 // This is an experimental option to test performance of device to device copy
58 // operations on copy engines (versus compute engine)
59 static const bool UseCopyEngineForD2DCopy = [] {
60  const char *CopyEngineForD2DCopy =
61  std::getenv("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_USE_COPY_ENGINE_FOR_D2D_COPY");
62  return (CopyEngineForD2DCopy && (std::stoi(CopyEngineForD2DCopy) != 0));
63 }();
64 
65 // This is an experimental option that allows the use of copy engine, if
66 // available in the device, in Level Zero plugin for copy operations submitted
67 // to an in-order queue. The default is 1.
68 static const bool UseCopyEngineForInOrderQueue = [] {
69  const char *CopyEngineForInOrderQueue =
70  std::getenv("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_USE_COPY_ENGINE_FOR_IN_ORDER_QUEUE");
71  return (!CopyEngineForInOrderQueue ||
72  (std::stoi(CopyEngineForInOrderQueue) != 0));
73 }();
74 
75 // This class encapsulates actions taken along with a call to Level Zero API.
76 class ZeCall {
77 private:
78  // The global mutex that is used for total serialization of Level Zero calls.
79  static std::mutex GlobalLock;
80 
81 public:
82  ZeCall() {
83  if ((ZeSerialize & ZeSerializeLock) != 0) {
84  GlobalLock.lock();
85  }
86  }
87  ~ZeCall() {
88  if ((ZeSerialize & ZeSerializeLock) != 0) {
89  GlobalLock.unlock();
90  }
91  }
92 
93  // The non-static version just calls static one.
94  ze_result_t doCall(ze_result_t ZeResult, const char *ZeName,
95  const char *ZeArgs, bool TraceError = true);
96 };
97 std::mutex ZeCall::GlobalLock;
98 
99 // Controls PI level tracing prints.
100 static bool PrintPiTrace = false;
101 
102 // Controls support of the indirect access kernels and deferred memory release.
103 static const bool IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled = [] {
104  return std::getenv("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_TRACK_INDIRECT_ACCESS_MEMORY") !=
105  nullptr;
106 }();
107 
108 // Map Level Zero runtime error code to PI error code.
109 static pi_result mapError(ze_result_t ZeResult) {
110  // TODO: these mapping need to be clarified and synced with the PI API return
111  // values, which is TBD.
112  static std::unordered_map<ze_result_t, pi_result> ErrorMapping = {
113  {ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS, PI_SUCCESS},
114  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_DEVICE_LOST, PI_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND},
115  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS, PI_INVALID_OPERATION},
116  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_NOT_AVAILABLE, PI_INVALID_OPERATION},
117  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNINITIALIZED, PI_INVALID_PLATFORM},
118  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT, PI_INVALID_ARG_VALUE},
119  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_NULL_POINTER, PI_INVALID_VALUE},
120  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_SIZE, PI_INVALID_VALUE},
121  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_SIZE, PI_INVALID_VALUE},
122  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_ALIGNMENT, PI_INVALID_VALUE},
123  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_SYNCHRONIZATION_OBJECT, PI_INVALID_EVENT},
124  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_ENUMERATION, PI_INVALID_VALUE},
125  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_ENUMERATION, PI_INVALID_VALUE},
126  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_IMAGE_FORMAT, PI_INVALID_VALUE},
127  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_NATIVE_BINARY, PI_INVALID_BINARY},
128  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_KERNEL_NAME, PI_INVALID_KERNEL_NAME},
129  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_FUNCTION_NAME, PI_BUILD_PROGRAM_FAILURE},
130  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_OVERLAPPING_REGIONS, PI_INVALID_OPERATION},
131  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_GROUP_SIZE_DIMENSION,
132  PI_INVALID_WORK_GROUP_SIZE},
133  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_MODULE_BUILD_FAILURE, PI_BUILD_PROGRAM_FAILURE},
134  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_OUT_OF_DEVICE_MEMORY, PI_OUT_OF_RESOURCES},
135  {ZE_RESULT_ERROR_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY, PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY}};
136 
137  auto It = ErrorMapping.find(ZeResult);
138  if (It == ErrorMapping.end()) {
139  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
140  }
141  return It->second;
142 }
143 
144 // This will count the calls to Level-Zero
145 static std::map<const char *, int> *ZeCallCount = nullptr;
146 
147 // Trace a call to Level-Zero RT
148 #define ZE_CALL(ZeName, ZeArgs) \
149  { \
150  ze_result_t ZeResult = ZeName ZeArgs; \
151  if (auto Result = ZeCall().doCall(ZeResult, #ZeName, #ZeArgs, true)) \
152  return mapError(Result); \
153  }
154 
155 #define ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(ZeName, ZeArgs) \
156  ZeCall().doCall(ZeName ZeArgs, #ZeName, #ZeArgs, false)
157 
158 // Trace an internal PI call; returns in case of an error.
159 #define PI_CALL(Call) \
160  { \
161  if (PrintPiTrace) \
162  fprintf(stderr, "PI ---> %s\n", #Call); \
163  pi_result Result = (Call); \
164  if (Result != PI_SUCCESS) \
165  return Result; \
166  }
167 
168 enum DebugLevel {
169  ZE_DEBUG_NONE = 0x0,
170  ZE_DEBUG_BASIC = 0x1,
171  ZE_DEBUG_VALIDATION = 0x2,
172  ZE_DEBUG_CALL_COUNT = 0x4,
173  ZE_DEBUG_ALL = -1
174 };
175 
176 // Controls Level Zero calls tracing.
177 static const int ZeDebug = [] {
178  const char *DebugMode = std::getenv("ZE_DEBUG");
179  return DebugMode ? std::atoi(DebugMode) : ZE_DEBUG_NONE;
180 }();
181 
182 static void zePrint(const char *Format, ...) {
183  if (ZeDebug & ZE_DEBUG_BASIC) {
184  va_list Args;
185  va_start(Args, Format);
186  vfprintf(stderr, Format, Args);
187  va_end(Args);
188  }
189 }
190 
191 // Controls whether device-scope events are used, and how.
192 static const enum EventsScope {
193  // All events are created host-visible.
194  AllHostVisible,
195  // All events are created with device-scope and only when
196  // host waits them or queries their status that a proxy
197  // host-visible event is created and set to signal after
198  // original event signals.
199  OnDemandHostVisibleProxy,
200  // All events are created with device-scope and only
201  // when a batch of commands is submitted for execution a
202  // last command in that batch is added to signal host-visible
203  // completion of each command in this batch (the default mode).
204  LastCommandInBatchHostVisible
205 } EventsScope = [] {
206  const auto DeviceEventsStr =
207  std::getenv("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_DEVICE_SCOPE_EVENTS");
208 
209  auto Default = LastCommandInBatchHostVisible;
210  switch (DeviceEventsStr ? std::atoi(DeviceEventsStr) : Default) {
211  case 0:
212  return AllHostVisible;
213  case 1:
214  return OnDemandHostVisibleProxy;
215  case 2:
216  return LastCommandInBatchHostVisible;
217  }
218  return Default;
219 }();
220 
221 // Maximum number of events that can be present in an event ZePool is captured
222 // here. Setting it to 256 gave best possible performance for several
223 // benchmarks.
224 static const pi_uint32 MaxNumEventsPerPool = [] {
225  const auto MaxNumEventsPerPoolEnv =
226  std::getenv("ZE_MAX_NUMBER_OF_EVENTS_PER_EVENT_POOL");
227  pi_uint32 Result =
228  MaxNumEventsPerPoolEnv ? std::atoi(MaxNumEventsPerPoolEnv) : 256;
229  if (Result <= 0)
230  Result = 256;
231  return Result;
232 }();
233 
234 // Helper function to implement zeHostSynchronize.
235 // The behavior is to avoid infinite wait during host sync under ZE_DEBUG.
236 // This allows for a much more responsive debugging of hangs.
237 //
238 template <typename T, typename Func>
239 ze_result_t zeHostSynchronizeImpl(Func Api, T Handle) {
240  if (!ZeDebug) {
241  return Api(Handle, UINT64_MAX);
242  }
243 
244  ze_result_t R;
245  while ((R = Api(Handle, 1000)) == ZE_RESULT_NOT_READY)
246  ;
247  return R;
248 }
249 
250 // Template function to do various types of host synchronizations.
251 // This is intended to be used instead of direct calls to specific
252 // Level-Zero synchronization APIs.
253 //
254 template <typename T> ze_result_t zeHostSynchronize(T Handle);
255 template <> ze_result_t zeHostSynchronize(ze_event_handle_t Handle) {
256  return zeHostSynchronizeImpl(zeEventHostSynchronize, Handle);
257 }
258 template <> ze_result_t zeHostSynchronize(ze_command_queue_handle_t Handle) {
259  return zeHostSynchronizeImpl(zeCommandQueueSynchronize, Handle);
260 }
261 template <> ze_result_t zeHostSynchronize(ze_fence_handle_t Handle) {
262  return zeHostSynchronizeImpl(zeFenceHostSynchronize, Handle);
263 }
264 
265 template <typename T, typename Assign>
266 pi_result getInfoImpl(size_t param_value_size, void *param_value,
267  size_t *param_value_size_ret, T value, size_t value_size,
268  Assign &&assign_func) {
269 
270  if (param_value != nullptr) {
271 
272  if (param_value_size < value_size) {
273  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
274  }
275 
276  assign_func(param_value, value, value_size);
277  }
278 
279  if (param_value_size_ret != nullptr) {
280  *param_value_size_ret = value_size;
281  }
282 
283  return PI_SUCCESS;
284 }
285 
286 template <typename T>
287 pi_result getInfo(size_t param_value_size, void *param_value,
288  size_t *param_value_size_ret, T value) {
289 
290  auto assignment = [](void *param_value, T value, size_t value_size) {
291  (void)value_size;
292  *static_cast<T *>(param_value) = value;
293  };
294 
295  return getInfoImpl(param_value_size, param_value, param_value_size_ret, value,
296  sizeof(T), assignment);
297 }
298 
299 template <typename T>
300 pi_result getInfoArray(size_t array_length, size_t param_value_size,
301  void *param_value, size_t *param_value_size_ret,
302  T *value) {
303  return getInfoImpl(param_value_size, param_value, param_value_size_ret, value,
304  array_length * sizeof(T), memcpy);
305 }
306 
307 template <typename T, typename RetType>
308 pi_result getInfoArray(size_t array_length, size_t param_value_size,
309  void *param_value, size_t *param_value_size_ret,
310  T *value) {
311  if (param_value) {
312  memset(param_value, 0, param_value_size);
313  for (uint32_t I = 0; I < array_length; I++)
314  ((RetType *)param_value)[I] = (RetType)value[I];
315  }
316  if (param_value_size_ret)
317  *param_value_size_ret = array_length * sizeof(RetType);
318  return PI_SUCCESS;
319 }
320 
321 template <>
322 pi_result getInfo<const char *>(size_t param_value_size, void *param_value,
323  size_t *param_value_size_ret,
324  const char *value) {
325  return getInfoArray(strlen(value) + 1, param_value_size, param_value,
326  param_value_size_ret, value);
327 }
328 
329 class ReturnHelper {
330 public:
331  ReturnHelper(size_t param_value_size, void *param_value,
332  size_t *param_value_size_ret)
333  : param_value_size(param_value_size), param_value(param_value),
334  param_value_size_ret(param_value_size_ret) {}
335 
336  template <class T> pi_result operator()(const T &t) {
337  return getInfo(param_value_size, param_value, param_value_size_ret, t);
338  }
339 
340 private:
341  size_t param_value_size;
342  void *param_value;
343  size_t *param_value_size_ret;
344 };
345 
346 } // anonymous namespace
347 
348 // SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_USE_COMPUTE_ENGINE can be set to an integer (>=0) in
349 // which case all compute commands will be submitted to the command-queue
350 // with the given index in the compute command group. If it is instead set
351 // to negative then all available compute engines may be used.
352 //
353 // The default value is "0".
354 //
355 static const std::pair<int, int> getRangeOfAllowedComputeEngines = [] {
356  const char *EnvVar = std::getenv("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_USE_COMPUTE_ENGINE");
357  // If the environment variable is not set only use "0" CCS for now.
358  // TODO: allow all CCSs when HW support is complete.
359  if (!EnvVar)
360  return std::pair<int, int>(0, 0);
361 
362  auto EnvVarValue = std::atoi(EnvVar);
363  if (EnvVarValue >= 0) {
364  return std::pair<int, int>(EnvVarValue, EnvVarValue);
365  }
366 
367  return std::pair<int, int>(0, INT_MAX);
368 }();
369 
370 // SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_USE_COPY_ENGINE can be set to an integer value, or
371 // a pair of integer values of the form "lower_index:upper_index".
372 // Here, the indices point to copy engines in a list of all available copy
373 // engines.
374 // This functions returns this pair of indices.
375 // If the user specifies only a single integer, a value of 0 indicates that
376 // the copy engines will not be used at all. A value of 1 indicates that all
377 // available copy engines can be used.
378 static const std::pair<int, int> getRangeOfAllowedCopyEngines = [] {
379  const char *EnvVar = std::getenv("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_USE_COPY_ENGINE");
380  // If the environment variable is not set, all available copy engines can be
381  // used.
382  if (!EnvVar)
383  return std::pair<int, int>(0, INT_MAX);
384  std::string CopyEngineRange = EnvVar;
385  // Environment variable can be a single integer or a pair of integers
386  // separated by ":"
387  auto pos = CopyEngineRange.find(":");
388  if (pos == std::string::npos) {
389  bool UseCopyEngine = (std::stoi(CopyEngineRange) != 0);
390  if (UseCopyEngine)
391  return std::pair<int, int>(0, INT_MAX); // All copy engines can be used.
392  return std::pair<int, int>(-1, -1); // No copy engines will be used.
393  }
394  int LowerCopyEngineIndex = std::stoi(CopyEngineRange.substr(0, pos));
395  int UpperCopyEngineIndex = std::stoi(CopyEngineRange.substr(pos + 1));
396  if ((LowerCopyEngineIndex > UpperCopyEngineIndex) ||
397  (LowerCopyEngineIndex < -1) || (UpperCopyEngineIndex < -1)) {
398  zePrint("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_USE_COPY_ENGINE: invalid value provided, "
399  "default set.\n");
400  LowerCopyEngineIndex = 0;
401  UpperCopyEngineIndex = INT_MAX;
402  }
403  return std::pair<int, int>(LowerCopyEngineIndex, UpperCopyEngineIndex);
404 }();
405 
406 static const bool CopyEngineRequested = [] {
407  int LowerCopyQueueIndex = getRangeOfAllowedCopyEngines.first;
408  int UpperCopyQueueIndex = getRangeOfAllowedCopyEngines.second;
409  return ((LowerCopyQueueIndex != -1) || (UpperCopyQueueIndex != -1));
410 }();
411 
412 // Global variables used in PI_Level_Zero
413 // Note we only create a simple pointer variables such that C++ RT won't
414 // deallocate them automatically at the end of the main program.
415 // The heap memory allocated for these global variables reclaimed only when
416 // Sycl RT calls piTearDown().
417 static std::vector<pi_platform> *PiPlatformsCache =
418  new std::vector<pi_platform>;
419 static sycl::detail::SpinLock *PiPlatformsCacheMutex =
420  new sycl::detail::SpinLock;
421 static bool PiPlatformCachePopulated = false;
422 
423 // Flags which tell whether various Level Zero extensions are available.
424 static bool PiDriverGlobalOffsetExtensionFound = false;
425 static bool PiDriverModuleProgramExtensionFound = false;
426 
427 pi_result
428 _pi_context::getFreeSlotInExistingOrNewPool(ze_event_pool_handle_t &Pool,
429  size_t &Index, bool HostVisible,
430  bool ProfilingEnabled) {
431  // Lock while updating event pool machinery.
432  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> Lock(ZeEventPoolCacheMutex);
433 
434  std::list<ze_event_pool_handle_t> *ZePoolCache =
435  getZeEventPoolCache(HostVisible, ProfilingEnabled);
436 
437  // Remove full pool from the cache.
438  if (!ZePoolCache->empty()) {
439  if (NumEventsAvailableInEventPool[ZePoolCache->front()] == 0) {
440  ZePoolCache->erase(ZePoolCache->begin());
441  }
442  }
443  if (ZePoolCache->empty()) {
444  ZePoolCache->push_back(nullptr);
445  }
446 
447  // We shall be adding an event to the front pool.
448  ze_event_pool_handle_t *ZePool = &ZePoolCache->front();
449  Index = 0;
450  // Create one event ZePool per MaxNumEventsPerPool events
451  if (*ZePool == nullptr) {
452  ZeStruct<ze_event_pool_desc_t> ZeEventPoolDesc;
453  ZeEventPoolDesc.count = MaxNumEventsPerPool;
454  ZeEventPoolDesc.flags = 0;
455  if (HostVisible)
456  ZeEventPoolDesc.flags |= ZE_EVENT_POOL_FLAG_HOST_VISIBLE;
457  if (ProfilingEnabled)
458  ZeEventPoolDesc.flags |= ZE_EVENT_POOL_FLAG_KERNEL_TIMESTAMP;
459  zePrint("ze_event_pool_desc_t flags set to: %d\n", ZeEventPoolDesc.flags);
460 
461  std::vector<ze_device_handle_t> ZeDevices;
462  std::for_each(Devices.begin(), Devices.end(),
463  [&](pi_device &D) { ZeDevices.push_back(D->ZeDevice); });
464 
465  ZE_CALL(zeEventPoolCreate, (ZeContext, &ZeEventPoolDesc, ZeDevices.size(),
466  &ZeDevices[0], ZePool));
467  NumEventsAvailableInEventPool[*ZePool] = MaxNumEventsPerPool - 1;
468  NumEventsUnreleasedInEventPool[*ZePool] = 1;
469  } else {
470  Index = MaxNumEventsPerPool - NumEventsAvailableInEventPool[*ZePool];
471  --NumEventsAvailableInEventPool[*ZePool];
472  ++NumEventsUnreleasedInEventPool[*ZePool];
473  }
474  Pool = *ZePool;
475  return PI_SUCCESS;
476 }
477 
478 pi_result _pi_context::decrementUnreleasedEventsInPool(pi_event Event) {
479  if (!Event->ZeEventPool) {
480  // This must be an interop event created on a users's pool.
481  // Do nothing.
482  return PI_SUCCESS;
483  }
484 
485  std::list<ze_event_pool_handle_t> *ZePoolCache =
486  getZeEventPoolCache(Event->isHostVisible(), Event->isProfilingEnabled());
487 
488  // Put the empty pool to the cache of the pools.
489  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> Lock(ZeEventPoolCacheMutex);
490  if (NumEventsUnreleasedInEventPool[Event->ZeEventPool] == 0)
491  die("Invalid event release: event pool doesn't have unreleased events");
492  if (--NumEventsUnreleasedInEventPool[Event->ZeEventPool] == 0) {
493  if (ZePoolCache->front() != Event->ZeEventPool) {
494  ZePoolCache->push_back(Event->ZeEventPool);
495  }
496  NumEventsAvailableInEventPool[Event->ZeEventPool] = MaxNumEventsPerPool;
497  }
498 
499  return PI_SUCCESS;
500 }
501 
502 // Some opencl extensions we know are supported by all Level Zero devices.
503 constexpr char ZE_SUPPORTED_EXTENSIONS[] =
504  "cl_khr_il_program cl_khr_subgroups cl_intel_subgroups "
505  "cl_intel_subgroups_short cl_intel_required_subgroup_size ";
506 
507 // Forward declarations
508 static pi_result
509 enqueueMemCopyHelper(pi_command_type CommandType, pi_queue Queue, void *Dst,
510  pi_bool BlockingWrite, size_t Size, const void *Src,
511  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
512  const pi_event *EventWaitList, pi_event *Event,
513  bool PreferCopyEngine = false);
514 
515 static pi_result enqueueMemCopyRectHelper(
516  pi_command_type CommandType, pi_queue Queue, void *SrcBuffer,
517  void *DstBuffer, pi_buff_rect_offset SrcOrigin,
518  pi_buff_rect_offset DstOrigin, pi_buff_rect_region Region,
519  size_t SrcRowPitch, size_t SrcSlicePitch, size_t DstRowPitch,
520  size_t DstSlicePitch, pi_bool Blocking, pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
521  const pi_event *EventWaitList, pi_event *Event,
522  bool PreferCopyEngine = false);
523 
524 inline void zeParseError(ze_result_t ZeError, const char *&ErrorString) {
525  switch (ZeError) {
526 #define ZE_ERRCASE(ERR) \
527  case ERR: \
528  ErrorString = "" #ERR; \
529  break;
530 
531  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS)
532  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_NOT_READY)
533  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_DEVICE_LOST)
534  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY)
535  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_OUT_OF_DEVICE_MEMORY)
536  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_MODULE_BUILD_FAILURE)
537  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS)
538  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_NOT_AVAILABLE)
539  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNINITIALIZED)
540  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_VERSION)
541  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE)
542  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT)
543  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_NULL_HANDLE)
544  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_HANDLE_OBJECT_IN_USE)
545  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_NULL_POINTER)
546  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_SIZE)
547  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_SIZE)
548  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_ALIGNMENT)
549  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_SYNCHRONIZATION_OBJECT)
550  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_ENUMERATION)
551  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_ENUMERATION)
552  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_IMAGE_FORMAT)
553  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_NATIVE_BINARY)
554  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_GLOBAL_NAME)
555  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_KERNEL_NAME)
556  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_FUNCTION_NAME)
557  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_GROUP_SIZE_DIMENSION)
558  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_GLOBAL_WIDTH_DIMENSION)
559  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_KERNEL_ARGUMENT_INDEX)
560  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_KERNEL_ARGUMENT_SIZE)
561  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_KERNEL_ATTRIBUTE_VALUE)
562  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_COMMAND_LIST_TYPE)
563  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_OVERLAPPING_REGIONS)
564  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_MODULE_UNLINKED)
565  ZE_ERRCASE(ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNKNOWN)
566 
567 #undef ZE_ERRCASE
568  default:
569  assert(false && "Unexpected Error code");
570  } // switch
571 }
572 
573 ze_result_t ZeCall::doCall(ze_result_t ZeResult, const char *ZeName,
574  const char *ZeArgs, bool TraceError) {
575  zePrint("ZE ---> %s%s\n", ZeName, ZeArgs);
576 
577  if (ZeDebug & ZE_DEBUG_CALL_COUNT) {
578  ++(*ZeCallCount)[ZeName];
579  }
580 
581  if (ZeResult && TraceError) {
582  const char *ErrorString = "Unknown";
583  zeParseError(ZeResult, ErrorString);
584  zePrint("Error (%s) in %s\n", ErrorString, ZeName);
585  }
586  return ZeResult;
587 }
588 
589 #define PI_ASSERT(condition, error) \
590  if (!(condition)) \
591  return error;
592 
593 // This helper function increments the reference counter of the Queue
594 // without guarding with a lock.
595 // It is the caller's responsibility to make sure the lock is acquired
596 // on the Queue that is passed in.
597 inline static void piQueueRetainNoLock(pi_queue Queue) { Queue->RefCount++; }
598 
599 // This helper function creates a pi_event and associate a pi_queue.
600 // Note that the caller of this function must have acquired lock on the Queue
601 // that is passed in.
602 // \param Queue pi_queue to associate with a new event.
603 // \param Event a pointer to hold the newly created pi_event
604 // \param CommandType various command type determined by the caller
605 // \param CommandList is the command list where the event is added
606 // \param ForceHostVisible tells if the event must be created in
607 // the host-visible pool
608 inline static pi_result createEventAndAssociateQueue(
609  pi_queue Queue, pi_event *Event, pi_command_type CommandType,
610  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList, bool ForceHostVisible = false) {
611 
612  PI_CALL(EventCreate(Queue->Context, Queue,
613  ForceHostVisible ? true : EventsScope == AllHostVisible,
614  Event));
615 
616  (*Event)->Queue = Queue;
617  (*Event)->CommandType = CommandType;
618 
619  // Append this Event to the CommandList, if any
620  if (CommandList != Queue->CommandListMap.end()) {
621  (*Event)->ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
622  CommandList->second.append(*Event);
623  PI_CALL(piEventRetain(*Event));
624  } else {
625  (*Event)->ZeCommandList = nullptr;
626  }
627 
628  // We need to increment the reference counter here to avoid pi_queue
629  // being released before the associated pi_event is released because
630  // piEventRelease requires access to the associated pi_queue.
631  // In piEventRelease, the reference counter of the Queue is decremented
632  // to release it.
633  piQueueRetainNoLock(Queue);
634 
635  // SYCL RT does not track completion of the events, so it could
636  // release a PI event as soon as that's not being waited in the app.
637  // But we have to ensure that the event is not destroyed before
638  // it is really signalled, so retain it explicitly here and
639  // release in Event->cleanup().
640  //
641  PI_CALL(piEventRetain(*Event));
642 
643  return PI_SUCCESS;
644 }
645 
646 pi_result _pi_device::initialize(int SubSubDeviceOrdinal,
647  int SubSubDeviceIndex) {
648  uint32_t numQueueGroups = 0;
649  ZE_CALL(zeDeviceGetCommandQueueGroupProperties,
650  (ZeDevice, &numQueueGroups, nullptr));
651  if (numQueueGroups == 0) {
652  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
653  }
654  zePrint("NOTE: Number of queue groups = %d\n", numQueueGroups);
655  std::vector<ZeStruct<ze_command_queue_group_properties_t>>
656  QueueGroupProperties(numQueueGroups);
657  ZE_CALL(zeDeviceGetCommandQueueGroupProperties,
658  (ZeDevice, &numQueueGroups, QueueGroupProperties.data()));
659 
660  // Initialize a sub-sub-device with its own ordinal and index
661  if (SubSubDeviceOrdinal >= 0) {
662  QueueGroup[queue_group_info_t::Compute].ZeOrdinal = SubSubDeviceOrdinal;
663  QueueGroup[queue_group_info_t::Compute].ZeIndex = SubSubDeviceIndex;
664  } else { // This is a root or a sub-device
665  for (uint32_t i = 0; i < numQueueGroups; i++) {
666  if (QueueGroupProperties[i].flags &
667  ZE_COMMAND_QUEUE_GROUP_PROPERTY_FLAG_COMPUTE) {
668  QueueGroup[queue_group_info_t::Compute].ZeOrdinal = i;
669  QueueGroup[queue_group_info_t::Compute].ZeProperties =
670  QueueGroupProperties[i];
671  break;
672  }
673  }
674  // How is it possible that there are no "compute" capabilities?
675  if (QueueGroup[queue_group_info_t::Compute].ZeOrdinal < 0) {
676  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
677  }
678 
679  if (CopyEngineRequested) {
680  for (uint32_t i = 0; i < numQueueGroups; i++) {
681  if (((QueueGroupProperties[i].flags &
682  ZE_COMMAND_QUEUE_GROUP_PROPERTY_FLAG_COMPUTE) == 0) &&
683  (QueueGroupProperties[i].flags &
684  ZE_COMMAND_QUEUE_GROUP_PROPERTY_FLAG_COPY)) {
685  if (QueueGroupProperties[i].numQueues == 1) {
686  QueueGroup[queue_group_info_t::MainCopy].ZeOrdinal = i;
687  QueueGroup[queue_group_info_t::MainCopy].ZeProperties =
688  QueueGroupProperties[i];
689  } else {
690  QueueGroup[queue_group_info_t::LinkCopy].ZeOrdinal = i;
691  QueueGroup[queue_group_info_t::LinkCopy].ZeProperties =
692  QueueGroupProperties[i];
693  break;
694  }
695  }
696  }
697  if (QueueGroup[queue_group_info_t::MainCopy].ZeOrdinal < 0)
698  zePrint("NOTE: main blitter/copy engine is not available\n");
699  else
700  zePrint("NOTE: main blitter/copy engine is available\n");
701 
702  if (QueueGroup[queue_group_info_t::LinkCopy].ZeOrdinal < 0)
703  zePrint("NOTE: link blitter/copy engines are not available\n");
704  else
705  zePrint("NOTE: link blitter/copy engines are available\n");
706  }
707  }
708 
709  // Maintain various device properties cache.
710  // Note that we just describe here how to compute the data.
711  // The real initialization is upon first access.
712  //
713  auto ZeDevice = this->ZeDevice;
714  ZeDeviceProperties.Compute = [ZeDevice](ze_device_properties_t &Properties) {
715  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeDeviceGetProperties, (ZeDevice, &Properties));
716  };
717 
718  ZeDeviceComputeProperties.Compute =
719  [ZeDevice](ze_device_compute_properties_t &Properties) {
720  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeDeviceGetComputeProperties, (ZeDevice, &Properties));
721  };
722 
723  ZeDeviceImageProperties.Compute =
724  [ZeDevice](ze_device_image_properties_t &Properties) {
725  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeDeviceGetImageProperties, (ZeDevice, &Properties));
726  };
727 
728  ZeDeviceModuleProperties.Compute =
729  [ZeDevice](ze_device_module_properties_t &Properties) {
730  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeDeviceGetModuleProperties, (ZeDevice, &Properties));
731  };
732 
733  ZeDeviceMemoryProperties.Compute =
734  [ZeDevice](
735  std::vector<ZeStruct<ze_device_memory_properties_t>> &Properties) {
736  uint32_t Count = 0;
737  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeDeviceGetMemoryProperties,
738  (ZeDevice, &Count, nullptr));
739 
740  Properties.resize(Count);
741  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeDeviceGetMemoryProperties,
742  (ZeDevice, &Count, Properties.data()));
743  };
744 
745  ZeDeviceMemoryAccessProperties.Compute =
746  [ZeDevice](ze_device_memory_access_properties_t &Properties) {
747  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeDeviceGetMemoryAccessProperties,
748  (ZeDevice, &Properties));
749  };
750 
751  ZeDeviceCacheProperties.Compute =
752  [ZeDevice](ze_device_cache_properties_t &Properties) {
753  // TODO: Since v1.0 there can be multiple cache properties.
754  // For now remember the first one, if any.
755  uint32_t Count = 0;
756  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeDeviceGetCacheProperties,
757  (ZeDevice, &Count, nullptr));
758  if (Count > 0)
759  Count = 1;
760  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeDeviceGetCacheProperties,
761  (ZeDevice, &Count, &Properties));
762  };
763  return PI_SUCCESS;
764 }
765 
766 pi_result _pi_context::initialize() {
767  // Create the immediate command list to be used for initializations
768  // Created as synchronous so level-zero performs implicit synchronization and
769  // there is no need to query for completion in the plugin
770  //
771  // TODO: get rid of using Devices[0] for the context with multiple
772  // root-devices. We should somehow make the data initialized on all devices.
773  pi_device Device = SingleRootDevice ? SingleRootDevice : Devices[0];
774 
775  // NOTE: we always submit to the "0" index compute engine with immediate
776  // command list since this is one for context.
777  ZeStruct<ze_command_queue_desc_t> ZeCommandQueueDesc;
778  ZeCommandQueueDesc.ordinal =
779  Device->QueueGroup[_pi_device::queue_group_info_t::Compute].ZeOrdinal;
780  ZeCommandQueueDesc.index = 0;
781  ZeCommandQueueDesc.mode = ZE_COMMAND_QUEUE_MODE_SYNCHRONOUS;
782  ZE_CALL(
783  zeCommandListCreateImmediate,
784  (ZeContext, Device->ZeDevice, &ZeCommandQueueDesc, &ZeCommandListInit));
785  return PI_SUCCESS;
786 }
787 
788 pi_result _pi_context::finalize() {
789  // This function is called when pi_context is deallocated, piContextRelease.
790  // There could be some memory that may have not been deallocated.
791  // For example, event pool caches would be still alive.
792  {
793  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> Lock(ZeEventPoolCacheMutex);
794  for (auto &ZePoolCache : ZeEventPoolCache) {
795  for (auto &ZePool : ZePoolCache)
796  ZE_CALL(zeEventPoolDestroy, (ZePool));
797  ZePoolCache.clear();
798  }
799  }
800 
801  // Destroy the command list used for initializations
802  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListDestroy, (ZeCommandListInit));
803 
804  // Adjust the number of command lists created on this platform.
805  auto Platform = Devices[0]->Platform;
806 
807  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> Lock(ZeCommandListCacheMutex);
808  for (auto &List : ZeComputeCommandListCache) {
809  for (ze_command_list_handle_t &ZeCommandList : List.second) {
810  if (ZeCommandList)
811  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListDestroy, (ZeCommandList));
812  }
813  Platform->ZeGlobalCommandListCount -= List.second.size();
814  }
815  for (auto &List : ZeCopyCommandListCache) {
816  for (ze_command_list_handle_t &ZeCommandList : List.second) {
817  if (ZeCommandList)
818  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListDestroy, (ZeCommandList));
819  }
820  Platform->ZeGlobalCommandListCount -= List.second.size();
821  }
822  return PI_SUCCESS;
823 }
824 
825 bool pi_command_list_info_t::isCopy(pi_queue Queue) const {
826  return ZeQueueGroupOrdinal !=
827  (uint32_t)Queue->Device
828  ->QueueGroup[_pi_device::queue_group_info_t::type::Compute]
829  .ZeOrdinal;
830 }
831 
832 bool _pi_queue::isInOrderQueue() const {
833  // If out-of-order queue property is not set, then this is a in-order queue.
834  return ((this->Properties & PI_QUEUE_OUT_OF_ORDER_EXEC_MODE_ENABLE) == 0);
835 }
836 
837 pi_result _pi_queue::resetCommandList(pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList,
838  bool MakeAvailable) {
839  bool UseCopyEngine = CommandList->second.isCopy(this);
840  auto &ZeCommandListCache =
841  UseCopyEngine
842  ? this->Context->ZeCopyCommandListCache[this->Device->ZeDevice]
843  : this->Context->ZeComputeCommandListCache[this->Device->ZeDevice];
844 
845  // Fence had been signalled meaning the associated command-list completed.
846  // Reset the fence and put the command list into a cache for reuse in PI
847  // calls.
848  ZE_CALL(zeFenceReset, (CommandList->second.ZeFence));
849  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListReset, (CommandList->first));
850  CommandList->second.InUse = false;
851 
852  // Finally release/cleanup all the events in this command list.
853  // Note, we don't need to synchronize the events since the fence
854  // synchronized above already does that.
855  auto &EventList = CommandList->second.EventList;
856  for (auto &Event : EventList) {
857  Event->Completed = true;
858  // All events in this loop are in the same command list which has been just
859  // reset above. We don't want cleanup() to reset same command list again for
860  // all events in the loop so set it to nullptr.
861  Event->ZeCommandList = nullptr;
862  if (!Event->CleanedUp) {
863  Event->cleanup(this);
864  }
865  PI_CALL(EventRelease(Event, this));
866  }
867  EventList.clear();
868 
869  if (MakeAvailable) {
870  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(this->Context->ZeCommandListCacheMutex);
871  ZeCommandListCache.push_back(CommandList->first);
872  }
873 
874  return PI_SUCCESS;
875 }
876 
877 // Maximum Number of Command Lists that can be created.
878 // This Value is initialized to 20000, but can be changed by the user
879 // thru the environment variable SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_MAX_COMMAND_LIST_CACHE
880 // ie SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_MAX_COMMAND_LIST_CACHE =10000.
881 static const int ZeMaxCommandListCacheSize = [] {
882  const char *CommandListCacheSize =
883  std::getenv("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_MAX_COMMAND_LIST_CACHE");
884  pi_uint32 CommandListCacheSizeValue;
885  try {
886  CommandListCacheSizeValue =
887  CommandListCacheSize ? std::stoi(CommandListCacheSize) : 20000;
888  } catch (std::exception const &) {
889  zePrint(
890  "SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_MAX_COMMAND_LIST_CACHE: invalid value provided, "
891  "default set.\n");
892  CommandListCacheSizeValue = 20000;
893  }
894  return CommandListCacheSizeValue;
895 }();
896 
897 // Configuration of the command-list batching.
898 typedef struct CommandListBatchConfig {
899  // Default value of 0. This specifies to use dynamic batch size adjustment.
900  // Other values will try to collect specified amount of commands.
901  pi_uint32 Size{0};
902 
903  // If doing dynamic batching, specifies start batch size.
904  pi_uint32 DynamicSizeStart{4};
905 
906  // The maximum size for dynamic batch.
907  pi_uint32 DynamicSizeMax{64};
908 
909  // The step size for dynamic batch increases.
910  pi_uint32 DynamicSizeStep{1};
911 
912  // Thresholds for when increase batch size (number of closed early is small
913  // and number of closed full is high).
914  pi_uint32 NumTimesClosedEarlyThreshold{2};
915  pi_uint32 NumTimesClosedFullThreshold{10};
916 
917  // Tells the starting size of a batch.
918  pi_uint32 startSize() const { return Size > 0 ? Size : DynamicSizeStart; }
919  // Tells is we are doing dynamic batch size adjustment.
920  bool dynamic() const { return Size == 0; }
921 } zeCommandListBatchConfig;
922 
923 // Helper function to initialize static variables that holds batch config info
924 // for compute and copy command batching.
925 static const zeCommandListBatchConfig ZeCommandListBatchConfig(bool IsCopy) {
926  zeCommandListBatchConfig Config{}; // default initialize
927 
928  // Default value of 0. This specifies to use dynamic batch size adjustment.
929  const auto BatchSizeStr =
930  (IsCopy) ? std::getenv("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_COPY_BATCH_SIZE")
931  : std::getenv("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_BATCH_SIZE");
932  if (BatchSizeStr) {
933  pi_int32 BatchSizeStrVal = std::atoi(BatchSizeStr);
934  // Level Zero may only support a limted number of commands per command
935  // list. The actual upper limit is not specified by the Level Zero
936  // Specification. For now we allow an arbitrary upper limit.
937  if (BatchSizeStrVal > 0) {
938  Config.Size = BatchSizeStrVal;
939  } else if (BatchSizeStrVal == 0) {
940  Config.Size = 0;
941  // We are requested to do dynamic batching. Collect specifics, if any.
942  // The extended format supported is ":" separated values.
943  //
944  // NOTE: these extra settings are experimental and are intended to
945  // be used only for finding a better default heuristic.
946  //
947  std::string BatchConfig(BatchSizeStr);
948  size_t Ord = 0;
949  size_t Pos = 0;
950  while (true) {
951  if (++Ord > 5)
952  break;
953 
954  Pos = BatchConfig.find(":", Pos);
955  if (Pos == std::string::npos)
956  break;
957  ++Pos; // past the ":"
958 
959  pi_uint32 Val;
960  try {
961  Val = std::stoi(BatchConfig.substr(Pos));
962  } catch (...) {
963  if (IsCopy)
964  zePrint(
965  "SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_COPY_BATCH_SIZE: failed to parse value\n");
966  else
967  zePrint("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_BATCH_SIZE: failed to parse value\n");
968  break;
969  }
970  switch (Ord) {
971  case 1:
972  Config.DynamicSizeStart = Val;
973  break;
974  case 2:
975  Config.DynamicSizeMax = Val;
976  break;
977  case 3:
978  Config.DynamicSizeStep = Val;
979  break;
980  case 4:
981  Config.NumTimesClosedEarlyThreshold = Val;
982  break;
983  case 5:
984  Config.NumTimesClosedFullThreshold = Val;
985  break;
986  default:
987  die("Unexpected batch config");
988  }
989  if (IsCopy)
990  zePrint("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_COPY_BATCH_SIZE: dynamic batch param "
991  "#%d: %d\n",
992  (int)Ord, (int)Val);
993  else
994  zePrint(
995  "SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_BATCH_SIZE: dynamic batch param #%d: %d\n",
996  (int)Ord, (int)Val);
997  };
998 
999  } else {
1000  // Negative batch sizes are silently ignored.
1001  if (IsCopy)
1002  zePrint("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_COPY_BATCH_SIZE: ignored negative value\n");
1003  else
1004  zePrint("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_BATCH_SIZE: ignored negative value\n");
1005  }
1006  }
1007  return Config;
1008 }
1009 
1010 // Static variable that holds batch config info for compute command batching.
1011 static const zeCommandListBatchConfig ZeCommandListBatchComputeConfig = [] {
1012  using IsCopy = bool;
1013  return ZeCommandListBatchConfig(IsCopy{false});
1014 }();
1015 
1016 // Static variable that holds batch config info for copy command batching.
1017 static const zeCommandListBatchConfig ZeCommandListBatchCopyConfig = [] {
1018  using IsCopy = bool;
1019  return ZeCommandListBatchConfig(IsCopy{true});
1020 }();
1021 
1022 _pi_queue::_pi_queue(std::vector<ze_command_queue_handle_t> &ComputeQueues,
1023  std::vector<ze_command_queue_handle_t> &CopyQueues,
1024  pi_context Context, pi_device Device,
1025  bool OwnZeCommandQueue,
1026  pi_queue_properties PiQueueProperties)
1027  : Context{Context}, Device{Device}, OwnZeCommandQueue{OwnZeCommandQueue},
1028  Properties(PiQueueProperties) {
1029 
1030  // Compute group initialization.
1031  // First, see if the queue's device allows for round-robin or it is
1032  // fixed to one particular compute CCS (it is so for sub-sub-devices).
1033  auto &ComputeQueueGroupInfo = Device->QueueGroup[queue_type::Compute];
1034  if (ComputeQueueGroupInfo.ZeIndex >= 0) {
1035  ComputeQueueGroup.LowerIndex = ComputeQueueGroupInfo.ZeIndex;
1036  ComputeQueueGroup.UpperIndex = ComputeQueueGroupInfo.ZeIndex;
1037  ComputeQueueGroup.NextIndex = ComputeQueueGroupInfo.ZeIndex;
1038  } else {
1039  ComputeQueueGroup.LowerIndex = 0;
1040  ComputeQueueGroup.UpperIndex = INT_MAX;
1041  ComputeQueueGroup.NextIndex = 0;
1042  }
1043 
1044  uint32_t FilterLowerIndex = getRangeOfAllowedComputeEngines.first;
1045  uint32_t FilterUpperIndex = getRangeOfAllowedComputeEngines.second;
1046  FilterUpperIndex =
1047  std::min((size_t)FilterUpperIndex, ComputeQueues.size() - 1);
1048  if (FilterLowerIndex <= FilterUpperIndex) {
1049  ComputeQueueGroup.ZeQueues = ComputeQueues;
1050  ComputeQueueGroup.LowerIndex = FilterLowerIndex;
1051  ComputeQueueGroup.UpperIndex = FilterUpperIndex;
1052  ComputeQueueGroup.NextIndex = ComputeQueueGroup.LowerIndex;
1053  } else {
1054  die("No compute queue available.");
1055  }
1056 
1057  // Copy group initialization.
1058  if (getRangeOfAllowedCopyEngines.first < 0 ||
1059  getRangeOfAllowedCopyEngines.second < 0) {
1060  // We are asked not to use copy engines, just do nothing.
1061  // Leave CopyQueueGroup.ZeQueues empty, and it won't be used.
1062  } else {
1063  uint32_t FilterLowerIndex = getRangeOfAllowedCopyEngines.first;
1064  uint32_t FilterUpperIndex = getRangeOfAllowedCopyEngines.second;
1065  FilterUpperIndex =
1066  std::min((size_t)FilterUpperIndex, CopyQueues.size() - 1);
1067  if (FilterLowerIndex <= FilterUpperIndex) {
1068  CopyQueueGroup.ZeQueues = CopyQueues;
1069  CopyQueueGroup.LowerIndex = FilterLowerIndex;
1070  CopyQueueGroup.UpperIndex = FilterUpperIndex;
1071  CopyQueueGroup.NextIndex = CopyQueueGroup.LowerIndex;
1072  }
1073  }
1074 
1075  // Initialize compute/copy command batches.
1076  ComputeCommandBatch.OpenCommandList = CommandListMap.end();
1077  CopyCommandBatch.OpenCommandList = CommandListMap.end();
1078  ComputeCommandBatch.QueueBatchSize =
1079  ZeCommandListBatchComputeConfig.startSize();
1080  CopyCommandBatch.QueueBatchSize = ZeCommandListBatchCopyConfig.startSize();
1081 }
1082 
1083 // Retrieve an available command list to be used in a PI call
1084 // Caller must hold a lock on the Queue passed in.
1085 pi_result
1086 _pi_context::getAvailableCommandList(pi_queue Queue,
1087  pi_command_list_ptr_t &CommandList,
1088  bool UseCopyEngine, bool AllowBatching) {
1089  auto &CommandBatch =
1090  UseCopyEngine ? Queue->CopyCommandBatch : Queue->ComputeCommandBatch;
1091  // Handle batching of commands
1092  // First see if there is an command-list open for batching commands
1093  // for this queue.
1094  if (Queue->hasOpenCommandList(UseCopyEngine)) {
1095  if (AllowBatching) {
1096  CommandList = CommandBatch.OpenCommandList;
1097  return PI_SUCCESS;
1098  }
1099  // If this command isn't allowed to be batched, then we need to
1100  // go ahead and execute what is already in the batched list,
1101  // and then go on to process this. On exit from executeOpenCommandList
1102  // OpenCommandList will be invalidated.
1103  if (auto Res = Queue->executeOpenCommandList(UseCopyEngine))
1104  return Res;
1105  }
1106 
1107  // Create/Reuse the command list, because in Level Zero commands are added to
1108  // the command lists, and later are then added to the command queue.
1109  // Each command list is paired with an associated fence to track when the
1110  // command list is available for reuse.
1111  _pi_result pi_result = PI_OUT_OF_RESOURCES;
1112  ZeStruct<ze_fence_desc_t> ZeFenceDesc;
1113  // Initally, we need to check if a command list has already been created
1114  // on this device that is available for use. If so, then reuse that
1115  // Level-Zero Command List and Fence for this PI call.
1116  {
1117  // Make sure to acquire the lock before checking the size, or there
1118  // will be a race condition.
1119  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(Queue->Context->ZeCommandListCacheMutex);
1120  // Under mutex since operator[] does insertion on the first usage for every
1121  // unique ZeDevice.
1122  auto &ZeCommandListCache =
1123  UseCopyEngine
1124  ? Queue->Context->ZeCopyCommandListCache[Queue->Device->ZeDevice]
1125  : Queue->Context
1126  ->ZeComputeCommandListCache[Queue->Device->ZeDevice];
1127 
1128  if (ZeCommandListCache.size() > 0) {
1129  auto &ZeCommandList = ZeCommandListCache.front();
1130  auto it = Queue->CommandListMap.find(ZeCommandList);
1131  if (it != Queue->CommandListMap.end()) {
1132  CommandList = it;
1133  CommandList->second.InUse = true;
1134  } else {
1135  // If there is a command list available on this context, but it
1136  // wasn't yet used in this queue then create a new entry in this
1137  // queue's map to hold the fence and other associated command
1138  // list information.
1139  uint32_t QueueGroupOrdinal;
1140  auto &ZeCommandQueue =
1141  Queue->getQueueGroup(UseCopyEngine).getZeQueue(&QueueGroupOrdinal);
1142 
1143  ze_fence_handle_t ZeFence;
1144  ZE_CALL(zeFenceCreate, (ZeCommandQueue, &ZeFenceDesc, &ZeFence));
1145  CommandList =
1146  Queue->CommandListMap
1147  .emplace(ZeCommandList,
1148  pi_command_list_info_t{ZeFence, true, ZeCommandQueue,
1149  QueueGroupOrdinal})
1150  .first;
1151  }
1152  ZeCommandListCache.pop_front();
1153  return PI_SUCCESS;
1154  }
1155  }
1156 
1157  // If there are no available command lists in the cache, then we check for
1158  // command lists that have already signalled, but have not been added to the
1159  // available list yet. Each command list has a fence associated which tracks
1160  // if a command list has completed dispatch of its commands and is ready for
1161  // reuse. If a command list is found to have been signalled, then the
1162  // command list & fence are reset and we return.
1163  for (auto it = Queue->CommandListMap.begin();
1164  it != Queue->CommandListMap.end(); ++it) {
1165  // Make sure this is the command list type needed.
1166  if (UseCopyEngine != it->second.isCopy(Queue))
1167  continue;
1168 
1169  ze_result_t ZeResult =
1170  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeFenceQueryStatus, (it->second.ZeFence));
1171  if (ZeResult == ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS) {
1172  Queue->resetCommandList(it, false);
1173  CommandList = it;
1174  CommandList->second.InUse = true;
1175  return PI_SUCCESS;
1176  }
1177  }
1178 
1179  // If there are no available command lists nor signalled command lists, then
1180  // we must create another command list if we have not exceed the maximum
1181  // command lists we can create.
1182  // Once created, this command list & fence are added to the command list fence
1183  // map.
1184  if (Queue->Device->Platform->ZeGlobalCommandListCount <
1185  ZeMaxCommandListCacheSize) {
1186  ze_command_list_handle_t ZeCommandList;
1187  ze_fence_handle_t ZeFence;
1188 
1189  uint32_t QueueGroupOrdinal;
1190  auto &ZeCommandQueue =
1191  Queue->getQueueGroup(UseCopyEngine).getZeQueue(&QueueGroupOrdinal);
1192 
1193  ZeStruct<ze_command_list_desc_t> ZeCommandListDesc;
1194  ZeCommandListDesc.commandQueueGroupOrdinal = QueueGroupOrdinal;
1195 
1196  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListCreate,
1197  (Queue->Context->ZeContext, Queue->Device->ZeDevice,
1198  &ZeCommandListDesc, &ZeCommandList));
1199  // Increments the total number of command lists created on this platform.
1200  Queue->Device->Platform->ZeGlobalCommandListCount++;
1201 
1202  ZE_CALL(zeFenceCreate, (ZeCommandQueue, &ZeFenceDesc, &ZeFence));
1203  std::tie(CommandList, std::ignore) = Queue->CommandListMap.insert(
1204  std::pair<ze_command_list_handle_t, pi_command_list_info_t>(
1205  ZeCommandList, {ZeFence, true, ZeCommandQueue, QueueGroupOrdinal}));
1206  pi_result = PI_SUCCESS;
1207  }
1208 
1209  return pi_result;
1210 }
1211 
1212 void _pi_queue::adjustBatchSizeForFullBatch(bool IsCopy) {
1213  auto &CommandBatch = IsCopy ? CopyCommandBatch : ComputeCommandBatch;
1214  auto &ZeCommandListBatchConfig =
1215  IsCopy ? ZeCommandListBatchCopyConfig : ZeCommandListBatchComputeConfig;
1216  pi_uint32 &QueueBatchSize = CommandBatch.QueueBatchSize;
1217  // QueueBatchSize of 0 means never allow batching.
1218  if (QueueBatchSize == 0 || !ZeCommandListBatchConfig.dynamic())
1219  return;
1220  CommandBatch.NumTimesClosedFull += 1;
1221 
1222  // If the number of times the list has been closed early is low, and
1223  // the number of times it has been closed full is high, then raise
1224  // the batching size slowly. Don't raise it if it is already pretty
1225  // high.
1226  if (CommandBatch.NumTimesClosedEarly <=
1227  ZeCommandListBatchConfig.NumTimesClosedEarlyThreshold &&
1228  CommandBatch.NumTimesClosedFull >
1229  ZeCommandListBatchConfig.NumTimesClosedFullThreshold) {
1230  if (QueueBatchSize < ZeCommandListBatchConfig.DynamicSizeMax) {
1231  QueueBatchSize += ZeCommandListBatchConfig.DynamicSizeStep;
1232  zePrint("Raising QueueBatchSize to %d\n", QueueBatchSize);
1233  }
1234  CommandBatch.NumTimesClosedEarly = 0;
1235  CommandBatch.NumTimesClosedFull = 0;
1236  }
1237 }
1238 
1239 void _pi_queue::adjustBatchSizeForPartialBatch(bool IsCopy) {
1240  auto &CommandBatch = IsCopy ? CopyCommandBatch : ComputeCommandBatch;
1241  auto &ZeCommandListBatchConfig =
1242  IsCopy ? ZeCommandListBatchCopyConfig : ZeCommandListBatchComputeConfig;
1243  pi_uint32 &QueueBatchSize = CommandBatch.QueueBatchSize;
1244  // QueueBatchSize of 0 means never allow batching.
1245  if (QueueBatchSize == 0 || !ZeCommandListBatchConfig.dynamic())
1246  return;
1247  CommandBatch.NumTimesClosedEarly += 1;
1248 
1249  // If we are closing early more than about 3x the number of times
1250  // it is closing full, lower the batch size to the value of the
1251  // current open command list. This is trying to quickly get to a
1252  // batch size that will be able to be closed full at least once
1253  // in a while.
1254  if (CommandBatch.NumTimesClosedEarly >
1255  (CommandBatch.NumTimesClosedFull + 1) * 3) {
1256  QueueBatchSize = CommandBatch.OpenCommandList->second.size() - 1;
1257  if (QueueBatchSize < 1)
1258  QueueBatchSize = 1;
1259  zePrint("Lowering QueueBatchSize to %d\n", QueueBatchSize);
1260  CommandBatch.NumTimesClosedEarly = 0;
1261  CommandBatch.NumTimesClosedFull = 0;
1262  }
1263 }
1264 
1265 pi_result _pi_queue::executeCommandList(pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList,
1266  bool IsBlocking,
1267  bool OKToBatchCommand) {
1268  bool UseCopyEngine = CommandList->second.isCopy(this);
1269 
1270  // If the current LastCommandEvent is the nullptr, then it means
1271  // either that no command has ever been issued to the queue
1272  // or it means that the LastCommandEvent has been signalled and
1273  // therefore that this Queue is idle.
1274  //
1275  // NOTE: this behavior adds some flakyness to the batching
1276  // since last command's event may or may not be completed by the
1277  // time we get here depending on timings and system/gpu load.
1278  // So, disable it for modes where we print PI traces. Printing
1279  // traces incurs much different timings than real execution
1280  // ansyway, and many regression tests use it.
1281  //
1282  bool CurrentlyEmpty = !PrintPiTrace && this->LastCommandEvent == nullptr;
1283 
1284  // The list can be empty if command-list only contains signals of proxy
1285  // events.
1286  if (!CommandList->second.EventList.empty())
1287  this->LastCommandEvent = CommandList->second.EventList.back();
1288 
1289  // Batch if allowed to, but don't batch if we know there are no kernels
1290  // from this queue that are currently executing. This is intended to get
1291  // kernels started as soon as possible when there are no kernels from this
1292  // queue awaiting execution, while allowing batching to occur when there
1293  // are kernels already executing. Also, if we are using fixed size batching,
1294  // as indicated by !ZeCommandListBatch.dynamic(), then just ignore
1295  // CurrentlyEmpty as we want to strictly follow the batching the user
1296  // specified.
1297  auto &CommandBatch = UseCopyEngine ? CopyCommandBatch : ComputeCommandBatch;
1298  auto &ZeCommandListBatchConfig = UseCopyEngine
1299  ? ZeCommandListBatchCopyConfig
1300  : ZeCommandListBatchComputeConfig;
1301  if (OKToBatchCommand && this->isBatchingAllowed(UseCopyEngine) &&
1302  (!ZeCommandListBatchConfig.dynamic() || !CurrentlyEmpty)) {
1303 
1304  if (hasOpenCommandList(UseCopyEngine) &&
1305  CommandBatch.OpenCommandList != CommandList)
1306  die("executeCommandList: OpenCommandList should be equal to"
1307  "null or CommandList");
1308 
1309  if (CommandList->second.size() < CommandBatch.QueueBatchSize) {
1310  CommandBatch.OpenCommandList = CommandList;
1311  return PI_SUCCESS;
1312  }
1313 
1314  adjustBatchSizeForFullBatch(UseCopyEngine);
1315  CommandBatch.OpenCommandList = CommandListMap.end();
1316  }
1317 
1318  auto &ZeCommandQueue = CommandList->second.ZeQueue;
1319  // Scope of the lock must be till the end of the function, otherwise new mem
1320  // allocs can be created between the moment when we made a snapshot and the
1321  // moment when command list is closed and executed. But mutex is locked only
1322  // if indirect access tracking enabled, because std::defer_lock is used.
1323  // unique_lock destructor at the end of the function will unlock the mutex if
1324  // it was locked (which happens only if IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled is
1325  // true).
1326  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> ContextsLock(Device->Platform->ContextsMutex,
1327  std::defer_lock);
1328  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
1329  // We are going to submit kernels for execution. If indirect access flag is
1330  // set for a kernel then we need to make a snapshot of existing memory
1331  // allocations in all contexts in the platform. We need to lock the mutex
1332  // guarding the list of contexts in the platform to prevent creation of new
1333  // memory alocations in any context before we submit the kernel for
1334  // execution.
1335  ContextsLock.lock();
1336  for (auto &Kernel : KernelsToBeSubmitted) {
1337  if (!Kernel->hasIndirectAccess())
1338  continue;
1339 
1340  auto &Contexts = Device->Platform->Contexts;
1341  for (auto &Ctx : Contexts) {
1342  for (auto &Elem : Ctx->MemAllocs) {
1343  const auto &Pair = Kernel->MemAllocs.insert(&Elem);
1344  // Kernel is referencing this memory allocation from now.
1345  // If this memory allocation was already captured for this kernel, it
1346  // means that kernel is submitted several times. Increase reference
1347  // count only once because we release all allocations only when
1348  // SubmissionsCount turns to 0. We don't want to know how many times
1349  // allocation was retained by each submission.
1350  if (Pair.second)
1351  Elem.second.RefCount++;
1352  }
1353  }
1354  Kernel->SubmissionsCount++;
1355  }
1356  KernelsToBeSubmitted.clear();
1357  }
1358 
1359  // In this mode all inner-batch events have device visibility only,
1360  // and we want the last command in the batch to signal a host-visible
1361  // event that anybody waiting for any event in the batch will
1362  // really be using.
1363  //
1364  if (EventsScope == LastCommandInBatchHostVisible) {
1365  // Create a "proxy" host-visible event.
1366  //
1367  pi_event HostVisibleEvent;
1368  auto Res = createEventAndAssociateQueue(
1369  this, &HostVisibleEvent, PI_COMMAND_TYPE_USER, CommandList, true);
1370  if (Res)
1371  return Res;
1372 
1373  // Update each command's event in the command-list to "see" this
1374  // proxy event as a host-visible counterpart.
1375  for (auto &Event : CommandList->second.EventList) {
1376  if (!Event->HostVisibleEvent) {
1377  Event->HostVisibleEvent = HostVisibleEvent;
1378  PI_CALL(piEventRetain(HostVisibleEvent));
1379  }
1380  }
1381 
1382  // Decrement the reference count of the event such that all the remaining
1383  // references are from the other commands in this batch and from the
1384  // command-list itself. This host-visible event will not be waited/released
1385  // by SYCL RT, so it must be destroyed after all events in the batch are
1386  // gone.
1387  PI_CALL(piEventRelease(HostVisibleEvent));
1388  PI_CALL(piEventRelease(HostVisibleEvent));
1389 
1390  // Indicate no cleanup is needed for this PI event as it is special.
1391  HostVisibleEvent->CleanedUp = true;
1392 
1393  // Finally set to signal the host-visible event at the end of the
1394  // command-list.
1395  // TODO: see if we need a barrier here (or explicit wait for all events in
1396  // the batch).
1397  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendSignalEvent,
1398  (CommandList->first, HostVisibleEvent->ZeEvent));
1399  }
1400 
1401  // Close the command list and have it ready for dispatch.
1402  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListClose, (CommandList->first));
1403  // Offload command list to the GPU for asynchronous execution
1404  auto ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
1405  auto ZeResult = ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(
1406  zeCommandQueueExecuteCommandLists,
1407  (ZeCommandQueue, 1, &ZeCommandList, CommandList->second.ZeFence));
1408  if (ZeResult != ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS) {
1409  this->Healthy = false;
1410  if (ZeResult == ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNKNOWN) {
1411  // Turn into a more informative end-user error.
1412  return PI_COMMAND_EXECUTION_FAILURE;
1413  }
1414  return mapError(ZeResult);
1415  }
1416 
1417  // Check global control to make every command blocking for debugging.
1418  if (IsBlocking || (ZeSerialize & ZeSerializeBlock) != 0) {
1419  // Wait until command lists attached to the command queue are executed.
1420  ZE_CALL(zeHostSynchronize, (ZeCommandQueue));
1421  }
1422  return PI_SUCCESS;
1423 }
1424 
1425 bool _pi_queue::isBatchingAllowed(bool IsCopy) const {
1426  auto &CommandBatch = IsCopy ? CopyCommandBatch : ComputeCommandBatch;
1427  return (CommandBatch.QueueBatchSize > 0 &&
1428  ((ZeSerialize & ZeSerializeBlock) == 0));
1429 }
1430 
1431 // This function will return one of possibly multiple available native queues.
1432 // Currently, a round robin strategy is used.
1433 // This function also sends back the value of the queue group ordinal.
1434 ze_command_queue_handle_t &
1435 _pi_queue::pi_queue_group_t::getZeQueue(uint32_t *QueueGroupOrdinal) {
1436 
1437  auto CurrentIndex = NextIndex;
1438  ++NextIndex;
1439  if (NextIndex > UpperIndex)
1440  NextIndex = LowerIndex;
1441 
1442  // Find out the right queue group ordinal (first queue might be "main" or
1443  // "link")
1444  auto QueueType = Type;
1445  if (QueueType != queue_type::Compute)
1446  QueueType = (CurrentIndex == 0 && Queue->Device->hasMainCopyEngine())
1447  ? queue_type::MainCopy
1448  : queue_type::LinkCopy;
1449 
1450  *QueueGroupOrdinal = Queue->Device->QueueGroup[QueueType].ZeOrdinal;
1451 
1452  ze_command_queue_handle_t &ZeQueue = ZeQueues[CurrentIndex];
1453  if (ZeQueue)
1454  return ZeQueue;
1455 
1456  // Command queue is not available at chosen index. So we create it below.
1457  ZeStruct<ze_command_queue_desc_t> ZeCommandQueueDesc;
1458 
1459  // Adjust the index to the L0 queue group since we represent "main" and "link"
1460  // L0 groups with a single copy group ("main" would take "0" index).
1461  auto ZeCommandQueueIndex = CurrentIndex;
1462  if (QueueType == queue_type::LinkCopy && Queue->Device->hasMainCopyEngine()) {
1463  ZeCommandQueueIndex -= 1;
1464  }
1465 
1466  ZeCommandQueueDesc.ordinal = *QueueGroupOrdinal;
1467  ZeCommandQueueDesc.index = ZeCommandQueueIndex;
1468  ZeCommandQueueDesc.mode = ZE_COMMAND_QUEUE_MODE_ASYNCHRONOUS;
1469 
1470  // Evaluate performance of explicit usage for "0" index.
1471  if (ZeCommandQueueIndex != 0) {
1472  ZeCommandQueueDesc.flags = ZE_COMMAND_QUEUE_FLAG_EXPLICIT_ONLY;
1473  }
1474 
1475  zePrint("[getZeQueue]: create queue ordinal = %d, index = %d "
1476  "(round robin in [%d, %d])\n",
1477  ZeCommandQueueDesc.ordinal, ZeCommandQueueDesc.index, LowerIndex,
1478  UpperIndex);
1479 
1480  auto ZeResult = ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(
1481  zeCommandQueueCreate, (Queue->Context->ZeContext, Queue->Device->ZeDevice,
1482  &ZeCommandQueueDesc, &ZeQueue));
1483  if (ZeResult) {
1484  die("[L0] getZeQueue: failed to create queue");
1485  }
1486  return ZeQueue;
1487 }
1488 
1489 pi_result _pi_queue::executeOpenCommandListWithEvent(pi_event Event) {
1490  // TODO: see if we can reliably tell if the event is copy or compute.
1491  // Meanwhile check both open command-lists.
1492  using IsCopy = bool;
1493  if (hasOpenCommandList(IsCopy{false}) &&
1494  ComputeCommandBatch.OpenCommandList->first == Event->ZeCommandList) {
1495  if (auto Res = executeOpenCommandList(IsCopy{false}))
1496  return Res;
1497  }
1498  if (hasOpenCommandList(IsCopy{true}) &&
1499  CopyCommandBatch.OpenCommandList->first == Event->ZeCommandList) {
1500  if (auto Res = executeOpenCommandList(IsCopy{true}))
1501  return Res;
1502  }
1503  return PI_SUCCESS;
1504 }
1505 
1506 pi_result _pi_queue::executeOpenCommandList(bool IsCopy) {
1507  auto &CommandBatch = IsCopy ? CopyCommandBatch : ComputeCommandBatch;
1508  // If there are any commands still in the open command list for this
1509  // queue, then close and execute that command list now.
1510  if (hasOpenCommandList(IsCopy)) {
1511  adjustBatchSizeForPartialBatch(IsCopy);
1512  auto Res = executeCommandList(CommandBatch.OpenCommandList, false, false);
1513  CommandBatch.OpenCommandList = CommandListMap.end();
1514  return Res;
1515  }
1516 
1517  return PI_SUCCESS;
1518 }
1519 
1520 static const bool FilterEventWaitList = [] {
1521  const char *Ret = std::getenv("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_FILTER_EVENT_WAIT_LIST");
1522  const bool RetVal = Ret ? std::stoi(Ret) : 1;
1523  return RetVal;
1524 }();
1525 
1526 pi_result _pi_ze_event_list_t::createAndRetainPiZeEventList(
1527  pi_uint32 EventListLength, const pi_event *EventList, pi_queue CurQueue) {
1528  this->Length = 0;
1529  this->ZeEventList = nullptr;
1530  this->PiEventList = nullptr;
1531 
1532  try {
1533  if (CurQueue->isInOrderQueue() && CurQueue->LastCommandEvent != nullptr) {
1534  this->ZeEventList = new ze_event_handle_t[EventListLength + 1];
1535  this->PiEventList = new pi_event[EventListLength + 1];
1536  } else if (EventListLength > 0) {
1537  this->ZeEventList = new ze_event_handle_t[EventListLength];
1538  this->PiEventList = new pi_event[EventListLength];
1539  }
1540 
1541  pi_uint32 TmpListLength = 0;
1542 
1543  if (EventListLength > 0) {
1544  for (pi_uint32 I = 0; I < EventListLength; I++) {
1545  PI_ASSERT(EventList[I] != nullptr, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
1546  if (EventList[I]->Completed)
1547  continue;
1548 
1549  // Poll of the host-visible events.
1550  auto HostVisibleEvent = EventList[I]->HostVisibleEvent;
1551  if (FilterEventWaitList && HostVisibleEvent) {
1552  auto Res =
1553  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeEventQueryStatus, (HostVisibleEvent->ZeEvent));
1554  if (Res == ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS) {
1555  // Event has already completed, don't put it into the list
1556  continue;
1557  }
1558  }
1559 
1560  auto Queue = EventList[I]->Queue;
1561 
1562  if (Queue && Queue != CurQueue) {
1563  // If the event that is going to be waited on is in a
1564  // different queue, then any open command list in
1565  // that queue must be closed and executed because
1566  // the event being waited on could be for a command
1567  // in the queue's batch.
1568 
1569  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
1570  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
1571 
1572  if (auto Res = Queue->executeAllOpenCommandLists())
1573  return Res;
1574  } else if (!Queue) {
1575  // There is a dependency on an interop-event.
1576  // Similarily to the above to avoid dead locks ensure that
1577  // execution of all prior commands in the current command-
1578  // batch is visible to the host. This may not be the case
1579  // when we intended to have only last command in the batch
1580  // produce host-visible event, e.g.
1581  //
1582  // event0 = interop event
1583  // event1 = command1 (already in batch, no deps)
1584  // event2 = command2 (is being added, dep on event0)
1585  // event3 = signal host-visible event for the batch
1586  // event1.wait()
1587  // event0.signal()
1588  //
1589  // Make sure that event1.wait() will wait for a host-visible
1590  // event that is signalled before the command2 is enqueued.
1591  if (EventsScope != AllHostVisible) {
1592  CurQueue->executeAllOpenCommandLists();
1593  }
1594  }
1595 
1596  this->ZeEventList[TmpListLength] = EventList[I]->ZeEvent;
1597  this->PiEventList[TmpListLength] = EventList[I];
1598  TmpListLength += 1;
1599  }
1600  }
1601 
1602  // For in-order queues, every command should be executed only after the
1603  // previous command has finished. The event associated with the last
1604  // enqueued command is added into the waitlist to ensure in-order semantics.
1605  if (CurQueue->isInOrderQueue() && CurQueue->LastCommandEvent != nullptr) {
1606  this->ZeEventList[TmpListLength] = CurQueue->LastCommandEvent->ZeEvent;
1607  this->PiEventList[TmpListLength] = CurQueue->LastCommandEvent;
1608  TmpListLength += 1;
1609  }
1610 
1611  this->Length = TmpListLength;
1612 
1613  } catch (...) {
1614  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
1615  }
1616 
1617  for (pi_uint32 I = 0; I < this->Length; I++) {
1618  PI_CALL(piEventRetain(this->PiEventList[I]));
1619  }
1620 
1621  return PI_SUCCESS;
1622 }
1623 
1624 static void printZeEventList(const _pi_ze_event_list_t &PiZeEventList) {
1625  zePrint(" NumEventsInWaitList %d:", PiZeEventList.Length);
1626 
1627  for (pi_uint32 I = 0; I < PiZeEventList.Length; I++) {
1628  zePrint(" %#lx", pi_cast<std::uintptr_t>(PiZeEventList.ZeEventList[I]));
1629  }
1630 
1631  zePrint("\n");
1632 }
1633 
1634 pi_result _pi_ze_event_list_t::collectEventsForReleaseAndDestroyPiZeEventList(
1635  std::list<pi_event> &EventsToBeReleased) {
1636  // acquire a lock before reading the length and list fields.
1637  // Acquire the lock, copy the needed data locally, and reset
1638  // the fields, then release the lock.
1639  // Only then do we do the actual actions to release and destroy,
1640  // holding the lock for the minimum time necessary.
1641  pi_uint32 LocLength = 0;
1642  ze_event_handle_t *LocZeEventList = nullptr;
1643  pi_event *LocPiEventList = nullptr;
1644 
1645  {
1646  // acquire the lock and copy fields locally
1647  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
1648  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(this->PiZeEventListMutex);
1649 
1650  LocLength = Length;
1651  LocZeEventList = ZeEventList;
1652  LocPiEventList = PiEventList;
1653 
1654  Length = 0;
1655  ZeEventList = nullptr;
1656  PiEventList = nullptr;
1657 
1658  // release lock by ending scope.
1659  }
1660 
1661  for (pi_uint32 I = 0; I < LocLength; I++) {
1662  // Add the event to be released to the list
1663  EventsToBeReleased.push_back(LocPiEventList[I]);
1664  }
1665 
1666  if (LocZeEventList != nullptr) {
1667  delete[] LocZeEventList;
1668  }
1669  if (LocPiEventList != nullptr) {
1670  delete[] LocPiEventList;
1671  }
1672 
1673  return PI_SUCCESS;
1674 }
1675 
1676 extern "C" {
1677 
1678 // Forward declarations
1679 decltype(piEventCreate) piEventCreate;
1680 
1681 static ze_result_t
1682 checkUnresolvedSymbols(ze_module_handle_t ZeModule,
1683  ze_module_build_log_handle_t *ZeBuildLog);
1684 
1685 // This function will ensure compatibility with both Linux and Windows for
1686 // setting environment variables.
1687 static bool setEnvVar(const char *name, const char *value) {
1688 #ifdef _WIN32
1689  int Res = _putenv_s(name, value);
1690 #else
1691  int Res = setenv(name, value, 1);
1692 #endif
1693  if (Res != 0) {
1694  zePrint(
1695  "Level Zero plugin was unable to set the environment variable: %s\n",
1696  name);
1697  return false;
1698  }
1699  return true;
1700 }
1701 
1702 static class ZeUSMImportExtension {
1703  // Pointers to functions that import/release host memory into USM
1704  ze_result_t (*zexDriverImportExternalPointer)(ze_driver_handle_t hDriver,
1705  void *, size_t);
1706  ze_result_t (*zexDriverReleaseImportedPointer)(ze_driver_handle_t, void *);
1707 
1708 public:
1709  // Whether user has requested Import/Release, and platform supports it.
1710  bool Enabled;
1711 
1712  ZeUSMImportExtension() : Enabled{false} {}
1713 
1714  void setZeUSMImport(pi_platform Platform) {
1715  // Whether env var SYCL_USM_HOSTPTR_IMPORT has been set requesting
1716  // host ptr import during buffer creation.
1717  const char *USMHostPtrImportStr = std::getenv("SYCL_USM_HOSTPTR_IMPORT");
1718  if (!USMHostPtrImportStr || std::atoi(USMHostPtrImportStr) == 0)
1719  return;
1720 
1721  // Check if USM hostptr import feature is available.
1722  ze_driver_handle_t driverHandle = Platform->ZeDriver;
1723  if (ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeDriverGetExtensionFunctionAddress,
1724  (driverHandle, "zexDriverImportExternalPointer",
1725  reinterpret_cast<void **>(
1726  &zexDriverImportExternalPointer))) == 0) {
1727  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(
1728  zeDriverGetExtensionFunctionAddress,
1729  (driverHandle, "zexDriverReleaseImportedPointer",
1730  reinterpret_cast<void **>(&zexDriverReleaseImportedPointer)));
1731  // Hostptr import/release is turned on because it has been requested
1732  // by the env var, and this platform supports the APIs.
1733  Enabled = true;
1734  // Hostptr import is only possible if piMemBufferCreate receives a
1735  // hostptr as an argument. The SYCL runtime passes a host ptr
1736  // only when SYCL_HOST_UNIFIED_MEMORY is enabled. Therefore we turn it on.
1737  setEnvVar("SYCL_HOST_UNIFIED_MEMORY", "1");
1738  }
1739  }
1740  void doZeUSMImport(ze_driver_handle_t driverHandle, void *HostPtr,
1741  size_t Size) {
1742  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zexDriverImportExternalPointer,
1743  (driverHandle, HostPtr, Size));
1744  }
1745  void doZeUSMRelease(ze_driver_handle_t driverHandle, void *HostPtr) {
1746  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zexDriverReleaseImportedPointer, (driverHandle, HostPtr));
1747  }
1748 } ZeUSMImport;
1749 
1750 pi_result _pi_platform::initialize() {
1751  // Cache driver properties
1752  ZeStruct<ze_driver_properties_t> ZeDriverProperties;
1753  ZE_CALL(zeDriverGetProperties, (ZeDriver, &ZeDriverProperties));
1754  uint32_t DriverVersion = ZeDriverProperties.driverVersion;
1755  // Intel Level-Zero GPU driver stores version as:
1756  // | 31 - 24 | 23 - 16 | 15 - 0 |
1757  // | Major | Minor | Build |
1758  auto VersionMajor = std::to_string((DriverVersion & 0xFF000000) >> 24);
1759  auto VersionMinor = std::to_string((DriverVersion & 0x00FF0000) >> 16);
1760  auto VersionBuild = std::to_string(DriverVersion & 0x0000FFFF);
1761  ZeDriverVersion = VersionMajor + "." + VersionMinor + "." + VersionBuild;
1762 
1763  ZE_CALL(zeDriverGetApiVersion, (ZeDriver, &ZeApiVersion));
1764  ZeDriverApiVersion = std::to_string(ZE_MAJOR_VERSION(ZeApiVersion)) + "." +
1765  std::to_string(ZE_MINOR_VERSION(ZeApiVersion));
1766 
1767  // Cache driver extension properties
1768  uint32_t Count = 0;
1769  ZE_CALL(zeDriverGetExtensionProperties, (ZeDriver, &Count, nullptr));
1770 
1771  std::vector<ze_driver_extension_properties_t> zeExtensions(Count);
1772 
1773  ZE_CALL(zeDriverGetExtensionProperties,
1774  (ZeDriver, &Count, zeExtensions.data()));
1775 
1776  for (auto extension : zeExtensions) {
1777  // Check if global offset extension is available
1778  if (strncmp(extension.name, ZE_GLOBAL_OFFSET_EXP_NAME,
1779  strlen(ZE_GLOBAL_OFFSET_EXP_NAME) + 1) == 0) {
1780  if (extension.version == ZE_GLOBAL_OFFSET_EXP_VERSION_1_0) {
1781  PiDriverGlobalOffsetExtensionFound = true;
1782  }
1783  }
1784  // Check if extension is available for "static linking" (compiling multiple
1785  // SPIR-V modules together into one Level Zero module).
1786  if (strncmp(extension.name, ZE_MODULE_PROGRAM_EXP_NAME,
1787  strlen(ZE_MODULE_PROGRAM_EXP_NAME) + 1) == 0) {
1788  if (extension.version == ZE_MODULE_PROGRAM_EXP_VERSION_1_0) {
1789  PiDriverModuleProgramExtensionFound = true;
1790  }
1791  }
1792  zeDriverExtensionMap[extension.name] = extension.version;
1793  }
1794 
1795  // Check if import user ptr into USM feature has been requested.
1796  // If yes, then set up L0 API pointers if the platform supports it.
1797  ZeUSMImport.setZeUSMImport(this);
1798 
1799  return PI_SUCCESS;
1800 }
1801 
1802 pi_result piPlatformsGet(pi_uint32 NumEntries, pi_platform *Platforms,
1803  pi_uint32 *NumPlatforms) {
1804 
1805  static const char *PiTrace = std::getenv("SYCL_PI_TRACE");
1806  static const int PiTraceValue = PiTrace ? std::stoi(PiTrace) : 0;
1807  if (PiTraceValue == -1 || PiTraceValue == 2) { // Means print all PI traces
1808  PrintPiTrace = true;
1809  }
1810 
1811  static std::once_flag ZeCallCountInitialized;
1812  try {
1813  std::call_once(ZeCallCountInitialized, []() {
1814  if (ZeDebug & ZE_DEBUG_CALL_COUNT) {
1815  ZeCallCount = new std::map<const char *, int>;
1816  }
1817  });
1818  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
1819  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
1820  } catch (...) {
1821  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
1822  }
1823 
1824  if (NumEntries == 0 && Platforms != nullptr) {
1825  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
1826  }
1827  if (Platforms == nullptr && NumPlatforms == nullptr) {
1828  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
1829  }
1830 
1831  // Setting these environment variables before running zeInit will enable the
1832  // validation layer in the Level Zero loader.
1833  if (ZeDebug & ZE_DEBUG_VALIDATION) {
1834  setEnvVar("ZE_ENABLE_VALIDATION_LAYER", "1");
1835  setEnvVar("ZE_ENABLE_PARAMETER_VALIDATION", "1");
1836  }
1837 
1838  // Enable SYSMAN support for obtaining the PCI address
1839  // and maximum memory bandwidth.
1840  if (getenv("SYCL_ENABLE_PCI") != nullptr) {
1841  setEnvVar("ZES_ENABLE_SYSMAN", "1");
1842  }
1843 
1844  // TODO: We can still safely recover if something goes wrong during the init.
1845  // Implement handling segfault using sigaction.
1846 
1847  // We must only initialize the driver once, even if piPlatformsGet() is called
1848  // multiple times. Declaring the return value as "static" ensures it's only
1849  // called once.
1850  static ze_result_t ZeResult = ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeInit, (0));
1851 
1852  // Absorb the ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNINITIALIZED and just return 0 Platforms.
1853  if (ZeResult == ZE_RESULT_ERROR_UNINITIALIZED) {
1854  PI_ASSERT(NumPlatforms != 0, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
1855  *NumPlatforms = 0;
1856  return PI_SUCCESS;
1857  }
1858 
1859  if (ZeResult != ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS) {
1860  zePrint("zeInit: Level Zero initialization failure\n");
1861  return mapError(ZeResult);
1862  }
1863 
1864  // Cache pi_platforms for reuse in the future
1865  // It solves two problems;
1866  // 1. sycl::platform equality issue; we always return the same pi_platform.
1867  // 2. performance; we can save time by immediately return from cache.
1868  //
1869 
1870  const std::lock_guard<sycl::detail::SpinLock> Lock{*PiPlatformsCacheMutex};
1871  if (!PiPlatformCachePopulated) {
1872  try {
1873  // Level Zero does not have concept of Platforms, but Level Zero driver is
1874  // the closest match.
1875  uint32_t ZeDriverCount = 0;
1876  ZE_CALL(zeDriverGet, (&ZeDriverCount, nullptr));
1877  if (ZeDriverCount == 0) {
1878  PiPlatformCachePopulated = true;
1879  } else {
1880  std::vector<ze_driver_handle_t> ZeDrivers;
1881  ZeDrivers.resize(ZeDriverCount);
1882 
1883  ZE_CALL(zeDriverGet, (&ZeDriverCount, ZeDrivers.data()));
1884  for (uint32_t I = 0; I < ZeDriverCount; ++I) {
1885  pi_platform Platform = new _pi_platform(ZeDrivers[I]);
1886  pi_result Result = Platform->initialize();
1887  if (Result != PI_SUCCESS) {
1888  return Result;
1889  }
1890  // Save a copy in the cache for future uses.
1891  PiPlatformsCache->push_back(Platform);
1892  }
1893  PiPlatformCachePopulated = true;
1894  }
1895  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
1896  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
1897  } catch (...) {
1898  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
1899  }
1900  }
1901 
1902  // Populate returned platforms from the cache.
1903  if (Platforms) {
1904  PI_ASSERT(NumEntries <= PiPlatformsCache->size(), PI_INVALID_PLATFORM);
1905  std::copy_n(PiPlatformsCache->begin(), NumEntries, Platforms);
1906  }
1907 
1908  if (NumPlatforms) {
1909  *NumPlatforms = PiPlatformsCache->size();
1910  }
1911 
1912  zePrint("Using events scope: %s\n",
1913  EventsScope == AllHostVisible ? "all host-visible"
1914  : EventsScope == OnDemandHostVisibleProxy
1915  ? "on demand host-visible proxy"
1916  : "only last command in a batch is host-visible");
1917  return PI_SUCCESS;
1918 }
1919 
1920 pi_result piPlatformGetInfo(pi_platform Platform, pi_platform_info ParamName,
1921  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
1922  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
1923 
1924  PI_ASSERT(Platform, PI_INVALID_PLATFORM);
1925 
1926  zePrint("==========================\n");
1927  zePrint("SYCL over Level-Zero %s\n", Platform->ZeDriverVersion.c_str());
1928  zePrint("==========================\n");
1929 
1930  ReturnHelper ReturnValue(ParamValueSize, ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet);
1931 
1932  switch (ParamName) {
1933  case PI_PLATFORM_INFO_NAME:
1934  // TODO: Query Level Zero driver when relevant info is added there.
1935  return ReturnValue("Intel(R) Level-Zero");
1936  case PI_PLATFORM_INFO_VENDOR:
1937  // TODO: Query Level Zero driver when relevant info is added there.
1938  return ReturnValue("Intel(R) Corporation");
1939  case PI_PLATFORM_INFO_EXTENSIONS:
1940  // Convention adopted from OpenCL:
1941  // "Returns a space-separated list of extension names (the extension
1942  // names themselves do not contain any spaces) supported by the platform.
1943  // Extensions defined here must be supported by all devices associated
1944  // with this platform."
1945  //
1946  // TODO: Check the common extensions supported by all connected devices and
1947  // return them. For now, hardcoding some extensions we know are supported by
1948  // all Level Zero devices.
1949  return ReturnValue(ZE_SUPPORTED_EXTENSIONS);
1950  case PI_PLATFORM_INFO_PROFILE:
1951  // TODO: figure out what this means and how is this used
1952  return ReturnValue("FULL_PROFILE");
1953  case PI_PLATFORM_INFO_VERSION:
1954  // TODO: this should query to zeDriverGetDriverVersion
1955  // but we don't yet have the driver handle here.
1956  //
1957  // From OpenCL 2.1: "This version string has the following format:
1958  // OpenCL<space><major_version.minor_version><space><platform-specific
1959  // information>. Follow the same notation here.
1960  //
1961  return ReturnValue(Platform->ZeDriverApiVersion.c_str());
1962  default:
1963  zePrint("piPlatformGetInfo: unrecognized ParamName\n");
1964  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
1965  }
1966 
1967  return PI_SUCCESS;
1968 }
1969 
1970 pi_result piextPlatformGetNativeHandle(pi_platform Platform,
1971  pi_native_handle *NativeHandle) {
1972  PI_ASSERT(Platform, PI_INVALID_PLATFORM);
1973  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
1974 
1975  auto ZeDriver = pi_cast<ze_driver_handle_t *>(NativeHandle);
1976  // Extract the Level Zero driver handle from the given PI platform
1977  *ZeDriver = Platform->ZeDriver;
1978  return PI_SUCCESS;
1979 }
1980 
1981 pi_result piextPlatformCreateWithNativeHandle(pi_native_handle NativeHandle,
1982  pi_platform *Platform) {
1983  PI_ASSERT(Platform, PI_INVALID_PLATFORM);
1984  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
1985 
1986  auto ZeDriver = pi_cast<ze_driver_handle_t>(NativeHandle);
1987 
1988  pi_uint32 NumPlatforms = 0;
1989  pi_result Res = piPlatformsGet(0, nullptr, &NumPlatforms);
1990  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS) {
1991  return Res;
1992  }
1993 
1994  if (NumPlatforms) {
1995  std::vector<pi_platform> Platforms(NumPlatforms);
1996  PI_CALL(piPlatformsGet(NumPlatforms, Platforms.data(), nullptr));
1997 
1998  // The SYCL spec requires that the set of platforms must remain fixed for
1999  // the duration of the application's execution. We assume that we found all
2000  // of the Level Zero drivers when we initialized the platform cache, so the
2001  // "NativeHandle" must already be in the cache. If it is not, this must not
2002  // be a valid Level Zero driver.
2003  for (const pi_platform &CachedPlatform : Platforms) {
2004  if (CachedPlatform->ZeDriver == ZeDriver) {
2005  *Platform = CachedPlatform;
2006  return PI_SUCCESS;
2007  }
2008  }
2009  }
2010 
2011  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
2012 }
2013 
2014 // Get the cached PI device created for the L0 device handle.
2015 // Return NULL if no such PI device found.
2016 pi_device _pi_platform::getDeviceFromNativeHandle(ze_device_handle_t ZeDevice) {
2017 
2018  pi_result Res = populateDeviceCacheIfNeeded();
2019  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS) {
2020  return nullptr;
2021  }
2022 
2023  // TODO: our sub-sub-device representation is currently [Level-Zero device
2024  // handle + Level-Zero compute group/engine index], so there is now no 1:1
2025  // mapping from L0 device handle to PI device assumed in this function. Until
2026  // Level-Zero adds unique ze_device_handle_t for sub-sub-devices, here we
2027  // filter out PI sub-sub-devices.
2028  auto it = std::find_if(PiDevicesCache.begin(), PiDevicesCache.end(),
