2029  [&](std::unique_ptr<_pi_device> &D) {
2030  return D.get()->ZeDevice == ZeDevice &&
2031  (D.get()->RootDevice == nullptr ||
2032  D.get()->RootDevice->RootDevice == nullptr);
2033  });
2034  if (it != PiDevicesCache.end()) {
2035  return (*it).get();
2036  }
2037  return nullptr;
2038 }
2039 
2040 pi_result piDevicesGet(pi_platform Platform, pi_device_type DeviceType,
2041  pi_uint32 NumEntries, pi_device *Devices,
2042  pi_uint32 *NumDevices) {
2043 
2044  PI_ASSERT(Platform, PI_INVALID_PLATFORM);
2045 
2046  pi_result Res = Platform->populateDeviceCacheIfNeeded();
2047  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS) {
2048  return Res;
2049  }
2050 
2051  // Filter available devices based on input DeviceType.
2052  std::vector<pi_device> MatchedDevices;
2053  for (auto &D : Platform->PiDevicesCache) {
2054  // Only ever return root-devices from piDevicesGet, but the
2055  // devices cache also keeps sub-devices.
2056  if (D->isSubDevice())
2057  continue;
2058 
2059  bool Matched = false;
2060  switch (DeviceType) {
2061  case PI_DEVICE_TYPE_ALL:
2062  Matched = true;
2063  break;
2064  case PI_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU:
2065  case PI_DEVICE_TYPE_DEFAULT:
2066  Matched = (D->ZeDeviceProperties->type == ZE_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU);
2067  break;
2068  case PI_DEVICE_TYPE_CPU:
2069  Matched = (D->ZeDeviceProperties->type == ZE_DEVICE_TYPE_CPU);
2070  break;
2071  case PI_DEVICE_TYPE_ACC:
2072  Matched = (D->ZeDeviceProperties->type == ZE_DEVICE_TYPE_MCA ||
2073  D->ZeDeviceProperties->type == ZE_DEVICE_TYPE_FPGA);
2074  break;
2075  default:
2076  Matched = false;
2077  zePrint("Unknown device type");
2078  break;
2079  }
2080  if (Matched)
2081  MatchedDevices.push_back(D.get());
2082  }
2083 
2084  uint32_t ZeDeviceCount = MatchedDevices.size();
2085 
2086  if (NumDevices)
2087  *NumDevices = ZeDeviceCount;
2088 
2089  if (NumEntries == 0) {
2090  // Devices should be nullptr when querying the number of devices.
2091  PI_ASSERT(Devices == nullptr, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2092  return PI_SUCCESS;
2093  }
2094 
2095  // Return the devices from the cache.
2096  if (Devices) {
2097  PI_ASSERT(NumEntries <= ZeDeviceCount, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
2098  std::copy_n(MatchedDevices.begin(), NumEntries, Devices);
2099  }
2100 
2101  return PI_SUCCESS;
2102 }
2103 
2104 // Check the device cache and load it if necessary.
2105 pi_result _pi_platform::populateDeviceCacheIfNeeded() {
2106  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> Lock(PiDevicesCacheMutex);
2107 
2108  if (DeviceCachePopulated) {
2109  return PI_SUCCESS;
2110  }
2111 
2112  uint32_t ZeDeviceCount = 0;
2113  ZE_CALL(zeDeviceGet, (ZeDriver, &ZeDeviceCount, nullptr));
2114 
2115  try {
2116  std::vector<ze_device_handle_t> ZeDevices(ZeDeviceCount);
2117  ZE_CALL(zeDeviceGet, (ZeDriver, &ZeDeviceCount, ZeDevices.data()));
2118 
2119  for (uint32_t I = 0; I < ZeDeviceCount; ++I) {
2120  std::unique_ptr<_pi_device> Device(new _pi_device(ZeDevices[I], this));
2121  pi_result Result = Device->initialize();
2122  if (Result != PI_SUCCESS) {
2123  return Result;
2124  }
2125 
2126  // Additionally we need to cache all sub-devices too, such that they
2127  // are readily visible to the piextDeviceCreateWithNativeHandle.
2128  //
2129  pi_uint32 SubDevicesCount = 0;
2130  ZE_CALL(zeDeviceGetSubDevices,
2131  (Device->ZeDevice, &SubDevicesCount, nullptr));
2132 
2133  auto ZeSubdevices = new ze_device_handle_t[SubDevicesCount];
2134  ZE_CALL(zeDeviceGetSubDevices,
2135  (Device->ZeDevice, &SubDevicesCount, ZeSubdevices));
2136 
2137  // Wrap the Level Zero sub-devices into PI sub-devices, and add them to
2138  // cache.
2139  for (uint32_t I = 0; I < SubDevicesCount; ++I) {
2140  std::unique_ptr<_pi_device> PiSubDevice(
2141  new _pi_device(ZeSubdevices[I], this, Device.get()));
2142  pi_result Result = PiSubDevice->initialize();
2143  if (Result != PI_SUCCESS) {
2144  delete[] ZeSubdevices;
2145  return Result;
2146  }
2147 
2148  // collect all the ordinals for the sub-sub-devices
2149  std::vector<int> Ordinals;
2150 
2151  uint32_t numQueueGroups = 0;
2152  ZE_CALL(zeDeviceGetCommandQueueGroupProperties,
2153  (PiSubDevice->ZeDevice, &numQueueGroups, nullptr));
2154  if (numQueueGroups == 0) {
2155  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
2156  }
2157  std::vector<ze_command_queue_group_properties_t> QueueGroupProperties(
2158  numQueueGroups);
2159  ZE_CALL(zeDeviceGetCommandQueueGroupProperties,
2160  (PiSubDevice->ZeDevice, &numQueueGroups,
2161  QueueGroupProperties.data()));
2162 
2163  for (uint32_t i = 0; i < numQueueGroups; i++) {
2164  if (QueueGroupProperties[i].flags &
2165  ZE_COMMAND_QUEUE_GROUP_PROPERTY_FLAG_COMPUTE &&
2166  QueueGroupProperties[i].numQueues > 1) {
2167  Ordinals.push_back(i);
2168  }
2169  }
2170 
2171  // Create PI sub-sub-devices with the sub-device for all the ordinals.
2172  // Each {ordinal, index} points to a specific CCS which constructs
2173  // a sub-sub-device at this point.
2174  // FIXME: Level Zero creates multiple PiDevices for a single physical
2175  // device when sub-device is partitioned into sub-sub-devices.
2176  // Sub-sub-device is technically a command queue and we should not build
2177  // program for each command queue. PiDevice is probably not the right
2178  // abstraction for a Level Zero command queue.
2179  for (uint32_t J = 0; J < Ordinals.size(); ++J) {
2180  for (uint32_t K = 0; K < QueueGroupProperties[Ordinals[J]].numQueues;
2181  ++K) {
2182  std::unique_ptr<_pi_device> PiSubSubDevice(
2183  new _pi_device(ZeSubdevices[I], this, PiSubDevice.get()));
2184  pi_result Result = PiSubSubDevice->initialize(Ordinals[J], K);
2185  if (Result != PI_SUCCESS) {
2186  return Result;
2187  }
2188 
2189  // save pointers to sub-sub-devices for quick retrieval in the
2190  // future.
2191  PiSubDevice->SubDevices.push_back(PiSubSubDevice.get());
2192  PiDevicesCache.push_back(std::move(PiSubSubDevice));
2193  }
2194  }
2195 
2196  // save pointers to sub-devices for quick retrieval in the future.
2197  Device->SubDevices.push_back(PiSubDevice.get());
2198  PiDevicesCache.push_back(std::move(PiSubDevice));
2199  }
2200  delete[] ZeSubdevices;
2201 
2202  // Save the root device in the cache for future uses.
2203  PiDevicesCache.push_back(std::move(Device));
2204  }
2205  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
2206  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
2207  } catch (...) {
2208  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
2209  }
2210  DeviceCachePopulated = true;
2211  return PI_SUCCESS;
2212 }
2213 
2214 pi_result piDeviceRetain(pi_device Device) {
2215  PI_ASSERT(Device, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
2216 
2217  // The root-device ref-count remains unchanged (always 1).
2218  if (Device->isSubDevice()) {
2219  ++(Device->RefCount);
2220  }
2221  return PI_SUCCESS;
2222 }
2223 
2224 pi_result piDeviceRelease(pi_device Device) {
2225  PI_ASSERT(Device, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
2226 
2227  // Check if the device is already released
2228  if (Device->RefCount <= 0)
2229  die("piDeviceRelease: the device has been already released");
2230 
2231  // Root devices are destroyed during the piTearDown process.
2232  if (Device->isSubDevice()) {
2233  if (--(Device->RefCount) == 0) {
2234  delete Device;
2235  }
2236  }
2237 
2238  return PI_SUCCESS;
2239 }
2240 
2241 pi_result piDeviceGetInfo(pi_device Device, pi_device_info ParamName,
2242  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
2243  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
2244 
2245  PI_ASSERT(Device, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
2246 
2247  ze_device_handle_t ZeDevice = Device->ZeDevice;
2248 
2249  ReturnHelper ReturnValue(ParamValueSize, ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet);
2250 
2251  switch (ParamName) {
2252  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_TYPE: {
2253  switch (Device->ZeDeviceProperties->type) {
2254  case ZE_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU:
2255  return ReturnValue(PI_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU);
2256  case ZE_DEVICE_TYPE_CPU:
2257  return ReturnValue(PI_DEVICE_TYPE_CPU);
2258  case ZE_DEVICE_TYPE_MCA:
2259  case ZE_DEVICE_TYPE_FPGA:
2260  return ReturnValue(PI_DEVICE_TYPE_ACC);
2261  default:
2262  zePrint("This device type is not supported\n");
2263  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
2264  }
2265  }
2266  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PARENT_DEVICE:
2267  return ReturnValue(Device->RootDevice);
2268  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PLATFORM:
2269  return ReturnValue(Device->Platform);
2270  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_VENDOR_ID:
2271  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Device->ZeDeviceProperties->vendorId});
2272  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_UUID:
2273  // Intel extension for device UUID. This returns the UUID as
2274  // std::array<std::byte, 16>. For details about this extension,
2275  // see sycl/doc/extensions/supported/sycl_ext_intel_device_info.md.
2276  return ReturnValue(Device->ZeDeviceProperties->uuid.id);
2277  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_ATOMIC_64:
2278  return ReturnValue(pi_bool{Device->ZeDeviceModuleProperties->flags &
2279  ZE_DEVICE_MODULE_FLAG_INT64_ATOMICS});
2280  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_EXTENSIONS: {
2281  // Convention adopted from OpenCL:
2282  // "Returns a space separated list of extension names (the extension
2283  // names themselves do not contain any spaces) supported by the device."
2284  //
2285  // TODO: Use proper mechanism to get this information from Level Zero after
2286  // it is added to Level Zero.
2287  // Hardcoding the few we know are supported by the current hardware.
2288  //
2289  //
2290  std::string SupportedExtensions;
2291 
2292  // cl_khr_il_program - OpenCL 2.0 KHR extension for SPIR-V support. Core
2293  // feature in >OpenCL 2.1
2294  // cl_khr_subgroups - Extension adds support for implementation-controlled
2295  // subgroups.
2296  // cl_intel_subgroups - Extension adds subgroup features, defined by Intel.
2297  // cl_intel_subgroups_short - Extension adds subgroup functions described in
2298  // the cl_intel_subgroups extension to support 16-bit integer data types
2299  // for performance.
2300  // cl_intel_required_subgroup_size - Extension to allow programmers to
2301  // optionally specify the required subgroup size for a kernel function.
2302  // cl_khr_fp16 - Optional half floating-point support.
2303  // cl_khr_fp64 - Support for double floating-point precision.
2304  // cl_khr_int64_base_atomics, cl_khr_int64_extended_atomics - Optional
2305  // extensions that implement atomic operations on 64-bit signed and
2306  // unsigned integers to locations in __global and __local memory.
2307  // cl_khr_3d_image_writes - Extension to enable writes to 3D image memory
2308  // objects.
2309  //
2310  // Hardcoding some extensions we know are supported by all Level Zero
2311  // devices.
2312  SupportedExtensions += (ZE_SUPPORTED_EXTENSIONS);
2313  if (Device->ZeDeviceModuleProperties->flags & ZE_DEVICE_MODULE_FLAG_FP16)
2314  SupportedExtensions += ("cl_khr_fp16 ");
2315  if (Device->ZeDeviceModuleProperties->flags & ZE_DEVICE_MODULE_FLAG_FP64)
2316  SupportedExtensions += ("cl_khr_fp64 ");
2317  if (Device->ZeDeviceModuleProperties->flags &
2318  ZE_DEVICE_MODULE_FLAG_INT64_ATOMICS)
2319  // int64AtomicsSupported indicates support for both.
2320  SupportedExtensions +=
2321  ("cl_khr_int64_base_atomics cl_khr_int64_extended_atomics ");
2322  if (Device->ZeDeviceImageProperties->maxImageDims3D > 0)
2323  // Supports reading and writing of images.
2324  SupportedExtensions += ("cl_khr_3d_image_writes ");
2325 
2326  return ReturnValue(SupportedExtensions.c_str());
2327  }
2328  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_NAME:
2329  return ReturnValue(Device->ZeDeviceProperties->name);
2330  // zeModuleCreate allows using root device module for sub-devices:
2331  // > The application must only use the module for the device, or its
2332  // > sub-devices, which was provided during creation.
2333  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_BUILD_ON_SUBDEVICE:
2334  return ReturnValue(PI_FALSE);
2335  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_COMPILER_AVAILABLE:
2336  return ReturnValue(pi_bool{1});
2337  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_LINKER_AVAILABLE:
2338  return ReturnValue(pi_bool{1});
2339  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_COMPUTE_UNITS: {
2340  pi_uint32 MaxComputeUnits =
2341  Device->ZeDeviceProperties->numEUsPerSubslice *
2342  Device->ZeDeviceProperties->numSubslicesPerSlice *
2343  Device->ZeDeviceProperties->numSlices;
2344  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{MaxComputeUnits});
2345  }
2346  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_WORK_ITEM_DIMENSIONS:
2347  // Level Zero spec defines only three dimensions
2348  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{3});
2349  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_WORK_GROUP_SIZE:
2350  return ReturnValue(
2351  pi_uint64{Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->maxTotalGroupSize});
2352  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_WORK_ITEM_SIZES: {
2353  struct {
2354  size_t Arr[3];
2355  } MaxGroupSize = {{Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->maxGroupSizeX,
2356  Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->maxGroupSizeY,
2357  Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->maxGroupSizeZ}};
2358  return ReturnValue(MaxGroupSize);
2359  }
2360  case PI_EXT_ONEAPI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_WORK_GROUPS_3D: {
2361  struct {
2362  size_t Arr[3];
2363  } MaxGroupCounts = {{Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->maxGroupCountX,
2364  Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->maxGroupCountY,
2365  Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->maxGroupCountZ}};
2366  return ReturnValue(MaxGroupCounts);
2367  }
2368  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_CLOCK_FREQUENCY:
2369  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Device->ZeDeviceProperties->coreClockRate});
2370  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_ADDRESS_BITS: {
2371  // TODO: To confirm with spec.
2372  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{64});
2373  }
2374  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_MEM_ALLOC_SIZE:
2375  return ReturnValue(pi_uint64{Device->ZeDeviceProperties->maxMemAllocSize});
2376  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_GLOBAL_MEM_SIZE: {
2377  uint64_t GlobalMemSize = 0;
2378  for (uint32_t I = 0; I < Device->ZeDeviceMemoryProperties->size(); I++) {
2379  GlobalMemSize +=
2380  (*Device->ZeDeviceMemoryProperties.operator->())[I].totalSize;
2381  }
2382  return ReturnValue(pi_uint64{GlobalMemSize});
2383  }
2384  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_LOCAL_MEM_SIZE:
2385  return ReturnValue(
2386  pi_uint64{Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->maxSharedLocalMemory});
2387  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_IMAGE_SUPPORT:
2388  return ReturnValue(
2389  pi_bool{Device->ZeDeviceImageProperties->maxImageDims1D > 0});
2390  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_HOST_UNIFIED_MEMORY:
2391  return ReturnValue(pi_bool{(Device->ZeDeviceProperties->flags &
2392  ZE_DEVICE_PROPERTY_FLAG_INTEGRATED) != 0});
2393  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_AVAILABLE:
2394  return ReturnValue(pi_bool{ZeDevice ? true : false});
2395  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_VENDOR:
2396  // TODO: Level-Zero does not return vendor's name at the moment
2397  // only the ID.
2398  return ReturnValue("Intel(R) Corporation");
2399  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_DRIVER_VERSION:
2400  return ReturnValue(Device->Platform->ZeDriverVersion.c_str());
2401  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_VERSION:
2402  return ReturnValue(Device->Platform->ZeDriverApiVersion.c_str());
2403  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PARTITION_MAX_SUB_DEVICES: {
2404  pi_result Res = Device->Platform->populateDeviceCacheIfNeeded();
2405  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS) {
2406  return Res;
2407  }
2408  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{(unsigned int)(Device->SubDevices.size())});
2409  }
2410  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_REFERENCE_COUNT:
2411  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Device->RefCount});
2412  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PARTITION_PROPERTIES: {
2413  // SYCL spec says: if this SYCL device cannot be partitioned into at least
2414  // two sub devices then the returned vector must be empty.
2415  pi_result Res = Device->Platform->populateDeviceCacheIfNeeded();
2416  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS) {
2417  return Res;
2418  }
2419 
2420  uint32_t ZeSubDeviceCount = Device->SubDevices.size();
2421  if (ZeSubDeviceCount < 2) {
2422  return ReturnValue(pi_device_partition_property{0});
2423  }
2424  // It is debatable if SYCL sub-device and partitioning APIs sufficient to
2425  // expose Level Zero sub-devices? We start with support of
2426  // "partition_by_affinity_domain" and "next_partitionable" but if that
2427  // doesn't seem to be a good fit we could look at adding a more descriptive
2428  // partitioning type.
2429  struct {
2430  pi_device_partition_property Arr[2];
2431  } PartitionProperties = {{PI_DEVICE_PARTITION_BY_AFFINITY_DOMAIN, 0}};
2432  return ReturnValue(PartitionProperties);
2433  }
2434  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PARTITION_AFFINITY_DOMAIN:
2435  return ReturnValue(pi_device_affinity_domain{
2436  PI_DEVICE_AFFINITY_DOMAIN_NUMA |
2437  PI_DEVICE_AFFINITY_DOMAIN_NEXT_PARTITIONABLE});
2438  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PARTITION_TYPE: {
2439  if (Device->isSubDevice()) {
2440  struct {
2441  pi_device_partition_property Arr[3];
2442  } PartitionProperties = {{PI_DEVICE_PARTITION_BY_AFFINITY_DOMAIN,
2443  PI_DEVICE_AFFINITY_DOMAIN_NEXT_PARTITIONABLE,
2444  0}};
2445  return ReturnValue(PartitionProperties);
2446  }
2447  // For root-device there is no partitioning to report.
2448  return ReturnValue(pi_device_partition_property{0});
2449  }
2450 
2451  // Everything under here is not supported yet
2452 
2453  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_OPENCL_C_VERSION:
2454  return ReturnValue("");
2455  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PREFERRED_INTEROP_USER_SYNC:
2456  return ReturnValue(pi_bool{true});
2457  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PRINTF_BUFFER_SIZE:
2458  return ReturnValue(
2459  size_t{Device->ZeDeviceModuleProperties->printfBufferSize});
2460  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PROFILE:
2461  return ReturnValue("FULL_PROFILE");
2462  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_BUILT_IN_KERNELS:
2463  // TODO: To find out correct value
2464  return ReturnValue("");
2465  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_QUEUE_PROPERTIES:
2466  return ReturnValue(pi_queue_properties{
2467  PI_QUEUE_OUT_OF_ORDER_EXEC_MODE_ENABLE | PI_QUEUE_PROFILING_ENABLE});
2468  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_EXECUTION_CAPABILITIES:
2469  return ReturnValue(
2470  pi_device_exec_capabilities{PI_DEVICE_EXEC_CAPABILITIES_NATIVE_KERNEL});
2471  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_ENDIAN_LITTLE:
2472  return ReturnValue(pi_bool{true});
2473  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_ERROR_CORRECTION_SUPPORT:
2474  return ReturnValue(pi_bool{Device->ZeDeviceProperties->flags &
2475  ZE_DEVICE_PROPERTY_FLAG_ECC});
2476  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PROFILING_TIMER_RESOLUTION:
2477  return ReturnValue(size_t{Device->ZeDeviceProperties->timerResolution});
2478  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_LOCAL_MEM_TYPE:
2479  return ReturnValue(PI_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_TYPE_LOCAL);
2480  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_CONSTANT_ARGS:
2481  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{64});
2482  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_CONSTANT_BUFFER_SIZE:
2483  return ReturnValue(
2484  pi_uint64{Device->ZeDeviceImageProperties->maxImageBufferSize});
2485  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_GLOBAL_MEM_CACHE_TYPE:
2486  return ReturnValue(PI_DEVICE_MEM_CACHE_TYPE_READ_WRITE_CACHE);
2487  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_GLOBAL_MEM_CACHELINE_SIZE:
2488  return ReturnValue(
2489  // TODO[1.0]: how to query cache line-size?
2490  pi_uint32{1});
2491  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_GLOBAL_MEM_CACHE_SIZE:
2492  return ReturnValue(pi_uint64{Device->ZeDeviceCacheProperties->cacheSize});
2493  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_PARAMETER_SIZE:
2494  return ReturnValue(
2495  size_t{Device->ZeDeviceModuleProperties->maxArgumentsSize});
2496  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MEM_BASE_ADDR_ALIGN:
2497  // SYCL/OpenCL spec is vague on what this means exactly, but seems to
2498  // be for "alignment requirement (in bits) for sub-buffer offsets."
2499  // An OpenCL implementation returns 8*128, but Level Zero can do just 8,
2500  // meaning unaligned access for values of types larger than 8 bits.
2501  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{8});
2502  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_SAMPLERS:
2503  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Device->ZeDeviceImageProperties->maxSamplers});
2504  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_READ_IMAGE_ARGS:
2505  return ReturnValue(
2506  pi_uint32{Device->ZeDeviceImageProperties->maxReadImageArgs});
2507  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_WRITE_IMAGE_ARGS:
2508  return ReturnValue(
2509  pi_uint32{Device->ZeDeviceImageProperties->maxWriteImageArgs});
2510  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_SINGLE_FP_CONFIG: {
2511  uint64_t SingleFPValue = 0;
2512  ze_device_fp_flags_t ZeSingleFPCapabilities =
2513  Device->ZeDeviceModuleProperties->fp32flags;
2514  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_DENORM & ZeSingleFPCapabilities) {
2515  SingleFPValue |= PI_FP_DENORM;
2516  }
2517  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_INF_NAN & ZeSingleFPCapabilities) {
2518  SingleFPValue |= PI_FP_INF_NAN;
2519  }
2520  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_ROUND_TO_NEAREST & ZeSingleFPCapabilities) {
2521  SingleFPValue |= PI_FP_ROUND_TO_NEAREST;
2522  }
2523  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_ROUND_TO_ZERO & ZeSingleFPCapabilities) {
2524  SingleFPValue |= PI_FP_ROUND_TO_ZERO;
2525  }
2526  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_ROUND_TO_INF & ZeSingleFPCapabilities) {
2527  SingleFPValue |= PI_FP_ROUND_TO_INF;
2528  }
2529  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_FMA & ZeSingleFPCapabilities) {
2530  SingleFPValue |= PI_FP_FMA;
2531  }
2532  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_ROUNDED_DIVIDE_SQRT & ZeSingleFPCapabilities) {
2533  SingleFPValue |= PI_FP_CORRECTLY_ROUNDED_DIVIDE_SQRT;
2534  }
2535  return ReturnValue(pi_uint64{SingleFPValue});
2536  }
2537  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_HALF_FP_CONFIG: {
2538  uint64_t HalfFPValue = 0;
2539  ze_device_fp_flags_t ZeHalfFPCapabilities =
2540  Device->ZeDeviceModuleProperties->fp16flags;
2541  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_DENORM & ZeHalfFPCapabilities) {
2542  HalfFPValue |= PI_FP_DENORM;
2543  }
2544  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_INF_NAN & ZeHalfFPCapabilities) {
2545  HalfFPValue |= PI_FP_INF_NAN;
2546  }
2547  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_ROUND_TO_NEAREST & ZeHalfFPCapabilities) {
2548  HalfFPValue |= PI_FP_ROUND_TO_NEAREST;
2549  }
2550  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_ROUND_TO_ZERO & ZeHalfFPCapabilities) {
2551  HalfFPValue |= PI_FP_ROUND_TO_ZERO;
2552  }
2553  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_ROUND_TO_INF & ZeHalfFPCapabilities) {
2554  HalfFPValue |= PI_FP_ROUND_TO_INF;
2555  }
2556  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_FMA & ZeHalfFPCapabilities) {
2557  HalfFPValue |= PI_FP_FMA;
2558  }
2559  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_ROUNDED_DIVIDE_SQRT & ZeHalfFPCapabilities) {
2560  HalfFPValue |= PI_FP_CORRECTLY_ROUNDED_DIVIDE_SQRT;
2561  }
2562  return ReturnValue(pi_uint64{HalfFPValue});
2563  }
2564  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_DOUBLE_FP_CONFIG: {
2565  uint64_t DoubleFPValue = 0;
2566  ze_device_fp_flags_t ZeDoubleFPCapabilities =
2567  Device->ZeDeviceModuleProperties->fp64flags;
2568  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_DENORM & ZeDoubleFPCapabilities) {
2569  DoubleFPValue |= PI_FP_DENORM;
2570  }
2571  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_INF_NAN & ZeDoubleFPCapabilities) {
2572  DoubleFPValue |= PI_FP_INF_NAN;
2573  }
2574  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_ROUND_TO_NEAREST & ZeDoubleFPCapabilities) {
2575  DoubleFPValue |= PI_FP_ROUND_TO_NEAREST;
2576  }
2577  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_ROUND_TO_ZERO & ZeDoubleFPCapabilities) {
2578  DoubleFPValue |= PI_FP_ROUND_TO_ZERO;
2579  }
2580  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_ROUND_TO_INF & ZeDoubleFPCapabilities) {
2581  DoubleFPValue |= PI_FP_ROUND_TO_INF;
2582  }
2583  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_FMA & ZeDoubleFPCapabilities) {
2584  DoubleFPValue |= PI_FP_FMA;
2585  }
2586  if (ZE_DEVICE_FP_FLAG_ROUNDED_DIVIDE_SQRT & ZeDoubleFPCapabilities) {
2587  DoubleFPValue |= PI_FP_CORRECTLY_ROUNDED_DIVIDE_SQRT;
2588  }
2589  return ReturnValue(pi_uint64{DoubleFPValue});
2590  }
2591  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_IMAGE2D_MAX_WIDTH:
2592  // Until Level Zero provides needed info, hardcode default minimum values
2593  // required by the SYCL specification.
2594  return ReturnValue(size_t{8192});
2595  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_IMAGE2D_MAX_HEIGHT:
2596  // Until Level Zero provides needed info, hardcode default minimum values
2597  // required by the SYCL specification.
2598  return ReturnValue(size_t{8192});
2599  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_IMAGE3D_MAX_WIDTH:
2600  // Until Level Zero provides needed info, hardcode default minimum values
2601  // required by the SYCL specification.
2602  return ReturnValue(size_t{2048});
2603  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_IMAGE3D_MAX_HEIGHT:
2604  // Until Level Zero provides needed info, hardcode default minimum values
2605  // required by the SYCL specification.
2606  return ReturnValue(size_t{2048});
2607  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_IMAGE3D_MAX_DEPTH:
2608  // Until Level Zero provides needed info, hardcode default minimum values
2609  // required by the SYCL specification.
2610  return ReturnValue(size_t{2048});
2611  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_IMAGE_MAX_BUFFER_SIZE:
2612  return ReturnValue(
2613  size_t{Device->ZeDeviceImageProperties->maxImageBufferSize});
2614  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_IMAGE_MAX_ARRAY_SIZE:
2615  return ReturnValue(
2616  size_t{Device->ZeDeviceImageProperties->maxImageArraySlices});
2617  // Handle SIMD widths.
2618  // TODO: can we do better than this?
2619  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_CHAR:
2620  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_CHAR:
2621  return ReturnValue(Device->ZeDeviceProperties->physicalEUSimdWidth / 1);
2622  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_SHORT:
2623  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_SHORT:
2624  return ReturnValue(Device->ZeDeviceProperties->physicalEUSimdWidth / 2);
2625  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_INT:
2626  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_INT:
2627  return ReturnValue(Device->ZeDeviceProperties->physicalEUSimdWidth / 4);
2628  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_LONG:
2629  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_LONG:
2630  return ReturnValue(Device->ZeDeviceProperties->physicalEUSimdWidth / 8);
2631  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_FLOAT:
2632  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_FLOAT:
2633  return ReturnValue(Device->ZeDeviceProperties->physicalEUSimdWidth / 4);
2634  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_DOUBLE:
2635  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_DOUBLE:
2636  return ReturnValue(Device->ZeDeviceProperties->physicalEUSimdWidth / 8);
2637  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_HALF:
2638  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_HALF:
2639  return ReturnValue(Device->ZeDeviceProperties->physicalEUSimdWidth / 2);
2640  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_NUM_SUB_GROUPS: {
2641  // Max_num_sub_Groups = maxTotalGroupSize/min(set of subGroupSizes);
2642  uint32_t MinSubGroupSize =
2643  Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->subGroupSizes[0];
2644  for (uint32_t I = 1;
2645  I < Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->numSubGroupSizes; I++) {
2646  if (MinSubGroupSize > Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->subGroupSizes[I])
2647  MinSubGroupSize = Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->subGroupSizes[I];
2648  }
2649  return ReturnValue(Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->maxTotalGroupSize /
2650  MinSubGroupSize);
2651  }
2652  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_SUB_GROUP_INDEPENDENT_FORWARD_PROGRESS: {
2653  // TODO: Not supported yet. Needs to be updated after support is added.
2654  return ReturnValue(pi_bool{false});
2655  }
2656  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_SUB_GROUP_SIZES_INTEL: {
2657  // ze_device_compute_properties.subGroupSizes is in uint32_t whereas the
2658  // expected return is size_t datatype. size_t can be 8 bytes of data.
2659  return getInfoArray<uint32_t, size_t>(
2660  Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->numSubGroupSizes, ParamValueSize,
2661  ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet,
2662  Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->subGroupSizes);
2663  }
2664  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_IL_VERSION: {
2665  // Set to a space separated list of IL version strings of the form
2666  // <IL_Prefix>_<Major_version>.<Minor_version>.
2667  // "SPIR-V" is a required IL prefix when cl_khr_il_progam extension is
2668  // reported.
2669  uint32_t SpirvVersion =
2670  Device->ZeDeviceModuleProperties->spirvVersionSupported;
2671  uint32_t SpirvVersionMajor = ZE_MAJOR_VERSION(SpirvVersion);
2672  uint32_t SpirvVersionMinor = ZE_MINOR_VERSION(SpirvVersion);
2673 
2674  char SpirvVersionString[50];
2675  int Len = sprintf(SpirvVersionString, "SPIR-V_%d.%d ", SpirvVersionMajor,
2676  SpirvVersionMinor);
2677  // returned string to contain only len number of characters.
2678  std::string ILVersion(SpirvVersionString, Len);
2679  return ReturnValue(ILVersion.c_str());
2680  }
2681  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_USM_HOST_SUPPORT:
2682  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_USM_DEVICE_SUPPORT:
2683  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_USM_SINGLE_SHARED_SUPPORT:
2684  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_USM_CROSS_SHARED_SUPPORT:
2685  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_USM_SYSTEM_SHARED_SUPPORT: {
2686  auto MapCaps = [](const ze_memory_access_cap_flags_t &ZeCapabilities) {
2687  pi_uint64 Capabilities = 0;
2688  if (ZeCapabilities & ZE_MEMORY_ACCESS_CAP_FLAG_RW)
2689  Capabilities |= PI_USM_ACCESS;
2690  if (ZeCapabilities & ZE_MEMORY_ACCESS_CAP_FLAG_ATOMIC)
2691  Capabilities |= PI_USM_ATOMIC_ACCESS;
2692  if (ZeCapabilities & ZE_MEMORY_ACCESS_CAP_FLAG_CONCURRENT)
2693  Capabilities |= PI_USM_CONCURRENT_ACCESS;
2694  if (ZeCapabilities & ZE_MEMORY_ACCESS_CAP_FLAG_CONCURRENT_ATOMIC)
2695  Capabilities |= PI_USM_CONCURRENT_ATOMIC_ACCESS;
2696  return Capabilities;
2697  };
2698  auto &Props = Device->ZeDeviceMemoryAccessProperties;
2699  switch (ParamName) {
2700  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_USM_HOST_SUPPORT:
2701  return ReturnValue(MapCaps(Props->hostAllocCapabilities));
2702  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_USM_DEVICE_SUPPORT:
2703  return ReturnValue(MapCaps(Props->deviceAllocCapabilities));
2704  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_USM_SINGLE_SHARED_SUPPORT:
2705  return ReturnValue(MapCaps(Props->sharedSingleDeviceAllocCapabilities));
2706  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_USM_CROSS_SHARED_SUPPORT:
2707  return ReturnValue(MapCaps(Props->sharedCrossDeviceAllocCapabilities));
2708  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_USM_SYSTEM_SHARED_SUPPORT:
2709  return ReturnValue(MapCaps(Props->sharedSystemAllocCapabilities));
2710  default:
2711  die("piDeviceGetInfo: enexpected ParamName.");
2712  }
2713  }
2714 
2715  // intel extensions for GPU information
2716  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_PCI_ADDRESS: {
2717  if (getenv("ZES_ENABLE_SYSMAN") == nullptr) {
2718  zePrint("Set SYCL_ENABLE_PCI=1 to obtain PCI data.\n");
2719  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
2720  }
2721  ZesStruct<zes_pci_properties_t> ZeDevicePciProperties;
2722  ZE_CALL(zesDevicePciGetProperties, (ZeDevice, &ZeDevicePciProperties));
2723  std::stringstream ss;
2724  ss << ZeDevicePciProperties.address.domain << ":"
2725  << ZeDevicePciProperties.address.bus << ":"
2726  << ZeDevicePciProperties.address.device << "."
2727  << ZeDevicePciProperties.address.function;
2728  return ReturnValue(ss.str().c_str());
2729  }
2730  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_GPU_EU_COUNT: {
2731  pi_uint32 count = Device->ZeDeviceProperties->numEUsPerSubslice *
2732  Device->ZeDeviceProperties->numSubslicesPerSlice *
2733  Device->ZeDeviceProperties->numSlices;
2734  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{count});
2735  }
2736  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_GPU_EU_SIMD_WIDTH:
2737  return ReturnValue(
2738  pi_uint32{Device->ZeDeviceProperties->physicalEUSimdWidth});
2739  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_GPU_SLICES:
2740  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Device->ZeDeviceProperties->numSlices});
2741  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_GPU_SUBSLICES_PER_SLICE:
2742  return ReturnValue(
2743  pi_uint32{Device->ZeDeviceProperties->numSubslicesPerSlice});
2744  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_GPU_EU_COUNT_PER_SUBSLICE:
2745  return ReturnValue(
2746  pi_uint32{Device->ZeDeviceProperties->numEUsPerSubslice});
2747  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_GPU_HW_THREADS_PER_EU:
2748  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Device->ZeDeviceProperties->numThreadsPerEU});
2749  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_MAX_MEM_BANDWIDTH:
2750  // currently not supported in level zero runtime
2751  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
2752 
2753  // TODO: Implement.
2754  case PI_DEVICE_INFO_ATOMIC_MEMORY_SCOPE_CAPABILITIES:
2755  default:
2756  zePrint("Unsupported ParamName in piGetDeviceInfo\n");
2757  zePrint("ParamName=%d(0x%x)\n", ParamName, ParamName);
2758  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
2759  }
2760 
2761  return PI_SUCCESS;
2762 }
2763 
2764 pi_result piDevicePartition(pi_device Device,
2765  const pi_device_partition_property *Properties,
2766  pi_uint32 NumDevices, pi_device *OutDevices,
2767  pi_uint32 *OutNumDevices) {
2768  // Other partitioning ways are not supported by Level Zero
2769  if (Properties[0] != PI_DEVICE_PARTITION_BY_AFFINITY_DOMAIN ||
2770  (Properties[1] != PI_DEVICE_AFFINITY_DOMAIN_NEXT_PARTITIONABLE &&
2771  Properties[1] != PI_DEVICE_AFFINITY_DOMAIN_NUMA)) {
2772  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
2773  }
2774 
2775  PI_ASSERT(Device, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
2776 
2777  // Devices cache is normally created in piDevicesGet but still make
2778  // sure that cache is populated.
2779  //
2780  pi_result Res = Device->Platform->populateDeviceCacheIfNeeded();
2781  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS) {
2782  return Res;
2783  }
2784 
2785  if (OutNumDevices) {
2786  *OutNumDevices = Device->SubDevices.size();
2787  }
2788 
2789  if (OutDevices) {
2790  // TODO: Consider support for partitioning to <= total sub-devices.
2791  // Currently supported partitioning (by affinity domain/numa) would always
2792  // partition to all sub-devices.
2793  //
2794  PI_ASSERT(NumDevices == Device->SubDevices.size(), PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2795 
2796  for (uint32_t I = 0; I < NumDevices; I++) {
2797  OutDevices[I] = Device->SubDevices[I];
2798  // reusing the same pi_device needs to increment the reference count
2799  PI_CALL(piDeviceRetain(OutDevices[I]));
2800  }
2801  }
2802  return PI_SUCCESS;
2803 }
2804 
2805 pi_result
2806 piextDeviceSelectBinary(pi_device Device, // TODO: does this need to be context?
2807  pi_device_binary *Binaries, pi_uint32 NumBinaries,
2808  pi_uint32 *SelectedBinaryInd) {
2809 
2810  PI_ASSERT(Device, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
2811  PI_ASSERT(SelectedBinaryInd, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2812  PI_ASSERT(NumBinaries == 0 || Binaries, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2813 
2814  // TODO: this is a bare-bones implementation for choosing a device image
2815  // that would be compatible with the targeted device. An AOT-compiled
2816  // image is preferred over SPIR-V for known devices (i.e. Intel devices)
2817  // The implementation makes no effort to differentiate between multiple images
2818  // for the given device, and simply picks the first one compatible.
2819  //
2820  // Real implementation will use the same mechanism OpenCL ICD dispatcher
2821  // uses. Something like:
2822  // PI_VALIDATE_HANDLE_RETURN_HANDLE(ctx, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
2823  // return context->dispatch->piextDeviceSelectIR(
2824  // ctx, images, num_images, selected_image);
2825  // where context->dispatch is set to the dispatch table provided by PI
2826  // plugin for platform/device the ctx was created for.
2827 
2828  // Look for GEN binary, which we known can only be handled by Level-Zero now.
2829  const char *BinaryTarget = __SYCL_PI_DEVICE_BINARY_TARGET_SPIRV64_GEN;
2830 
2831  // Find the appropriate device image, fallback to spirv if not found
2832  constexpr pi_uint32 InvalidInd = std::numeric_limits<pi_uint32>::max();
2833  pi_uint32 Spirv = InvalidInd;
2834 
2835  for (pi_uint32 i = 0; i < NumBinaries; ++i) {
2836  if (strcmp(Binaries[i]->DeviceTargetSpec, BinaryTarget) == 0) {
2837  *SelectedBinaryInd = i;
2838  return PI_SUCCESS;
2839  }
2840  if (strcmp(Binaries[i]->DeviceTargetSpec,
2841  __SYCL_PI_DEVICE_BINARY_TARGET_SPIRV64) == 0)
2842  Spirv = i;
2843  }
2844  // Points to a spirv image, if such indeed was found
2845  if ((*SelectedBinaryInd = Spirv) != InvalidInd)
2846  return PI_SUCCESS;
2847 
2848  // No image can be loaded for the given device
2849  return PI_INVALID_BINARY;
2850 }
2851 
2852 pi_result piextDeviceGetNativeHandle(pi_device Device,
2853  pi_native_handle *NativeHandle) {
2854  PI_ASSERT(Device, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
2855  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2856 
2857  auto ZeDevice = pi_cast<ze_device_handle_t *>(NativeHandle);
2858  // Extract the Level Zero module handle from the given PI device
2859  *ZeDevice = Device->ZeDevice;
2860  return PI_SUCCESS;
2861 }
2862 
2863 pi_result piextDeviceCreateWithNativeHandle(pi_native_handle NativeHandle,
2864  pi_platform Platform,
2865  pi_device *Device) {
2866  PI_ASSERT(Device, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
2867  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2868 
2869  auto ZeDevice = pi_cast<ze_device_handle_t>(NativeHandle);
2870 
2871  // The SYCL spec requires that the set of devices must remain fixed for the
2872  // duration of the application's execution. We assume that we found all of the
2873  // Level Zero devices when we initialized the platforms/devices cache, so the
2874  // "NativeHandle" must already be in the cache. If it is not, this must not be
2875  // a valid Level Zero device.
2876  //
2877  // TODO: maybe we should populate cache of platforms if it wasn't already.
2878  // For now assert that is was populated.
2879  PI_ASSERT(PiPlatformCachePopulated, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2880  const std::lock_guard<sycl::detail::SpinLock> Lock{*PiPlatformsCacheMutex};
2881 
2882  pi_device Dev = nullptr;
2883  for (auto &ThePlatform : *PiPlatformsCache) {
2884  Dev = ThePlatform->getDeviceFromNativeHandle(ZeDevice);
2885  if (Dev) {
2886  // Check that the input Platform, if was given, matches the found one.
2887  PI_ASSERT(!Platform || Platform == ThePlatform, PI_INVALID_PLATFORM);
2888  break;
2889  }
2890  }
2891 
2892  if (Dev == nullptr)
2893  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
2894 
2895  *Device = Dev;
2896  return PI_SUCCESS;
2897 }
2898 
2899 pi_result piContextCreate(const pi_context_properties *Properties,
2900  pi_uint32 NumDevices, const pi_device *Devices,
2901  void (*PFnNotify)(const char *ErrInfo,
2902  const void *PrivateInfo, size_t CB,
2903  void *UserData),
2904  void *UserData, pi_context *RetContext) {
2905  (void)Properties;
2906  (void)PFnNotify;
2907  (void)UserData;
2908  PI_ASSERT(NumDevices, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2909  PI_ASSERT(Devices, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
2910  PI_ASSERT(RetContext, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2911 
2912  pi_platform Platform = (*Devices)->Platform;
2913  ZeStruct<ze_context_desc_t> ContextDesc;
2914  ContextDesc.flags = 0;
2915 
2916  ze_context_handle_t ZeContext;
2917  ZE_CALL(zeContextCreate, (Platform->ZeDriver, &ContextDesc, &ZeContext));
2918  try {
2919  *RetContext = new _pi_context(ZeContext, NumDevices, Devices, true);
2920  (*RetContext)->initialize();
2921  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
2922  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> Lock(Platform->ContextsMutex);
2923  Platform->Contexts.push_back(*RetContext);
2924  }
2925  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
2926  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
2927  } catch (...) {
2928  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
2929  }
2930 
2931  return PI_SUCCESS;
2932 }
2933 
2934 pi_result piContextGetInfo(pi_context Context, pi_context_info ParamName,
2935  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
2936  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
2937 
2938  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
2939 
2940  ReturnHelper ReturnValue(ParamValueSize, ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet);
2941  switch (ParamName) {
2942  case PI_CONTEXT_INFO_DEVICES:
2943  return getInfoArray(Context->Devices.size(), ParamValueSize, ParamValue,
2944  ParamValueSizeRet, &Context->Devices[0]);
2945  case PI_CONTEXT_INFO_NUM_DEVICES:
2946  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32(Context->Devices.size()));
2947  case PI_CONTEXT_INFO_REFERENCE_COUNT:
2948  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Context->RefCount});
2949  case PI_CONTEXT_INFO_ATOMIC_MEMORY_SCOPE_CAPABILITIES:
2950  default:
2951  // TODO: implement other parameters
2952  die("piGetContextInfo: unsuppported ParamName.");
2953  }
2954 
2955  return PI_SUCCESS;
2956 }
2957 
2958 // FIXME: Dummy implementation to prevent link fail
2959 pi_result piextContextSetExtendedDeleter(pi_context Context,
2960  pi_context_extended_deleter Function,
2961  void *UserData) {
2962  (void)Context;
2963  (void)Function;
2964  (void)UserData;
2965  die("piextContextSetExtendedDeleter: not supported");
2966  return PI_SUCCESS;
2967 }
2968 
2969 pi_result piextContextGetNativeHandle(pi_context Context,
2970  pi_native_handle *NativeHandle) {
2971  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
2972  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2973 
2974  auto ZeContext = pi_cast<ze_context_handle_t *>(NativeHandle);
2975  // Extract the Level Zero queue handle from the given PI queue
2976  *ZeContext = Context->ZeContext;
2977  return PI_SUCCESS;
2978 }
2979 
2980 pi_result piextContextCreateWithNativeHandle(pi_native_handle NativeHandle,
2981  pi_uint32 NumDevices,
2982  const pi_device *Devices,
2983  bool OwnNativeHandle,
2984  pi_context *RetContext) {
2985  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2986  PI_ASSERT(Devices, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
2987  PI_ASSERT(RetContext, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2988  PI_ASSERT(NumDevices, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
2989 
2990  try {
2991  *RetContext = new _pi_context(pi_cast<ze_context_handle_t>(NativeHandle),
2992  NumDevices, Devices, OwnNativeHandle);
2993  (*RetContext)->initialize();
2994  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
2995  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
2996  } catch (...) {
2997  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
2998  }
2999 
3000  return PI_SUCCESS;
3001 }
3002 
3003 pi_result piContextRetain(pi_context Context) {
3004 
3005  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
3006 
3007  ++(Context->RefCount);
3008  return PI_SUCCESS;
3009 }
3010 
3011 // Helper function to release the context, a caller must lock the platform-level
3012 // mutex guarding the container with contexts because the context can be removed
3013 // from the list of tracked contexts.
3014 pi_result ContextReleaseHelper(pi_context Context) {
3015 
3016  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
3017 
3018  if (--(Context->RefCount) == 0) {
3019  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
3020  pi_platform Plt = Context->Devices[0]->Platform;
3021  auto &Contexts = Plt->Contexts;
3022  auto It = std::find(Contexts.begin(), Contexts.end(), Context);
3023  if (It != Contexts.end())
3024  Contexts.erase(It);
3025  }
3026  ze_context_handle_t DestoryZeContext =
3027  Context->OwnZeContext ? Context->ZeContext : nullptr;
3028 
3029  // Clean up any live memory associated with Context
3030  pi_result Result = Context->finalize();
3031 
3032  // We must delete Context first and then destroy zeContext because
3033  // Context deallocation requires ZeContext in some member deallocation of
3034  // pi_context.
3035  delete Context;
3036 
3037  // Destruction of some members of pi_context uses L0 context
3038  // and therefore it must be valid at that point.
3039  // Technically it should be placed to the destructor of pi_context
3040  // but this makes API error handling more complex.
3041  if (DestoryZeContext)
3042  ZE_CALL(zeContextDestroy, (DestoryZeContext));
3043 
3044  return Result;
3045  }
3046  return PI_SUCCESS;
3047 }
3048 
3049 pi_result piContextRelease(pi_context Context) {
3050  pi_platform Plt = Context->Devices[0]->Platform;
3051  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> ContextsLock(Plt->ContextsMutex,
3052  std::defer_lock);
3053  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled)
3054  ContextsLock.lock();
3055 
3056  return ContextReleaseHelper(Context);
3057 }
3058 
3059 pi_result piQueueCreate(pi_context Context, pi_device Device,
3060  pi_queue_properties Properties, pi_queue *Queue) {
3061 
3062  // Check that unexpected bits are not set.
3063  PI_ASSERT(!(Properties & ~(PI_QUEUE_OUT_OF_ORDER_EXEC_MODE_ENABLE |
3064  PI_QUEUE_PROFILING_ENABLE | PI_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE |
3065  PI_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE_DEFAULT)),
3066  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
3067 
3068  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
3069  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
3070  PI_ASSERT(Device, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
3071 
3072  if (std::find(Context->Devices.begin(), Context->Devices.end(), Device) ==
3073  Context->Devices.end()) {
3074  return PI_INVALID_DEVICE;
3075  }
3076 
3077  // Create placeholder queues in the compute queue group.
3078  // Actual L0 queues will be created at first use.
3079  std::vector<ze_command_queue_handle_t> ZeComputeCommandQueues(
3080  Device->QueueGroup[_pi_queue::queue_type::Compute].ZeProperties.numQueues,
3081  nullptr);
3082 
3083  // Create placeholder queues in the copy queue group (main and link
3084  // native groups are combined into one group).
3085  // Actual L0 queues will be created at first use.
3086  size_t NumCopyGroups = 0;
3087  if (Device->hasMainCopyEngine()) {
3088  NumCopyGroups += Device->QueueGroup[_pi_queue::queue_type::MainCopy]
3089  .ZeProperties.numQueues;
3090  }
3091  if (Device->hasLinkCopyEngine()) {
3092  NumCopyGroups += Device->QueueGroup[_pi_queue::queue_type::LinkCopy]
3093  .ZeProperties.numQueues;
3094  }
3095  std::vector<ze_command_queue_handle_t> ZeCopyCommandQueues(NumCopyGroups,
3096  nullptr);
3097 
3098  try {
3099  *Queue = new _pi_queue(ZeComputeCommandQueues, ZeCopyCommandQueues, Context,
3100  Device, true, Properties);
3101  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
3102  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
3103  } catch (...) {
3104  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
3105  }
3106  return PI_SUCCESS;
3107 }
3108 
3109 pi_result piQueueGetInfo(pi_queue Queue, pi_queue_info ParamName,
3110  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
3111  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
3112 
3113  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
3114 
3115  ReturnHelper ReturnValue(ParamValueSize, ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet);
3116  // TODO: consider support for queue properties and size
3117  switch (ParamName) {
3118  case PI_QUEUE_INFO_CONTEXT:
3119  return ReturnValue(Queue->Context);
3120  case PI_QUEUE_INFO_DEVICE:
3121  return ReturnValue(Queue->Device);
3122  case PI_QUEUE_INFO_REFERENCE_COUNT:
3123  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Queue->RefCount});
3124  case PI_QUEUE_INFO_PROPERTIES:
3125  die("PI_QUEUE_INFO_PROPERTIES in piQueueGetInfo not implemented\n");
3126  break;
3127  case PI_QUEUE_INFO_SIZE:
3128  die("PI_QUEUE_INFO_SIZE in piQueueGetInfo not implemented\n");
3129  break;
3130  case PI_QUEUE_INFO_DEVICE_DEFAULT:
3131  die("PI_QUEUE_INFO_DEVICE_DEFAULT in piQueueGetInfo not implemented\n");
3132  break;
3133  default:
3134  zePrint("Unsupported ParamName in piQueueGetInfo: ParamName=%d(0x%x)\n",
3135  ParamName, ParamName);
3136  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
3137  }
3138 
3139  return PI_SUCCESS;
3140 }
3141 
3142 pi_result piQueueRetain(pi_queue Queue) {
3143  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
3144  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
3145  Queue->RefCountExternal++;
3146  piQueueRetainNoLock(Queue);
3147  return PI_SUCCESS;
3148 }
3149 
3150 pi_result piQueueRelease(pi_queue Queue) {
3151  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
3152  {
3153  // Have this scope such that the lock is released before the
3154  // queue is potentially deleted in QueueRelease.
3155  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
3156  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
3157 
3158  Queue->RefCountExternal--;
3159  if (Queue->RefCountExternal == 0) {
3160  // When external reference count goes to zero it is still possible
3161  // that internal references still exists, e.g. command-lists that
3162  // are not yet completed. So do full queue synchronization here
3163  // and perform proper cleanup.
3164  //
3165  // It is possible to get to here and still have an open command list
3166  // if no wait or finish ever occurred for this queue.
3167  if (auto Res = Queue->executeAllOpenCommandLists())
3168  return Res;
3169 
3170  // Make sure all commands get executed.
3171  // Only do so for a healthy queue as otherwise sync may not be valid.
3172  if (Queue->Healthy) {
3173  for (auto &ZeQueue : Queue->ComputeQueueGroup.ZeQueues) {
3174  if (ZeQueue)
3175  ZE_CALL(zeHostSynchronize, (ZeQueue));
3176  }
3177  for (auto &ZeQueue : Queue->CopyQueueGroup.ZeQueues) {
3178  if (ZeQueue)
3179  ZE_CALL(zeHostSynchronize, (ZeQueue));
3180  }
3181  }
3182 
3183  // Destroy all the fences created associated with this queue.
3184  for (auto it = Queue->CommandListMap.begin();
3185  it != Queue->CommandListMap.end(); ++it) {
3186  // This fence wasn't yet signalled when we polled it for recycling
3187  // the command-list, so need to release the command-list too.
3188  if (it->second.InUse) {
3189  Queue->resetCommandList(it, true);
3190  }
3191  // TODO: remove "if" when the problem is fixed in the level zero
3192  // runtime. Destroy only if a queue is healthy. Destroying a fence may
3193  // cause a hang otherwise.
3194  if (Queue->Healthy)
3195  ZE_CALL(zeFenceDestroy, (it->second.ZeFence));
3196  }
3197  Queue->CommandListMap.clear();
3198  }
3199  }
3200  PI_CALL(QueueRelease(Queue, nullptr));
3201  return PI_SUCCESS;
3202 }
3203 
3204 static pi_result QueueRelease(pi_queue Queue, pi_queue LockedQueue) {
3205  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
3206  PI_ASSERT(Queue->RefCount, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
3207 
3208  // We need to use a bool variable here to check the condition that
3209  // RefCount becomes zero atomically with Queue->Mutex lock.
3210  // Then, we can release the lock before we remove the Queue below.
3211  bool RefCountZero = false;
3212  {
3213  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
3214  auto Lock = ((Queue == LockedQueue) ? std::unique_lock<pi_shared_mutex>()
3215  : std::unique_lock(Queue->Mutex));
3216 
3217  Queue->RefCount--;
3218  if (Queue->RefCount == 0) {
3219  RefCountZero = true;
3220 
3221  if (Queue->OwnZeCommandQueue) {
3222  for (auto &ZeQueue : Queue->ComputeQueueGroup.ZeQueues) {
3223  if (ZeQueue)
3224  ZE_CALL(zeCommandQueueDestroy, (ZeQueue));
3225  }
3226  for (auto &ZeQueue : Queue->CopyQueueGroup.ZeQueues) {
3227  if (ZeQueue)
3228  ZE_CALL(zeCommandQueueDestroy, (ZeQueue));
3229  }
3230  }
3231 
3232  zePrint("piQueueRelease(compute) NumTimesClosedFull %d, "
3233  "NumTimesClosedEarly %d\n",
3234  Queue->ComputeCommandBatch.NumTimesClosedFull,
3235  Queue->ComputeCommandBatch.NumTimesClosedEarly);
3236  zePrint("piQueueRelease(copy) NumTimesClosedFull %d, NumTimesClosedEarly "
3237  "%d\n",
3238  Queue->CopyCommandBatch.NumTimesClosedFull,
3239  Queue->CopyCommandBatch.NumTimesClosedEarly);
3240  }
3241  }
3242  if (RefCountZero)
3243  delete Queue;
3244 
3245  return PI_SUCCESS;
3246 }
3247 
3248 pi_result piQueueFinish(pi_queue Queue) {
3249  // Wait until command lists attached to the command queue are executed.
3250  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
3251 
3252  std::vector<ze_command_queue_handle_t> ZeQueues;
3253  {
3254  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
3255  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
3256 
3257  // execute any command list that may still be open.
3258  if (auto Res = Queue->executeAllOpenCommandLists())
3259  return Res;
3260 
3261  // Make a copy of queues to sync and release the lock.
3262  ZeQueues = Queue->CopyQueueGroup.ZeQueues;
3263  std::copy(Queue->ComputeQueueGroup.ZeQueues.begin(),
3264  Queue->ComputeQueueGroup.ZeQueues.end(),
3265  std::back_inserter(ZeQueues));
3266  }
3267 
3268  // Don't hold a lock to the queue's mutex while waiting.
3269  // This allows continue working with the queue from other threads.
3270  for (auto ZeQueue : ZeQueues) {
3271  if (ZeQueue)
3272  ZE_CALL(zeHostSynchronize, (ZeQueue));
3273  }
3274 
3275  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
3276  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
3277  // Prevent unneeded already finished events to show up in the wait list.
3278  Queue->LastCommandEvent = nullptr;
3279 
3280  return PI_SUCCESS;
3281 }
3282 
3283 // Flushing cross-queue dependencies is covered by createAndRetainPiZeEventList,
3284 // so this can be left as a no-op.
3285 pi_result piQueueFlush(pi_queue Queue) {
3286  (void)Queue;
3287  return PI_SUCCESS;
3288 }
3289 
3290 pi_result piextQueueGetNativeHandle(pi_queue Queue,
3291  pi_native_handle *NativeHandle) {
3292  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
3293  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
3294 
3295  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
3296  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
3297 
3298  auto ZeQueue = pi_cast<ze_command_queue_handle_t *>(NativeHandle);
3299  // Extract the Level Zero compute queue handle from the given PI queue
3300  *ZeQueue = Queue->ComputeQueueGroup.ZeQueues[0];
3301  return PI_SUCCESS;
3302 }
3303 
3304 pi_result piextQueueCreateWithNativeHandle(pi_native_handle NativeHandle,
3305  pi_context Context, pi_queue *Queue,
3306  bool OwnNativeHandle) {
3307  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
3308  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
3309  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
3310 
3311  auto ZeQueue = pi_cast<ze_command_queue_handle_t>(NativeHandle);
3312  // Assume this is the "0" index queue in the compute command-group.
3313  std::vector<ze_command_queue_handle_t> ZeQueues{ZeQueue};
3314 
3315  // Attach the queue to the "0" device.
3316  // TODO: see if we need to let user choose the device.
3317  pi_device Device = Context->Devices[0];
3318  // TODO: see what we can do to correctly initialize PI queue for
3319  // compute vs. copy Level-Zero queue. Currently we will send
3320  // all commands to the "ZeQueue".
3321  std::vector<ze_command_queue_handle_t> ZeroCopyQueues;
3322  *Queue =
3323  new _pi_queue(ZeQueues, ZeroCopyQueues, Context, Device, OwnNativeHandle);
3324  return PI_SUCCESS;
3325 }
3326 
3327 // If indirect access tracking is enabled then performs reference counting,
3328 // otherwise just calls zeMemAllocDevice.
3329 static pi_result ZeDeviceMemAllocHelper(void **ResultPtr, pi_context Context,
3330  pi_device Device, size_t Size) {
3331  pi_platform Plt = Device->Platform;
3332  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> ContextsLock(Plt->ContextsMutex,
3333  std::defer_lock);
3334  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
3335  // Lock the mutex which is guarding contexts container in the platform.
3336  // This prevents new kernels from being submitted in any context while
3337  // we are in the process of allocating a memory, this is needed to
3338  // properly capture allocations by kernels with indirect access.
3339  ContextsLock.lock();
3340  // We are going to defer memory release if there are kernels with
3341  // indirect access, that is why explicitly retain context to be sure
3342  // that it is released after all memory allocations in this context are
3343  // released.
3344  PI_CALL(piContextRetain(Context));
3345  }
3346 
3347  ze_device_mem_alloc_desc_t ZeDesc = {};
3348  ZeDesc.flags = 0;
3349  ZeDesc.ordinal = 0;
3350  ZE_CALL(zeMemAllocDevice,
3351  (Context->ZeContext, &ZeDesc, Size, 1, Device->ZeDevice, ResultPtr));
3352 
3353  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
3354  // Keep track of all memory allocations in the context
3355  Context->MemAllocs.emplace(std::piecewise_construct,
3356  std::forward_as_tuple(*ResultPtr),
3357  std::forward_as_tuple(Context));
3358  }
3359  return PI_SUCCESS;
3360 }
3361 
3362 // If indirect access tracking is enabled then performs reference counting,
3363 // otherwise just calls zeMemAllocHost.
3364 static pi_result ZeHostMemAllocHelper(void **ResultPtr, pi_context Context,
3365  size_t Size) {
3366  pi_platform Plt = Context->Devices[0]->Platform;
3367  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> ContextsLock(Plt->ContextsMutex,
3368  std::defer_lock);
3369  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
3370  // Lock the mutex which is guarding contexts container in the platform.
3371  // This prevents new kernels from being submitted in any context while
3372  // we are in the process of allocating a memory, this is needed to
3373  // properly capture allocations by kernels with indirect access.
3374  ContextsLock.lock();
3375  // We are going to defer memory release if there are kernels with
3376  // indirect access, that is why explicitly retain context to be sure
3377  // that it is released after all memory allocations in this context are
3378  // released.
3379  PI_CALL(piContextRetain(Context));
3380  }
3381 
3382  ze_host_mem_alloc_desc_t ZeDesc = {};
3383  ZeDesc.flags = 0;
3384  ZE_CALL(zeMemAllocHost, (Context->ZeContext, &ZeDesc, Size, 1, ResultPtr));
3385 
3386  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
3387  // Keep track of all memory allocations in the context
3388  Context->MemAllocs.emplace(std::piecewise_construct,
3389  std::forward_as_tuple(*ResultPtr),
3390  std::forward_as_tuple(Context));
3391  }
3392  return PI_SUCCESS;
3393 }
3394 
3395 pi_result piMemBufferCreate(pi_context Context, pi_mem_flags Flags, size_t Size,
3396  void *HostPtr, pi_mem *RetMem,
3397  const pi_mem_properties *properties) {
3398 
3399  // TODO: implement support for more access modes
3400  if (!((Flags & PI_MEM_FLAGS_ACCESS_RW) ||
3401  (Flags & PI_MEM_ACCESS_READ_ONLY))) {
3402  die("piMemBufferCreate: Level-Zero supports read-write and read-only "
3403  "buffer,"
3404  "but not other accesses (such as write-only) yet.");
3405  }
3406 
3407  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
3408  PI_ASSERT(RetMem, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
3409 
3410  if (properties != nullptr) {
3411  die("piMemBufferCreate: no mem properties goes to Level-Zero RT yet");
3412  }
3413 
3414  void *Ptr = nullptr;
3415 
3416  // We treat integrated devices (physical memory shared with the CPU)
3417  // differently from discrete devices (those with distinct memories).
3418  // For integrated devices, allocating the buffer in host shared memory
3419  // enables automatic access from the device, and makes copying
3420  // unnecessary in the map/unmap operations. This improves performance.
3421  bool DeviceIsIntegrated = Context->Devices.size() == 1 &&
3422  Context->Devices[0]->ZeDeviceProperties->flags &
3423  ZE_DEVICE_PROPERTY_FLAG_INTEGRATED;
3424 
3425  if (Flags & PI_MEM_FLAGS_HOST_PTR_ALLOC) {
3426  // Having PI_MEM_FLAGS_HOST_PTR_ALLOC for buffer requires allocation of
3427  // pinned host memory, see:
3428  // sycl/doc/extensions/supported/sycl_ext_oneapi_use_pinned_host_memory_property.asciidoc
3429  // We are however missing such functionality in Level Zero, so we just
3430  // ignore the flag for now.
3431  //
3432  }
3433 
3434  // Choose an alignment that is at most 64 and is the next power of 2 for sizes
3435  // less than 64.
3436  auto Alignment = Size;
3437  if (Alignment > 32UL)
3438  Alignment = 64UL;
3439  else if (Alignment > 16UL)
3440  Alignment = 32UL;
3441  else if (Alignment > 8UL)
3442  Alignment = 16UL;
3443  else if (Alignment > 4UL)
3444  Alignment = 8UL;
3445  else if (Alignment > 2UL)
3446  Alignment = 4UL;
3447  else if (Alignment > 1UL)
3448  Alignment = 2UL;
3449  else
3450  Alignment = 1UL;
3451 
3452  // If USM Import feature is enabled and hostptr is supplied,
3453  // import the hostptr if not already imported into USM.
3454  // Data transfer rate is maximized when both source and destination
3455  // are USM pointers. Promotion of the host pointer to USM thus
3456  // optimizes data transfer performance.
3457  bool HostPtrImported = false;
3458  if (ZeUSMImport.Enabled && HostPtr != nullptr &&
3459  (Flags & PI_MEM_FLAGS_HOST_PTR_USE) != 0) {
3460  // Query memory type of the host pointer
3461  ze_device_handle_t ZeDeviceHandle;
3462  ZeStruct<ze_memory_allocation_properties_t> ZeMemoryAllocationProperties;
3463  ZE_CALL(zeMemGetAllocProperties,
3464  (Context->ZeContext, HostPtr, &ZeMemoryAllocationProperties,
3465  &ZeDeviceHandle));
3466 
3467  // If not shared of any type, we can import the ptr
3468  if (ZeMemoryAllocationProperties.type == ZE_MEMORY_TYPE_UNKNOWN) {
3469  // Promote the host ptr to USM host memory
3470  ze_driver_handle_t driverHandle = Context->Devices[0]->Platform->ZeDriver;
3471  ZeUSMImport.doZeUSMImport(driverHandle, HostPtr, Size);
3472  HostPtrImported = true;
3473  }
3474  }
3475 
3476  pi_result Result = PI_SUCCESS;
3477  if (DeviceIsIntegrated) {
3478  if (HostPtrImported) {
3479  // When HostPtr is imported we use it for the buffer.
3480  Ptr = HostPtr;
3481  } else {
3482  if (enableBufferPooling()) {
3483  PI_CALL(piextUSMHostAlloc(&Ptr, Context, nullptr, Size, Alignment));
3484  } else {
3485  Result = ZeHostMemAllocHelper(&Ptr, Context, Size);
3486  }
3487  }
3488  } else if (Context->SingleRootDevice) {
3489  // If we have a single discrete device or all devices in the context are
3490  // sub-devices of the same device then we can allocate on device
3491  if (enableBufferPooling()) {
3492  PI_CALL(piextUSMDeviceAlloc(&Ptr, Context, Context->SingleRootDevice,
3493  nullptr, Size, Alignment));
3494  } else {
3495  Result = ZeDeviceMemAllocHelper(&Ptr, Context, Context->SingleRootDevice,
3496  Size);
3497  }
3498  } else {
3499  // Context with several gpu cards. Temporarily use host allocation because
3500  // it is accessible by all devices. But it is not good in terms of
3501  // performance.
3502  // TODO: We need to either allow remote access to device memory using IPC,
3503  // or do explicit memory transfers from one device to another using host
3504  // resources as backing buffers to allow those transfers.
3505  if (HostPtrImported) {
3506  // When HostPtr is imported we use it for the buffer.
3507  Ptr = HostPtr;
3508  } else {
3509  if (enableBufferPooling()) {
3510  PI_CALL(piextUSMHostAlloc(&Ptr, Context, nullptr, Size, Alignment));
3511  } else {
3512  Result = ZeHostMemAllocHelper(&Ptr, Context, Size);
3513  }
3514  }
3515  }
3516 
3517  if (Result != PI_SUCCESS)
3518  return Result;
3519 
3520  if (HostPtr) {
3521  if ((Flags & PI_MEM_FLAGS_HOST_PTR_USE) != 0 ||
3522  (Flags & PI_MEM_FLAGS_HOST_PTR_COPY) != 0) {
3523  // Initialize the buffer with user data
3524  if (DeviceIsIntegrated) {
3525  // Do a host to host copy.
3526  // For an imported HostPtr the copy is unneeded.
3527  if (!HostPtrImported)
3528  memcpy(Ptr, HostPtr, Size);
3529  } else if (Context->SingleRootDevice) {
3530  // Initialize the buffer synchronously with immediate offload
3531  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendMemoryCopy,
3532  (Context->ZeCommandListInit, Ptr, HostPtr, Size, nullptr, 0,
3533  nullptr));
3534  } else {
3535  // Multiple root devices, do a host to host copy because we use a host
3536  // allocation for this case.
3537  // For an imported HostPtr the copy is unneeded.
3538  if (!HostPtrImported)
3539  memcpy(Ptr, HostPtr, Size);
3540  }
3541  } else if (Flags == 0 || (Flags == PI_MEM_FLAGS_ACCESS_RW)) {
3542  // Nothing more to do.
3543  } else {
3544  die("piMemBufferCreate: not implemented");
3545  }
3546  }
3547 
3548  auto HostPtrOrNull =
3549  (Flags & PI_MEM_FLAGS_HOST_PTR_USE) ? pi_cast<char *>(HostPtr) : nullptr;
3550  try {
3551  *RetMem = new _pi_buffer(
3552  Context, pi_cast<char *>(Ptr) /* Level Zero Memory Handle */,
3553  HostPtrOrNull, nullptr, 0, 0,
3554  DeviceIsIntegrated /* allocation in host memory */, HostPtrImported);
3555  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
3556  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
3557  } catch (...) {
3558  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
3559  }
3560 
3561  return PI_SUCCESS;
3562 }
3563 
3564 pi_result piMemGetInfo(pi_mem Mem,
3565  cl_mem_info ParamName, // TODO: untie from OpenCL
3566  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
3567  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
3568  (void)Mem;
3569  (void)ParamName;
3570  (void)ParamValueSize;
3571  (void)ParamValue;
3572  (void)ParamValueSizeRet;
3573  die("piMemGetInfo: not implemented");
3574  return {};
3575 }
3576 
3577 pi_result piMemRetain(pi_mem Mem) {
3578  PI_ASSERT(Mem, PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
3579 
3580  std::scoped_lock Guard(Mem->Mutex);
3581  ++(Mem->RefCount);
3582  return PI_SUCCESS;
3583 }
3584 
3585 // If indirect access tracking is not enabled then this functions just performs
3586 // zeMemFree. If indirect access tracking is enabled then reference counting is
3587 // performed.
3588 static pi_result ZeMemFreeHelper(pi_context Context, void *Ptr) {
3589  pi_platform Plt = Context->Devices[0]->Platform;
3590  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> ContextsLock(Plt->ContextsMutex,
3591  std::defer_lock);
3592  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
3593  ContextsLock.lock();
3594  auto It = Context->MemAllocs.find(Ptr);
3595  if (It == std::end(Context->MemAllocs)) {
3596  die("All memory allocations must be tracked!");
3597  }
3598  if (--(It->second.RefCount) != 0) {
3599  // Memory can't be deallocated yet.
3600  return PI_SUCCESS;
3601  }
3602 
3603  // Reference count is zero, it is ok to free memory.
3604  // We don't need to track this allocation anymore.
3605  Context->MemAllocs.erase(It);
3606  }
3607 
3608  ZE_CALL(zeMemFree, (Context->ZeContext, Ptr));
3609 
3610  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled)
3611  PI_CALL(ContextReleaseHelper(Context));
3612 
3613  return PI_SUCCESS;
3614 }
3615 
3616 pi_result piMemRelease(pi_mem Mem) {
3617  PI_ASSERT(Mem, PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
3618  bool RefCountZero = false;
3619  {
3620  std::scoped_lock Guard(Mem->Mutex);
3621  if (--(Mem->RefCount) == 0) {
3622  if (Mem->isImage()) {
3623  ZE_CALL(zeImageDestroy,
3624  (pi_cast<ze_image_handle_t>(Mem->getZeHandle())));
3625  } else {
3626  auto Buf = static_cast<_pi_buffer *>(Mem);
3627  if (!Buf->isSubBuffer()) {
3628  if (Mem->HostPtrImported) {
3629  ze_driver_handle_t driverHandle =
3630  Mem->Context->Devices[0]->Platform->ZeDriver;
3631  ZeUSMImport.doZeUSMRelease(driverHandle, Mem->MapHostPtr);
3632  } else {
3633  if (enableBufferPooling()) {
3634  PI_CALL(piextUSMFree(Mem->Context, Mem->getZeHandle()));
3635  } else {
3636  if (auto Res = ZeMemFreeHelper(Mem->Context, Mem->getZeHandle()))
3637  return Res;
3638  }
3639  }
3640  }
3641  RefCountZero = true;
3642  }
3643  }
3644  }
3645 
3646  if (RefCountZero)
3647  delete Mem;
3648 
3649  return PI_SUCCESS;
3650 }
3651 
3652 pi_result piMemImageCreate(pi_context Context, pi_mem_flags Flags,
3653  const pi_image_format *ImageFormat,
3654  const pi_image_desc *ImageDesc, void *HostPtr,
3655  pi_mem *RetImage) {
3656 
3657  // TODO: implement read-only, write-only
3658  if ((Flags & PI_MEM_FLAGS_ACCESS_RW) == 0) {
3659  die("piMemImageCreate: Level-Zero implements only read-write buffer,"
3660  "no read-only or write-only yet.");
3661  }
3662  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
3663  PI_ASSERT(RetImage, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
3664  PI_ASSERT(ImageFormat, PI_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT_DESCRIPTOR);
3665 
3666  ze_image_format_type_t ZeImageFormatType;
3667  size_t ZeImageFormatTypeSize;
3668  switch (ImageFormat->image_channel_data_type) {
3669  case CL_FLOAT:
3670  ZeImageFormatType = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_TYPE_FLOAT;
3671  ZeImageFormatTypeSize = 32;
3672  break;
3673  case CL_HALF_FLOAT:
3674  ZeImageFormatType = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_TYPE_FLOAT;
3675  ZeImageFormatTypeSize = 16;
3676  break;
3677  case CL_UNSIGNED_INT32:
3678  ZeImageFormatType = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_TYPE_UINT;
3679  ZeImageFormatTypeSize = 32;
3680  break;
3681  case CL_UNSIGNED_INT16:
3682  ZeImageFormatType = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_TYPE_UINT;
3683  ZeImageFormatTypeSize = 16;
3684  break;
3685  case CL_UNSIGNED_INT8:
3686  ZeImageFormatType = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_TYPE_UINT;
3687  ZeImageFormatTypeSize = 8;
3688  break;
3689  case CL_UNORM_INT16:
3690  ZeImageFormatType = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_TYPE_UNORM;
3691  ZeImageFormatTypeSize = 16;
3692  break;
3693  case CL_UNORM_INT8:
3694  ZeImageFormatType = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_TYPE_UNORM;
3695  ZeImageFormatTypeSize = 8;
3696  break;
3697  case CL_SIGNED_INT32:
3698  ZeImageFormatType = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_TYPE_SINT;
3699  ZeImageFormatTypeSize = 32;
3700  break;
3701  case CL_SIGNED_INT16:
3702  ZeImageFormatType = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_TYPE_SINT;
3703  ZeImageFormatTypeSize = 16;
3704  break;
3705  case CL_SIGNED_INT8:
3706  ZeImageFormatType = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_TYPE_SINT;
3707  ZeImageFormatTypeSize = 8;
3708  break;
3709  case CL_SNORM_INT16:
3710  ZeImageFormatType = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_TYPE_SNORM;
3711  ZeImageFormatTypeSize = 16;
3712  break;
3713  case CL_SNORM_INT8:
3714  ZeImageFormatType = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_TYPE_SNORM;
3715  ZeImageFormatTypeSize = 8;
3716  break;
3717  default:
3718  zePrint("piMemImageCreate: unsupported image data type: data type = %d\n",
3719  ImageFormat->image_channel_data_type);
3720  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
3721  }
3722 
3723  // TODO: populate the layout mapping
3724  ze_image_format_layout_t ZeImageFormatLayout;
3725  switch (ImageFormat->image_channel_order) {
3726  case CL_RGBA:
3727  switch (ZeImageFormatTypeSize) {
3728  case 8:
3729  ZeImageFormatLayout = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_LAYOUT_8_8_8_8;
3730  break;
3731  case 16:
3732  ZeImageFormatLayout = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_LAYOUT_16_16_16_16;
3733  break;
3734  case 32:
3735  ZeImageFormatLayout = ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_LAYOUT_32_32_32_32;
3736  break;
3737  default:
3738  zePrint("piMemImageCreate: unexpected data type Size\n");
3739  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
3740  }
3741  break;
3742  default:
3743  zePrint("format layout = %d\n", ImageFormat->image_channel_order);
3744  die("piMemImageCreate: unsupported image format layout\n");
3745  break;
3746  }
3747 
3748  ze_image_format_t ZeFormatDesc = {
3749  ZeImageFormatLayout, ZeImageFormatType,
3750  // TODO: are swizzles deducted from image_format->image_channel_order?
3751  ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_SWIZZLE_R, ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_SWIZZLE_G,
3752  ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_SWIZZLE_B, ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_SWIZZLE_A};
3753 
3754  ze_image_type_t ZeImageType;
3755  switch (ImageDesc->image_type) {
3756  case PI_MEM_TYPE_IMAGE1D:
3757  ZeImageType = ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_1D;
3758  break;
3759  case PI_MEM_TYPE_IMAGE2D:
3760  ZeImageType = ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_2D;
3761  break;
3762  case PI_MEM_TYPE_IMAGE3D:
3763  ZeImageType = ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_3D;
3764  break;
3765  case PI_MEM_TYPE_IMAGE1D_ARRAY:
3766  ZeImageType = ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_1DARRAY;
3767  break;
3768  case PI_MEM_TYPE_IMAGE2D_ARRAY:
3769  ZeImageType = ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_2DARRAY;
3770  break;
3771  default:
3772  zePrint("piMemImageCreate: unsupported image type\n");
3773  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
3774  }
3775 
3776  ZeStruct<ze_image_desc_t> ZeImageDesc;
3777  ZeImageDesc.arraylevels = ZeImageDesc.flags = 0;
3778  ZeImageDesc.type = ZeImageType;
3779  ZeImageDesc.format = ZeFormatDesc;
3780  ZeImageDesc.width = pi_cast<uint32_t>(ImageDesc->image_width);
3781  ZeImageDesc.height = pi_cast<uint32_t>(ImageDesc->image_height);
3782  ZeImageDesc.depth = pi_cast<uint32_t>(ImageDesc->image_depth);
3783  ZeImageDesc.arraylevels = pi_cast<uint32_t>(ImageDesc->image_array_size);
3784  ZeImageDesc.miplevels = ImageDesc->num_mip_levels;
3785 
3786  // Currently we have the "0" device in context with mutliple root devices to
3787  // own the image.
3788  // TODO: Implement explicit copying for acessing the image from other devices
3789  // in the context.
3790  pi_device Device = Context->SingleRootDevice ? Context->SingleRootDevice
3791  : Context->Devices[0];
3792  ze_image_handle_t ZeHImage;
3793  ZE_CALL(zeImageCreate,
3794  (Context->ZeContext, Device->ZeDevice, &ZeImageDesc, &ZeHImage));
3795 
3796  auto HostPtrOrNull =
3797  (Flags & PI_MEM_FLAGS_HOST_PTR_USE) ? pi_cast<char *>(HostPtr) : nullptr;
3798 
3799  try {
3800  auto ZePIImage = new _pi_image(Context, ZeHImage, HostPtrOrNull);
3801 
3802 #ifndef NDEBUG
3803  ZePIImage->ZeImageDesc = ZeImageDesc;
3804 #endif // !NDEBUG
3805 
3806  if ((Flags & PI_MEM_FLAGS_HOST_PTR_USE) != 0 ||
3807  (Flags & PI_MEM_FLAGS_HOST_PTR_COPY) != 0) {
3808  // Initialize image synchronously with immediate offload
3809  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendImageCopyFromMemory,
3810  (Context->ZeCommandListInit, ZeHImage, HostPtr, nullptr, nullptr,
3811  0, nullptr));
3812  }
3813 
3814  *RetImage = ZePIImage;
3815  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
3816  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
3817  } catch (...) {
3818  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
3819  }
3820  return PI_SUCCESS;
3821 }
3822 
3823 pi_result piextMemGetNativeHandle(pi_mem Mem, pi_native_handle *NativeHandle) {
3824  PI_ASSERT(Mem, PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
3825  std::shared_lock Guard(Mem->Mutex);
3826  *NativeHandle = pi_cast<pi_native_handle>(Mem->getZeHandle());
3827  return PI_SUCCESS;
3828 }
3829 
3830 pi_result piextMemCreateWithNativeHandle(pi_native_handle NativeHandle,
3831  pi_mem *Mem) {
3832  (void)NativeHandle;
3833  (void)Mem;
3834  die("piextMemCreateWithNativeHandle: not supported");
3835  return PI_SUCCESS;
3836 }
3837 
3838 pi_result piProgramCreate(pi_context Context, const void *ILBytes,
3839  size_t Length, pi_program *Program) {
3840 
3841  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
3842  PI_ASSERT(ILBytes && Length, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
3843  PI_ASSERT(Program, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
3844 
3845  // NOTE: the Level Zero module creation is also building the program, so we
3846  // are deferring it until the program is ready to be built.
3847 
3848  try {
3849  *Program = new _pi_program(_pi_program::IL, Context, ILBytes, Length);
3850  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
3851  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
3852  } catch (...) {
3853  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
3854  }
3855  return PI_SUCCESS;
3856 }
3857 
3858 pi_result piProgramCreateWithBinary(
3859  pi_context Context, pi_uint32 NumDevices, const pi_device *DeviceList,
3860  const size_t *Lengths, const unsigned char **Binaries,
3861  size_t NumMetadataEntries, const pi_device_binary_property *Metadata,
3862  pi_int32 *BinaryStatus, pi_program *Program) {
3863  (void)Metadata;
3864  (void)NumMetadataEntries;
3865 
3866  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
3867  PI_ASSERT(DeviceList && NumDevices, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
3868  PI_ASSERT(Binaries && Lengths, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
3869  PI_ASSERT(Program, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
3870 
3871  // For now we support only one device.
3872  if (NumDevices != 1) {
3873  zePrint("piProgramCreateWithBinary: level_zero supports only one device.");
3874  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
3875  }
3876  if (!Binaries[0] || !Lengths[0]) {
3877  if (BinaryStatus)
3878  *BinaryStatus = PI_INVALID_VALUE;
3879  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
3880  }
3881 
3882  size_t Length = Lengths[0];
3883  auto Binary = Binaries[0];
3884 
3885  // In OpenCL, clCreateProgramWithBinary() can be used to load any of the
3886  // following: "program executable", "compiled program", or "library of
3887  // compiled programs". In addition, the loaded program can be either
3888  // IL (SPIR-v) or native device code. For now, we assume that
3889  // piProgramCreateWithBinary() is only used to load a "program executable"
3890  // as native device code.
3891  // If we wanted to support all the same cases as OpenCL, we would need to
3892  // somehow examine the binary image to distinguish the cases. Alternatively,
3893  // we could change the PI interface and have the caller pass additional
3894  // information to distinguish the cases.
3895 
3896  try {
3897  *Program = new _pi_program(_pi_program::Native, Context, Binary, Length);
3898  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
3899  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
3900  } catch (...) {
3901  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
3902  }
3903 
3904  if (BinaryStatus)
3905  *BinaryStatus = PI_SUCCESS;
3906  return PI_SUCCESS;
3907 }
3908 
3909 pi_result piclProgramCreateWithSource(pi_context Context, pi_uint32 Count,
3910  const char **Strings,
3911  const size_t *Lengths,
3912  pi_program *RetProgram) {
3913 
3914  (void)Context;
3915  (void)Count;
3916  (void)Strings;
3917  (void)Lengths;
3918  (void)RetProgram;
3919  zePrint("piclProgramCreateWithSource: not supported in Level Zero\n");
3920  return PI_INVALID_OPERATION;
3921 }
3922 
3923 pi_result piProgramGetInfo(pi_program Program, pi_program_info ParamName,
3924  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
3925  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
3926 
3927  PI_ASSERT(Program, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
3928 
3929  ReturnHelper ReturnValue(ParamValueSize, ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet);
3930  switch (ParamName) {
3931  case PI_PROGRAM_INFO_REFERENCE_COUNT:
3932  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Program->RefCount});
3933  case PI_PROGRAM_INFO_NUM_DEVICES:
3934  // TODO: return true number of devices this program exists for.
3935  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{1});
3936  case PI_PROGRAM_INFO_DEVICES:
3937  // TODO: return all devices this program exists for.
3938  return ReturnValue(Program->Context->Devices[0]);
3939  case PI_PROGRAM_INFO_BINARY_SIZES: {
3940  std::shared_lock Guard(Program->Mutex);
3941  size_t SzBinary;
3942  if (Program->State == _pi_program::IL ||
3943  Program->State == _pi_program::Native ||
3944  Program->State == _pi_program::Object) {
3945  SzBinary = Program->CodeLength;
3946  } else if (Program->State == _pi_program::Exe) {
3947  ZE_CALL(zeModuleGetNativeBinary, (Program->ZeModule, &SzBinary, nullptr));
3948  } else {
3949  return PI_INVALID_PROGRAM;
3950  }
3951  // This is an array of 1 element, initialized as if it were scalar.
3952  return ReturnValue(size_t{SzBinary});
3953  }
3954  case PI_PROGRAM_INFO_BINARIES: {
3955  // The caller sets "ParamValue" to an array of pointers, one for each
3956  // device. Since Level Zero supports only one device, there is only one
3957  // pointer. If the pointer is NULL, we don't do anything. Otherwise, we
3958  // copy the program's binary image to the buffer at that pointer.
3959  uint8_t **PBinary = pi_cast<uint8_t **>(ParamValue);
3960  if (!PBinary[0])
3961  break;
3962 
3963  std::shared_lock Guard(Program->Mutex);
3964  if (Program->State == _pi_program::IL ||
3965  Program->State == _pi_program::Native ||
3966  Program->State == _pi_program::Object) {
3967  std::memcpy(PBinary[0], Program->Code.get(), Program->CodeLength);
3968  } else if (Program->State == _pi_program::Exe) {
3969  size_t SzBinary = 0;
3970  ZE_CALL(zeModuleGetNativeBinary,
3971  (Program->ZeModule, &SzBinary, PBinary[0]));
3972  } else {
3973  return PI_INVALID_PROGRAM;
3974  }
3975  break;
3976  }
3977  case PI_PROGRAM_INFO_NUM_KERNELS: {
3978  std::shared_lock Guard(Program->Mutex);
3979  uint32_t NumKernels;
3980  if (Program->State == _pi_program::IL ||
3981  Program->State == _pi_program::Native ||
3982  Program->State == _pi_program::Object) {
3983  return PI_INVALID_PROGRAM_EXECUTABLE;
3984  } else if (Program->State == _pi_program::Exe) {
3985  NumKernels = 0;
3986  ZE_CALL(zeModuleGetKernelNames,
3987  (Program->ZeModule, &NumKernels, nullptr));
3988  } else {
3989  return PI_INVALID_PROGRAM;
3990  }
3991  return ReturnValue(size_t{NumKernels});
3992  }
3993  case PI_PROGRAM_INFO_KERNEL_NAMES:
3994  try {
3995  std::shared_lock Guard(Program->Mutex);
3996  std::string PINames{""};
3997  if (Program->State == _pi_program::IL ||
3998  Program->State == _pi_program::Native ||
3999  Program->State == _pi_program::Object) {
4000  return PI_INVALID_PROGRAM_EXECUTABLE;
4001  } else if (Program->State == _pi_program::Exe) {
4002  uint32_t Count = 0;
4003  ZE_CALL(zeModuleGetKernelNames, (Program->ZeModule, &Count, nullptr));
4004  std::unique_ptr<const char *[]> PNames(new const char *[Count]);
4005  ZE_CALL(zeModuleGetKernelNames,
4006  (Program->ZeModule, &Count, PNames.get()));
4007  for (uint32_t I = 0; I < Count; ++I) {
4008  PINames += (I > 0 ? ";" : "");
4009  PINames += PNames[I];
4010  }
4011  } else {
4012  return PI_INVALID_PROGRAM;
4013  }
4014  return ReturnValue(PINames.c_str());
4015  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
4016  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
4017  } catch (...) {
4018  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
4019  }
4020  default:
4021  die("piProgramGetInfo: not implemented");
4022  }
4023 
4024  return PI_SUCCESS;
4025 }
4026 
4027 pi_result piProgramLink(pi_context Context, pi_uint32 NumDevices,
4028  const pi_device *DeviceList, const char *Options,
4029  pi_uint32 NumInputPrograms,
4030  const pi_program *InputPrograms,
4031  void (*PFnNotify)(pi_program Program, void *UserData),
4032  void *UserData, pi_program *RetProgram) {
4033  // We only support one device with Level Zero currently.
4034  if (NumDevices != 1) {
4035  zePrint("piProgramLink: level_zero supports only one device.");
4036  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
4037  }
4038 
4039  // We do not support any link flags at this time because the Level Zero API
4040  // does not have any way to pass flags that are specific to linking.
4041  if (Options && *Options != '\0') {
4042  std::string ErrorMessage(
4043  "Level Zero does not support kernel link flags: \"");
4044  ErrorMessage.append(Options);
4045  ErrorMessage.push_back('\"');
4046  pi_program Program =
4047  new _pi_program(_pi_program::Invalid, Context, ErrorMessage);
4048  *RetProgram = Program;
4049  return PI_LINK_PROGRAM_FAILURE;
4050  }
4051 
4052  // Validate input parameters.
4053  PI_ASSERT(DeviceList, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
4054  {
4055  auto DeviceEntry =
4056  find(Context->Devices.begin(), Context->Devices.end(), DeviceList[0]);
4057  if (DeviceEntry == Context->Devices.end())
4058  return PI_INVALID_DEVICE;
4059  }
4060  PI_ASSERT(!PFnNotify && !UserData, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
4061  if (NumInputPrograms == 0 || InputPrograms == nullptr)
4062  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
4063 
4064  pi_result PiResult = PI_SUCCESS;
4065  try {
4066  // Acquire a "shared" lock on each of the input programs, and also validate
4067  // that they are all in Object state.
4068  //
