4069  // There is no danger of deadlock here even if two threads call
4070  // piProgramLink simultaneously with the same input programs in a different
4071  // order. If we were acquiring these with "exclusive" access, this could
4072  // lead to a classic lock ordering deadlock. However, there is no such
4073  // deadlock potential with "shared" access. There could also be a deadlock
4074  // potential if there was some other code that holds more than one of these
4075  // locks simultaneously with "exclusive" access. However, there is no such
4076  // code like that, so this is also not a danger.
4077  std::vector<std::shared_lock<pi_shared_mutex>> Guards(NumInputPrograms);
4078  for (pi_uint32 I = 0; I < NumInputPrograms; I++) {
4079  std::shared_lock Guard(InputPrograms[I]->Mutex);
4080  Guards[I].swap(Guard);
4081  if (InputPrograms[I]->State != _pi_program::Object) {
4082  return PI_INVALID_OPERATION;
4083  }
4084  }
4085 
4086  // Previous calls to piProgramCompile did not actually compile the SPIR-V.
4087  // Instead, we postpone compilation until this point, when all the modules
4088  // are linked together. By doing compilation and linking together, the JIT
4089  // compiler is able see all modules and do cross-module optimizations.
4090  //
4091  // Construct a ze_module_program_exp_desc_t which contains information about
4092  // all of the modules that will be linked together.
4093  ZeStruct<ze_module_program_exp_desc_t> ZeExtModuleDesc;
4094  std::vector<size_t> CodeSizes(NumInputPrograms);
4095  std::vector<const uint8_t *> CodeBufs(NumInputPrograms);
4096  std::vector<const char *> BuildFlagPtrs(NumInputPrograms);
4097  std::vector<const ze_module_constants_t *> SpecConstPtrs(NumInputPrograms);
4098  std::vector<_pi_program::SpecConstantShim> SpecConstShims;
4099  SpecConstShims.reserve(NumInputPrograms);
4100 
4101  for (pi_uint32 I = 0; I < NumInputPrograms; I++) {
4102  pi_program Program = InputPrograms[I];
4103  CodeSizes[I] = Program->CodeLength;
4104  CodeBufs[I] = Program->Code.get();
4105  BuildFlagPtrs[I] = Program->BuildFlags.c_str();
4106  SpecConstShims.emplace_back(Program);
4107  SpecConstPtrs[I] = SpecConstShims[I].ze();
4108  }
4109 
4110  ZeExtModuleDesc.count = NumInputPrograms;
4111  ZeExtModuleDesc.inputSizes = CodeSizes.data();
4112  ZeExtModuleDesc.pInputModules = CodeBufs.data();
4113  ZeExtModuleDesc.pBuildFlags = BuildFlagPtrs.data();
4114  ZeExtModuleDesc.pConstants = SpecConstPtrs.data();
4115 
4116  ZeStruct<ze_module_desc_t> ZeModuleDesc;
4117  ZeModuleDesc.pNext = &ZeExtModuleDesc;
4118  ZeModuleDesc.format = ZE_MODULE_FORMAT_IL_SPIRV;
4119 
4120  // This works around a bug in the Level Zero driver. When "ZE_DEBUG=-1",
4121  // the driver does validation of the API calls, and it expects
4122  // "pInputModule" to be non-NULL and "inputSize" to be non-zero. This
4123  // validation is wrong when using the "ze_module_program_exp_desc_t"
4124  // extension because those fields are supposed to be ignored. As a
4125  // workaround, set both fields to 1.
4126  //
4127  // TODO: Remove this workaround when the driver is fixed.
4128  ZeModuleDesc.pInputModule = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(1);
4129  ZeModuleDesc.inputSize = 1;
4130 
4131  // We need a Level Zero extension to compile multiple programs together into
4132  // a single Level Zero module. However, we don't need that extension if
4133  // there happens to be only one input program.
4134  //
4135  // The "|| (NumInputPrograms == 1)" term is a workaround for a bug in the
4136  // Level Zero driver. The driver's "ze_module_program_exp_desc_t"
4137  // extension should work even in the case when there is just one input
4138  // module. However, there is currently a bug in the driver that leads to a
4139  // crash. As a workaround, do not use the extension when there is one
4140  // input module.
4141  //
4142  // TODO: Remove this workaround when the driver is fixed.
4143  if (!PiDriverModuleProgramExtensionFound || (NumInputPrograms == 1)) {
4144  if (NumInputPrograms == 1) {
4145  ZeModuleDesc.pNext = nullptr;
4146  ZeModuleDesc.inputSize = ZeExtModuleDesc.inputSizes[0];
4147  ZeModuleDesc.pInputModule = ZeExtModuleDesc.pInputModules[0];
4148  ZeModuleDesc.pBuildFlags = ZeExtModuleDesc.pBuildFlags[0];
4149  ZeModuleDesc.pConstants = ZeExtModuleDesc.pConstants[0];
4150  } else {
4151  zePrint("piProgramLink: level_zero driver does not have static linking "
4152  "support.");
4153  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
4154  }
4155  }
4156 
4157  // Call the Level Zero API to compile, link, and create the module.
4158  ze_device_handle_t ZeDevice = DeviceList[0]->ZeDevice;
4159  ze_context_handle_t ZeContext = Context->ZeContext;
4160  ze_module_handle_t ZeModule = nullptr;
4161  ze_module_build_log_handle_t ZeBuildLog = nullptr;
4162  ze_result_t ZeResult =
4163  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeModuleCreate, (ZeContext, ZeDevice, &ZeModuleDesc,
4164  &ZeModule, &ZeBuildLog));
4165 
4166  // We still create a _pi_program object even if there is a BUILD_FAILURE
4167  // because we need the object to hold the ZeBuildLog. There is no build
4168  // log created for other errors, so we don't create an object.
4169  PiResult = mapError(ZeResult);
4170  if (ZeResult != ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS &&
4171  ZeResult != ZE_RESULT_ERROR_MODULE_BUILD_FAILURE) {
4172  return PiResult;
4173  }
4174 
4175  // The call to zeModuleCreate does not report an error if there are
4176  // unresolved symbols because it thinks these could be resolved later via a
4177  // call to zeModuleDynamicLink. However, modules created with piProgramLink
4178  // are supposed to be fully linked and ready to use. Therefore, do an extra
4179  // check now for unresolved symbols. Note that we still create a
4180  // _pi_program if there are unresolved symbols because the ZeBuildLog tells
4181  // which symbols are unresolved.
4182  if (ZeResult == ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS) {
4183  ZeResult = checkUnresolvedSymbols(ZeModule, &ZeBuildLog);
4184  if (ZeResult == ZE_RESULT_ERROR_MODULE_LINK_FAILURE) {
4185  PiResult = PI_LINK_PROGRAM_FAILURE;
4186  } else if (ZeResult != ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS) {
4187  return mapError(ZeResult);
4188  }
4189  }
4190 
4191  _pi_program::state State =
4192  (PiResult == PI_SUCCESS) ? _pi_program::Exe : _pi_program::Invalid;
4193  *RetProgram = new _pi_program(State, Context, ZeModule, ZeBuildLog);
4194  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
4195  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
4196  } catch (...) {
4197  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
4198  }
4199  return PiResult;
4200 }
4201 
4202 pi_result piProgramCompile(
4203  pi_program Program, pi_uint32 NumDevices, const pi_device *DeviceList,
4204  const char *Options, pi_uint32 NumInputHeaders,
4205  const pi_program *InputHeaders, const char **HeaderIncludeNames,
4206  void (*PFnNotify)(pi_program Program, void *UserData), void *UserData) {
4207  (void)NumInputHeaders;
4208  (void)InputHeaders;
4209  (void)HeaderIncludeNames;
4210 
4211  PI_ASSERT(Program, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
4212 
4213  if ((NumDevices && !DeviceList) || (!NumDevices && DeviceList))
4214  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
4215 
4216  // These aren't supported.
4217  PI_ASSERT(!PFnNotify && !UserData, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
4218 
4219  std::scoped_lock Guard(Program->Mutex);
4220 
4221  // It's only valid to compile a program created from IL (we don't support
4222  // programs created from source code).
4223  //
4224  // The OpenCL spec says that the header parameters are ignored when compiling
4225  // IL programs, so we don't validate them.
4226  if (Program->State != _pi_program::IL)
4227  return PI_INVALID_OPERATION;
4228 
4229  // We don't compile anything now. Instead, we delay compilation until
4230  // piProgramLink, where we do both compilation and linking as a single step.
4231  // This produces better code because the driver can do cross-module
4232  // optimizations. Therefore, we just remember the compilation flags, so we
4233  // can use them later.
4234  if (Options)
4235  Program->BuildFlags = Options;
4236  Program->State = _pi_program::Object;
4237 
4238  return PI_SUCCESS;
4239 }
4240 
4241 pi_result piProgramBuild(pi_program Program, pi_uint32 NumDevices,
4242  const pi_device *DeviceList, const char *Options,
4243  void (*PFnNotify)(pi_program Program, void *UserData),
4244  void *UserData) {
4245 
4246  PI_ASSERT(Program, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
4247  if ((NumDevices && !DeviceList) || (!NumDevices && DeviceList))
4248  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
4249 
4250  // We only support build to one device with Level Zero now.
4251  // TODO: we should eventually build to the possibly multiple root
4252  // devices in the context.
4253  if (NumDevices != 1) {
4254  zePrint("piProgramBuild: level_zero supports only one device.");
4255  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
4256  }
4257 
4258  // These aren't supported.
4259  PI_ASSERT(!PFnNotify && !UserData, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
4260 
4261  std::scoped_lock Guard(Program->Mutex);
4262  // Check if device belongs to associated context.
4263  PI_ASSERT(Program->Context, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
4264  {
4265  auto DeviceEntry = find(Program->Context->Devices.begin(),
4266  Program->Context->Devices.end(), DeviceList[0]);
4267  if (DeviceEntry == Program->Context->Devices.end())
4268  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
4269  }
4270  // It is legal to build a program created from either IL or from native
4271  // device code.
4272  if (Program->State != _pi_program::IL &&
4273  Program->State != _pi_program::Native)
4274  return PI_INVALID_OPERATION;
4275 
4276  // We should have either IL or native device code.
4277  PI_ASSERT(Program->Code, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
4278 
4279  // Ask Level Zero to build and load the native code onto the device.
4280  ZeStruct<ze_module_desc_t> ZeModuleDesc;
4281  _pi_program::SpecConstantShim Shim(Program);
4282  ZeModuleDesc.format = (Program->State == _pi_program::IL)
4283  ? ZE_MODULE_FORMAT_IL_SPIRV
4284  : ZE_MODULE_FORMAT_NATIVE;
4285  ZeModuleDesc.inputSize = Program->CodeLength;
4286  ZeModuleDesc.pInputModule = Program->Code.get();
4287  ZeModuleDesc.pBuildFlags = Options;
4288  ZeModuleDesc.pConstants = Shim.ze();
4289 
4290  ze_device_handle_t ZeDevice = DeviceList[0]->ZeDevice;
4291  ze_context_handle_t ZeContext = Program->Context->ZeContext;
4292  ze_module_handle_t ZeModule = nullptr;
4293 
4294  pi_result Result = PI_SUCCESS;
4295  Program->State = _pi_program::Exe;
4296  ze_result_t ZeResult =
4297  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeModuleCreate, (ZeContext, ZeDevice, &ZeModuleDesc,
4298  &ZeModule, &Program->ZeBuildLog));
4299  if (ZeResult != ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS) {
4300  // We adjust pi_program below to avoid attempting to release zeModule when
4301  // RT calls piProgramRelease().
4302  ZeModule = nullptr;
4303  Program->State = _pi_program::Invalid;
4304  Result = mapError(ZeResult);
4305  } else {
4306  // The call to zeModuleCreate does not report an error if there are
4307  // unresolved symbols because it thinks these could be resolved later via a
4308  // call to zeModuleDynamicLink. However, modules created with
4309  // piProgramBuild are supposed to be fully linked and ready to use.
4310  // Therefore, do an extra check now for unresolved symbols.
4311  ZeResult = checkUnresolvedSymbols(ZeModule, &Program->ZeBuildLog);
4312  if (ZeResult != ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS) {
4313  Program->State = _pi_program::Invalid;
4314  Result = (ZeResult == ZE_RESULT_ERROR_MODULE_LINK_FAILURE)
4315  ? PI_BUILD_PROGRAM_FAILURE
4316  : mapError(ZeResult);
4317  }
4318  }
4319 
4320  // We no longer need the IL / native code.
4321  Program->Code.reset();
4322  Program->ZeModule = ZeModule;
4323  return Result;
4324 }
4325 
4326 pi_result piProgramGetBuildInfo(pi_program Program, pi_device Device,
4327  cl_program_build_info ParamName,
4328  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
4329  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
4330  (void)Device;
4331 
4332  std::shared_lock Guard(Program->Mutex);
4333  ReturnHelper ReturnValue(ParamValueSize, ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet);
4334  if (ParamName == CL_PROGRAM_BINARY_TYPE) {
4335  cl_program_binary_type Type = CL_PROGRAM_BINARY_TYPE_NONE;
4336  if (Program->State == _pi_program::Object) {
4337  Type = CL_PROGRAM_BINARY_TYPE_COMPILED_OBJECT;
4338  } else if (Program->State == _pi_program::Exe) {
4339  Type = CL_PROGRAM_BINARY_TYPE_EXECUTABLE;
4340  }
4341  return ReturnValue(cl_program_binary_type{Type});
4342  }
4343  if (ParamName == CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_OPTIONS) {
4344  // TODO: how to get module build options out of Level Zero?
4345  // For the programs that we compiled we can remember the options
4346  // passed with piProgramCompile/piProgramBuild, but what can we
4347  // return for programs that were built outside and registered
4348  // with piProgramRegister?
4349  return ReturnValue("");
4350  } else if (ParamName == CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG) {
4351  // Check first to see if the plugin code recorded an error message.
4352  if (!Program->ErrorMessage.empty()) {
4353  return ReturnValue(Program->ErrorMessage.c_str());
4354  }
4355 
4356  // Next check if there is a Level Zero build log.
4357  if (Program->ZeBuildLog) {
4358  size_t LogSize = ParamValueSize;
4359  ZE_CALL(zeModuleBuildLogGetString,
4360  (Program->ZeBuildLog, &LogSize, pi_cast<char *>(ParamValue)));
4361  if (ParamValueSizeRet) {
4362  *ParamValueSizeRet = LogSize;
4363  }
4364  return PI_SUCCESS;
4365  }
4366 
4367  // Otherwise, there is no error. The OpenCL spec says to return an empty
4368  // string if there ws no previous attempt to compile, build, or link the
4369  // program.
4370  return ReturnValue("");
4371  } else {
4372  zePrint("piProgramGetBuildInfo: unsupported ParamName\n");
4373  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
4374  }
4375  return PI_SUCCESS;
4376 }
4377 
4378 pi_result piProgramRetain(pi_program Program) {
4379  PI_ASSERT(Program, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
4380  ++(Program->RefCount);
4381  return PI_SUCCESS;
4382 }
4383 
4384 pi_result piProgramRelease(pi_program Program) {
4385  PI_ASSERT(Program, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
4386  // Check if the program is already released
4387  PI_ASSERT(Program->RefCount > 0, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
4388  if (--(Program->RefCount) == 0) {
4389  delete Program;
4390  }
4391  return PI_SUCCESS;
4392 }
4393 
4394 pi_result piextProgramGetNativeHandle(pi_program Program,
4395  pi_native_handle *NativeHandle) {
4396  PI_ASSERT(Program, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
4397  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
4398 
4399  auto ZeModule = pi_cast<ze_module_handle_t *>(NativeHandle);
4400 
4401  std::shared_lock Guard(Program->Mutex);
4402  switch (Program->State) {
4403  case _pi_program::Exe: {
4404  *ZeModule = Program->ZeModule;
4405  break;
4406  }
4407 
4408  default:
4409  return PI_INVALID_OPERATION;
4410  }
4411 
4412  return PI_SUCCESS;
4413 }
4414 
4415 pi_result piextProgramCreateWithNativeHandle(pi_native_handle NativeHandle,
4416  pi_context Context,
4417  bool ownNativeHandle,
4418  pi_program *Program) {
4419  PI_ASSERT(Program, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
4420  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
4421  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
4422 
4423  auto ZeModule = pi_cast<ze_module_handle_t>(NativeHandle);
4424 
4425  // We assume here that programs created from a native handle always
4426  // represent a fully linked executable (state Exe) and not an unlinked
4427  // executable (state Object).
4428 
4429  try {
4430  *Program =
4431  new _pi_program(_pi_program::Exe, Context, ZeModule, ownNativeHandle);
4432  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
4433  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
4434  } catch (...) {
4435  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
4436  }
4437  return PI_SUCCESS;
4438 }
4439 
4440 _pi_program::~_pi_program() {
4441  // According to Level Zero Specification, all kernels and build logs
4442  // must be destroyed before the Module can be destroyed. So, be sure
4443  // to destroy build log before destroying the module.
4444  if (ZeBuildLog) {
4445  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeModuleBuildLogDestroy, (ZeBuildLog));
4446  }
4447 
4448  if (ZeModule && OwnZeModule) {
4449  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeModuleDestroy, (ZeModule));
4450  }
4451 }
4452 
4453 // Check to see if a Level Zero module has any unresolved symbols.
4454 //
4455 // @param ZeModule The module handle to check.
4456 // @param ZeBuildLog If there are unresolved symbols, this build log handle is
4457 // modified to receive information telling which symbols
4458 // are unresolved.
4459 //
4460 // @return ZE_RESULT_ERROR_MODULE_LINK_FAILURE indicates there are unresolved
4461 // symbols. ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS indicates all symbols are resolved. Any other
4462 // value indicates there was an error and we cannot tell if symbols are
4463 // resolved.
4464 static ze_result_t
4465 checkUnresolvedSymbols(ze_module_handle_t ZeModule,
4466  ze_module_build_log_handle_t *ZeBuildLog) {
4467 
4468  // First check to see if the module has any imported symbols. If there are
4469  // no imported symbols, it's not possible to have any unresolved symbols. We
4470  // do this check first because we assume it's faster than the call to
4471  // zeModuleDynamicLink below.
4472  ZeStruct<ze_module_properties_t> ZeModuleProps;
4473  ze_result_t ZeResult =
4474  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeModuleGetProperties, (ZeModule, &ZeModuleProps));
4475  if (ZeResult != ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS)
4476  return ZeResult;
4477 
4478  // If there are imported symbols, attempt to "link" the module with itself.
4479  // As a side effect, this will return the error
4480  // ZE_RESULT_ERROR_MODULE_LINK_FAILURE if there are any unresolved symbols.
4481  if (ZeModuleProps.flags & ZE_MODULE_PROPERTY_FLAG_IMPORTS) {
4482  return ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeModuleDynamicLink, (1, &ZeModule, ZeBuildLog));
4483  }
4484  return ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS;
4485 }
4486 
4487 pi_result piKernelCreate(pi_program Program, const char *KernelName,
4488  pi_kernel *RetKernel) {
4489 
4490  PI_ASSERT(Program, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
4491  PI_ASSERT(RetKernel, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
4492  PI_ASSERT(KernelName, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
4493 
4494  std::shared_lock Guard(Program->Mutex);
4495  if (Program->State != _pi_program::Exe) {
4496  return PI_INVALID_PROGRAM_EXECUTABLE;
4497  }
4498 
4499  ZeStruct<ze_kernel_desc_t> ZeKernelDesc;
4500  ZeKernelDesc.flags = 0;
4501  ZeKernelDesc.pKernelName = KernelName;
4502 
4503  ze_kernel_handle_t ZeKernel;
4504  ZE_CALL(zeKernelCreate, (Program->ZeModule, &ZeKernelDesc, &ZeKernel));
4505 
4506  try {
4507  *RetKernel = new _pi_kernel(ZeKernel, true, Program);
4508  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
4509  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
4510  } catch (...) {
4511  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
4512  }
4513 
4514  // Update the refcount of the program and context to show it's used by this
4515  // kernel.
4516  PI_CALL(piProgramRetain(Program));
4517  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled)
4518  // TODO: do piContextRetain without the guard
4519  PI_CALL(piContextRetain(Program->Context));
4520 
4521  // Set up how to obtain kernel properties when needed.
4522  (*RetKernel)->ZeKernelProperties.Compute =
4523  [ZeKernel](ze_kernel_properties_t &Properties) {
4524  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeKernelGetProperties, (ZeKernel, &Properties));
4525  };
4526 
4527  return PI_SUCCESS;
4528 }
4529 
4530 pi_result piKernelSetArg(pi_kernel Kernel, pi_uint32 ArgIndex, size_t ArgSize,
4531  const void *ArgValue) {
4532 
4533  // OpenCL: "the arg_value pointer can be NULL or point to a NULL value
4534  // in which case a NULL value will be used as the value for the argument
4535  // declared as a pointer to global or constant memory in the kernel"
4536  //
4537  // We don't know the type of the argument but it seems that the only time
4538  // SYCL RT would send a pointer to NULL in 'arg_value' is when the argument
4539  // is a NULL pointer. Treat a pointer to NULL in 'arg_value' as a NULL.
4540  if (ArgSize == sizeof(void *) && ArgValue &&
4541  *(void **)(const_cast<void *>(ArgValue)) == nullptr) {
4542  ArgValue = nullptr;
4543  }
4544 
4545  PI_ASSERT(Kernel, PI_INVALID_KERNEL);
4546 
4547  ZE_CALL(zeKernelSetArgumentValue,
4548  (pi_cast<ze_kernel_handle_t>(Kernel->ZeKernel),
4549  pi_cast<uint32_t>(ArgIndex), pi_cast<size_t>(ArgSize),
4550  pi_cast<const void *>(ArgValue)));
4551 
4552  return PI_SUCCESS;
4553 }
4554 
4555 // Special version of piKernelSetArg to accept pi_mem.
4556 pi_result piextKernelSetArgMemObj(pi_kernel Kernel, pi_uint32 ArgIndex,
4557  const pi_mem *ArgValue) {
4558  // TODO: the better way would probably be to add a new PI API for
4559  // extracting native PI object from PI handle, and have SYCL
4560  // RT pass that directly to the regular piKernelSetArg (and
4561  // then remove this piextKernelSetArgMemObj).
4562 
4563  PI_ASSERT(Kernel, PI_INVALID_KERNEL);
4564 
4565  ZE_CALL(zeKernelSetArgumentValue,
4566  (pi_cast<ze_kernel_handle_t>(Kernel->ZeKernel),
4567  pi_cast<uint32_t>(ArgIndex), sizeof(void *),
4568  (*ArgValue)->getZeHandlePtr()));
4569 
4570  return PI_SUCCESS;
4571 }
4572 
4573 // Special version of piKernelSetArg to accept pi_sampler.
4574 pi_result piextKernelSetArgSampler(pi_kernel Kernel, pi_uint32 ArgIndex,
4575  const pi_sampler *ArgValue) {
4576  PI_ASSERT(Kernel, PI_INVALID_KERNEL);
4577 
4578  ZE_CALL(zeKernelSetArgumentValue,
4579  (pi_cast<ze_kernel_handle_t>(Kernel->ZeKernel),
4580  pi_cast<uint32_t>(ArgIndex), sizeof(void *),
4581  &(*ArgValue)->ZeSampler));
4582 
4583  return PI_SUCCESS;
4584 }
4585 
4586 pi_result piKernelGetInfo(pi_kernel Kernel, pi_kernel_info ParamName,
4587  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
4588  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
4589  PI_ASSERT(Kernel, PI_INVALID_KERNEL);
4590 
4591  ReturnHelper ReturnValue(ParamValueSize, ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet);
4592  switch (ParamName) {
4593  case PI_KERNEL_INFO_CONTEXT:
4594  return ReturnValue(pi_context{Kernel->Program->Context});
4595  case PI_KERNEL_INFO_PROGRAM:
4596  return ReturnValue(pi_program{Kernel->Program});
4597  case PI_KERNEL_INFO_FUNCTION_NAME:
4598  try {
4599  size_t Size = 0;
4600  ZE_CALL(zeKernelGetName, (Kernel->ZeKernel, &Size, nullptr));
4601  char *KernelName = new char[Size];
4602  ZE_CALL(zeKernelGetName, (Kernel->ZeKernel, &Size, KernelName));
4603  pi_result Res = ReturnValue(static_cast<const char *>(KernelName));
4604  delete[] KernelName;
4605  return Res;
4606  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
4607  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
4608  } catch (...) {
4609  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
4610  }
4611  case PI_KERNEL_INFO_NUM_ARGS:
4612  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Kernel->ZeKernelProperties->numKernelArgs});
4613  case PI_KERNEL_INFO_REFERENCE_COUNT:
4614  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Kernel->RefCount});
4615  case PI_KERNEL_INFO_ATTRIBUTES:
4616  try {
4617  uint32_t Size;
4618  ZE_CALL(zeKernelGetSourceAttributes, (Kernel->ZeKernel, &Size, nullptr));
4619  char *attributes = new char[Size];
4620  ZE_CALL(zeKernelGetSourceAttributes,
4621  (Kernel->ZeKernel, &Size, &attributes));
4622  auto Res = ReturnValue(attributes);
4623  delete[] attributes;
4624  return Res;
4625  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
4626  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
4627  } catch (...) {
4628  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
4629  }
4630  default:
4631  zePrint("Unsupported ParamName in piKernelGetInfo: ParamName=%d(0x%x)\n",
4632  ParamName, ParamName);
4633  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
4634  }
4635 
4636  return PI_SUCCESS;
4637 }
4638 
4639 pi_result piKernelGetGroupInfo(pi_kernel Kernel, pi_device Device,
4640  pi_kernel_group_info ParamName,
4641  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
4642  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
4643  PI_ASSERT(Kernel, PI_INVALID_KERNEL);
4644  PI_ASSERT(Device, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
4645 
4646  ReturnHelper ReturnValue(ParamValueSize, ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet);
4647  switch (ParamName) {
4648  case PI_KERNEL_GROUP_INFO_GLOBAL_WORK_SIZE: {
4649  // TODO: To revisit after level_zero/issues/262 is resolved
4650  struct {
4651  size_t Arr[3];
4652  } WorkSize = {{Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->maxGroupSizeX,
4653  Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->maxGroupSizeY,
4654  Device->ZeDeviceComputeProperties->maxGroupSizeZ}};
4655  return ReturnValue(WorkSize);
4656  }
4657  case PI_KERNEL_GROUP_INFO_WORK_GROUP_SIZE: {
4658  uint32_t X, Y, Z;
4659  ZE_CALL(zeKernelSuggestGroupSize,
4660  (Kernel->ZeKernel, 10000, 10000, 10000, &X, &Y, &Z));
4661  return ReturnValue(size_t{X * Y * Z});
4662  }
4663  case PI_KERNEL_GROUP_INFO_COMPILE_WORK_GROUP_SIZE: {
4664  struct {
4665  size_t Arr[3];
4666  } WgSize = {{Kernel->ZeKernelProperties->requiredGroupSizeX,
4667  Kernel->ZeKernelProperties->requiredGroupSizeY,
4668  Kernel->ZeKernelProperties->requiredGroupSizeZ}};
4669  return ReturnValue(WgSize);
4670  }
4671  case PI_KERNEL_GROUP_INFO_LOCAL_MEM_SIZE:
4672  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Kernel->ZeKernelProperties->localMemSize});
4673  case PI_KERNEL_GROUP_INFO_PREFERRED_WORK_GROUP_SIZE_MULTIPLE: {
4674  return ReturnValue(size_t{Device->ZeDeviceProperties->physicalEUSimdWidth});
4675  }
4676  case PI_KERNEL_GROUP_INFO_PRIVATE_MEM_SIZE:
4677  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Kernel->ZeKernelProperties->privateMemSize});
4678  case PI_KERNEL_GROUP_INFO_NUM_REGS: {
4679  die("PI_KERNEL_GROUP_INFO_NUM_REGS in piKernelGetGroupInfo not "
4680  "implemented\n");
4681  break;
4682  }
4683  default:
4684  zePrint("Unknown ParamName in piKernelGetGroupInfo: ParamName=%d(0x%x)\n",
4685  ParamName, ParamName);
4686  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
4687  }
4688  return PI_SUCCESS;
4689 }
4690 
4691 pi_result piKernelGetSubGroupInfo(pi_kernel Kernel, pi_device Device,
4692  pi_kernel_sub_group_info ParamName,
4693  size_t InputValueSize, const void *InputValue,
4694  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
4695  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
4696  (void)Device;
4697  (void)InputValueSize;
4698  (void)InputValue;
4699 
4700  ReturnHelper ReturnValue(ParamValueSize, ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet);
4701 
4702  if (ParamName == PI_KERNEL_MAX_SUB_GROUP_SIZE) {
4703  ReturnValue(uint32_t{Kernel->ZeKernelProperties->maxSubgroupSize});
4704  } else if (ParamName == PI_KERNEL_MAX_NUM_SUB_GROUPS) {
4705  ReturnValue(uint32_t{Kernel->ZeKernelProperties->maxNumSubgroups});
4706  } else if (ParamName == PI_KERNEL_COMPILE_NUM_SUB_GROUPS) {
4707  ReturnValue(uint32_t{Kernel->ZeKernelProperties->requiredNumSubGroups});
4708  } else if (ParamName == PI_KERNEL_COMPILE_SUB_GROUP_SIZE_INTEL) {
4709  ReturnValue(uint32_t{Kernel->ZeKernelProperties->requiredSubgroupSize});
4710  } else {
4711  die("piKernelGetSubGroupInfo: parameter not implemented");
4712  return {};
4713  }
4714  return PI_SUCCESS;
4715 }
4716 
4717 pi_result piKernelRetain(pi_kernel Kernel) {
4718 
4719  PI_ASSERT(Kernel, PI_INVALID_KERNEL);
4720 
4721  ++(Kernel->RefCount);
4722  // When retaining a kernel, you are also retaining the program it is part of.
4723  PI_CALL(piProgramRetain(Kernel->Program));
4724  return PI_SUCCESS;
4725 }
4726 
4727 static pi_result USMFreeHelper(pi_context Context, void *Ptr);
4728 
4729 pi_result piKernelRelease(pi_kernel Kernel) {
4730 
4731  PI_ASSERT(Kernel, PI_INVALID_KERNEL);
4732 
4733  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
4734  // piKernelRelease is called by Event->cleanup() as soon as kernel
4735  // execution has finished. This is the place where we need to release memory
4736  // allocations. If kernel is not in use (not submitted by some other thread)
4737  // then release referenced memory allocations. As a result, memory can be
4738  // deallocated and context can be removed from container in the platform.
4739  // That's why we need to lock a mutex here.
4740  pi_platform Plt = Kernel->Program->Context->Devices[0]->Platform;
4741  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> ContextsLock(Plt->ContextsMutex);
4742 
4743  if (--Kernel->SubmissionsCount == 0) {
4744  // Kernel is not submitted for execution, release referenced memory
4745  // allocations.
4746  for (auto &MemAlloc : Kernel->MemAllocs) {
4747  USMFreeHelper(MemAlloc->second.Context, MemAlloc->first);
4748  }
4749  Kernel->MemAllocs.clear();
4750  }
4751  }
4752 
4753  auto KernelProgram = Kernel->Program;
4754  if (--(Kernel->RefCount) == 0) {
4755  if (Kernel->OwnZeKernel)
4756  ZE_CALL(zeKernelDestroy, (Kernel->ZeKernel));
4757  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
4758  PI_CALL(piContextRelease(KernelProgram->Context));
4759  }
4760  delete Kernel;
4761  }
4762 
4763  // do a release on the program this kernel was part of
4764  PI_CALL(piProgramRelease(KernelProgram));
4765 
4766  return PI_SUCCESS;
4767 }
4768 
4769 pi_result
4770 piEnqueueKernelLaunch(pi_queue Queue, pi_kernel Kernel, pi_uint32 WorkDim,
4771  const size_t *GlobalWorkOffset,
4772  const size_t *GlobalWorkSize, const size_t *LocalWorkSize,
4773  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
4774  const pi_event *EventWaitList, pi_event *Event) {
4775  PI_ASSERT(Kernel, PI_INVALID_KERNEL);
4776  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
4777  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
4778  PI_ASSERT((WorkDim > 0) && (WorkDim < 4), PI_INVALID_WORK_DIMENSION);
4779 
4780  if (GlobalWorkOffset != NULL) {
4781  if (!PiDriverGlobalOffsetExtensionFound) {
4782  zePrint("No global offset extension found on this driver\n");
4783  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
4784  }
4785 
4786  ZE_CALL(zeKernelSetGlobalOffsetExp,
4787  (Kernel->ZeKernel, GlobalWorkOffset[0], GlobalWorkOffset[1],
4788  GlobalWorkOffset[2]));
4789  }
4790 
4791  ze_group_count_t ZeThreadGroupDimensions{1, 1, 1};
4792  uint32_t WG[3];
4793 
4794  // global_work_size of unused dimensions must be set to 1
4795  PI_ASSERT(WorkDim == 3 || GlobalWorkSize[2] == 1, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
4796  PI_ASSERT(WorkDim >= 2 || GlobalWorkSize[1] == 1, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
4797 
4798  if (LocalWorkSize) {
4799  WG[0] = pi_cast<uint32_t>(LocalWorkSize[0]);
4800  WG[1] = pi_cast<uint32_t>(LocalWorkSize[1]);
4801  WG[2] = pi_cast<uint32_t>(LocalWorkSize[2]);
4802  } else {
4803  ZE_CALL(zeKernelSuggestGroupSize,
4804  (Kernel->ZeKernel, GlobalWorkSize[0], GlobalWorkSize[1],
4805  GlobalWorkSize[2], &WG[0], &WG[1], &WG[2]));
4806  }
4807 
4808  // TODO: assert if sizes do not fit into 32-bit?
4809  switch (WorkDim) {
4810  case 3:
4811  ZeThreadGroupDimensions.groupCountX =
4812  pi_cast<uint32_t>(GlobalWorkSize[0] / WG[0]);
4813  ZeThreadGroupDimensions.groupCountY =
4814  pi_cast<uint32_t>(GlobalWorkSize[1] / WG[1]);
4815  ZeThreadGroupDimensions.groupCountZ =
4816  pi_cast<uint32_t>(GlobalWorkSize[2] / WG[2]);
4817  break;
4818  case 2:
4819  ZeThreadGroupDimensions.groupCountX =
4820  pi_cast<uint32_t>(GlobalWorkSize[0] / WG[0]);
4821  ZeThreadGroupDimensions.groupCountY =
4822  pi_cast<uint32_t>(GlobalWorkSize[1] / WG[1]);
4823  WG[2] = 1;
4824  break;
4825  case 1:
4826  ZeThreadGroupDimensions.groupCountX =
4827  pi_cast<uint32_t>(GlobalWorkSize[0] / WG[0]);
4828  WG[1] = WG[2] = 1;
4829  break;
4830 
4831  default:
4832  zePrint("piEnqueueKernelLaunch: unsupported work_dim\n");
4833  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
4834  }
4835 
4836  // Error handling for non-uniform group size case
4837  if (GlobalWorkSize[0] != (ZeThreadGroupDimensions.groupCountX * WG[0])) {
4838  zePrint("piEnqueueKernelLaunch: invalid work_dim. The range is not a "
4839  "multiple of the group size in the 1st dimension\n");
4840  return PI_INVALID_WORK_GROUP_SIZE;
4841  }
4842  if (GlobalWorkSize[1] != (ZeThreadGroupDimensions.groupCountY * WG[1])) {
4843  zePrint("piEnqueueKernelLaunch: invalid work_dim. The range is not a "
4844  "multiple of the group size in the 2nd dimension\n");
4845  return PI_INVALID_WORK_GROUP_SIZE;
4846  }
4847  if (GlobalWorkSize[2] != (ZeThreadGroupDimensions.groupCountZ * WG[2])) {
4848  zePrint("piEnqueueKernelLaunch: invalid work_dim. The range is not a "
4849  "multiple of the group size in the 3rd dimension\n");
4850  return PI_INVALID_WORK_GROUP_SIZE;
4851  }
4852 
4853  ZE_CALL(zeKernelSetGroupSize, (Kernel->ZeKernel, WG[0], WG[1], WG[2]));
4854 
4855  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
4856  std::scoped_lock QueueLock(Queue->Mutex);
4857 
4858  _pi_ze_event_list_t TmpWaitList;
4859 
4860  if (auto Res = TmpWaitList.createAndRetainPiZeEventList(NumEventsInWaitList,
4861  EventWaitList, Queue))
4862  return Res;
4863 
4864  // Get a new command list to be used on this call
4865  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList{};
4866  if (auto Res = Queue->Context->getAvailableCommandList(
4867  Queue, CommandList, false /* UseCopyEngine */,
4868  true /* AllowBatching */))
4869  return Res;
4870 
4871  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent = nullptr;
4872  pi_result Res = createEventAndAssociateQueue(
4873  Queue, Event, PI_COMMAND_TYPE_NDRANGE_KERNEL, CommandList);
4874  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
4875  return Res;
4876  ZeEvent = (*Event)->ZeEvent;
4877  (*Event)->WaitList = TmpWaitList;
4878 
4879  // Save the kernel in the event, so that when the event is signalled
4880  // the code can do a piKernelRelease on this kernel.
4881  (*Event)->CommandData = (void *)Kernel;
4882 
4883  // Use piKernelRetain to increment the reference count and indicate
4884  // that the Kernel is in use. Once the event has been signalled, the
4885  // code in Event.cleanup() will do a piReleaseKernel to update
4886  // the reference count on the kernel, using the kernel saved
4887  // in CommandData.
4888  PI_CALL(piKernelRetain(Kernel));
4889 
4890  // Add the command to the command list
4891  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendLaunchKernel,
4892  (CommandList->first, Kernel->ZeKernel, &ZeThreadGroupDimensions,
4893  ZeEvent, (*Event)->WaitList.Length, (*Event)->WaitList.ZeEventList));
4894 
4895  zePrint("calling zeCommandListAppendLaunchKernel() with"
4896  " ZeEvent %#lx\n",
4897  pi_cast<std::uintptr_t>(ZeEvent));
4898  printZeEventList((*Event)->WaitList);
4899 
4900  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled)
4901  Queue->KernelsToBeSubmitted.push_back(Kernel);
4902 
4903  // Execute command list asynchronously, as the event will be used
4904  // to track down its completion.
4905  if (auto Res = Queue->executeCommandList(CommandList, false, true))
4906  return Res;
4907 
4908  return PI_SUCCESS;
4909 }
4910 
4911 pi_result piextKernelCreateWithNativeHandle(pi_native_handle NativeHandle,
4912  pi_context Context,
4913  pi_program Program,
4914  bool OwnNativeHandle,
4915  pi_kernel *Kernel) {
4916  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
4917  PI_ASSERT(Program, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
4918  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
4919  PI_ASSERT(Kernel, PI_INVALID_KERNEL);
4920 
4921  auto ZeKernel = pi_cast<ze_kernel_handle_t>(NativeHandle);
4922  *Kernel = new _pi_kernel(ZeKernel, OwnNativeHandle, Program);
4923 
4924  // Update the refcount of the program and context to show it's used by this
4925  // kernel.
4926  PI_CALL(piProgramRetain(Program));
4927  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled)
4928  // TODO: do piContextRetain without the guard
4929  PI_CALL(piContextRetain(Program->Context));
4930 
4931  // Set up how to obtain kernel properties when needed.
4932  (*Kernel)->ZeKernelProperties.Compute =
4933  [ZeKernel](ze_kernel_properties_t &Properties) {
4934  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeKernelGetProperties, (ZeKernel, &Properties));
4935  };
4936 
4937  return PI_SUCCESS;
4938 }
4939 
4940 pi_result piextKernelGetNativeHandle(pi_kernel Kernel,
4941  pi_native_handle *NativeHandle) {
4942  PI_ASSERT(Kernel, PI_INVALID_KERNEL);
4943  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
4944 
4945  auto *ZeKernel = pi_cast<ze_kernel_handle_t *>(NativeHandle);
4946  *ZeKernel = Kernel->ZeKernel;
4947  return PI_SUCCESS;
4948 }
4949 
4950 //
4951 // Events
4952 //
4953 pi_result
4954 _pi_event::getOrCreateHostVisibleEvent(ze_event_handle_t &ZeHostVisibleEvent) {
4955 
4956  if (!HostVisibleEvent) {
4957  if (EventsScope != OnDemandHostVisibleProxy)
4958  die("getOrCreateHostVisibleEvent: missing host-visible event");
4959 
4960  // Submit the command(s) signalling the proxy event to the queue.
4961  // We have to first submit a wait for the device-only event for which this
4962  // proxy is created.
4963  //
4964  // Get a new command list to be used on this call
4965  {
4966  std::scoped_lock Lock(Queue->Mutex);
4967 
4968  // We want to batch these commands to avoid extra submissions (costly)
4969  bool OkToBatch = true;
4970 
4971  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList{};
4972  if (auto Res = Queue->Context->getAvailableCommandList(
4973  Queue, CommandList, false /* UseCopyEngine */, OkToBatch))
4974  return Res;
4975 
4976  // Create a "proxy" host-visible event.
4977  auto Res = createEventAndAssociateQueue(
4978  Queue, &HostVisibleEvent, PI_COMMAND_TYPE_USER, CommandList, true);
4979  // HostVisibleEvent->CleanedUp = true;
4980  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
4981  return Res;
4982 
4983  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendWaitOnEvents,
4984  (CommandList->first, 1, &ZeEvent));
4985  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendSignalEvent,
4986  (CommandList->first, HostVisibleEvent->ZeEvent));
4987 
4988  if (auto Res = Queue->executeCommandList(CommandList, false, OkToBatch))
4989  return Res;
4990  }
4991  }
4992 
4993  ZeHostVisibleEvent = HostVisibleEvent->ZeEvent;
4994  return PI_SUCCESS;
4995 }
4996 
4997 // Helper function for creating a PI event.
4998 // The "Queue" argument specifies the PI queue where a command is submitted.
4999 // The "HostVisible" argument specifies if event needs to be allocated from
5000 // a host-visible pool.
5001 //
5002 static pi_result EventCreate(pi_context Context, pi_queue Queue,
5003  bool HostVisible, pi_event *RetEvent) {
5004 
5005  bool ProfilingEnabled =
5006  !Queue || (Queue->Properties & PI_QUEUE_PROFILING_ENABLE) != 0;
5007 
5008  size_t Index = 0;
5009  ze_event_pool_handle_t ZeEventPool = {};
5010  if (auto Res = Context->getFreeSlotInExistingOrNewPool(
5011  ZeEventPool, Index, HostVisible, ProfilingEnabled))
5012  return Res;
5013 
5014  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent;
5015  ZeStruct<ze_event_desc_t> ZeEventDesc;
5016  ZeEventDesc.index = Index;
5017  ZeEventDesc.wait = 0;
5018 
5019  if (HostVisible) {
5020  ZeEventDesc.signal = ZE_EVENT_SCOPE_FLAG_HOST;
5021  } else {
5022  //
5023  // Set the scope to "device" for every event. This is sufficient for global
5024  // device access and peer device access. If needed to be seen on the host
5025  // we are doing special handling, see EventsScope options.
5026  //
5027  // TODO: see if "sub-device" (ZE_EVENT_SCOPE_FLAG_SUBDEVICE) can better be
5028  // used in some circumstances.
5029  //
5030  ZeEventDesc.signal = 0;
5031  }
5032 
5033  ZE_CALL(zeEventCreate, (ZeEventPool, &ZeEventDesc, &ZeEvent));
5034 
5035  try {
5036  PI_ASSERT(RetEvent, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
5037 
5038  *RetEvent = new _pi_event(ZeEvent, ZeEventPool, Context,
5039  PI_COMMAND_TYPE_USER, true);
5040  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
5041  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
5042  } catch (...) {
5043  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
5044  }
5045 
5046  if (HostVisible)
5047  (*RetEvent)->HostVisibleEvent = *RetEvent;
5048 
5049  return PI_SUCCESS;
5050 }
5051 
5052 // Exteral PI API entry
5053 pi_result piEventCreate(pi_context Context, pi_event *RetEvent) {
5054  return EventCreate(Context, nullptr, EventsScope == AllHostVisible, RetEvent);
5055 }
5056 
5057 pi_result piEventGetInfo(pi_event Event, pi_event_info ParamName,
5058  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
5059  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
5060 
5061  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
5062 
5063  ReturnHelper ReturnValue(ParamValueSize, ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet);
5064  switch (ParamName) {
5065  case PI_EVENT_INFO_COMMAND_QUEUE:
5066  return ReturnValue(pi_queue{Event->Queue});
5067  case PI_EVENT_INFO_CONTEXT:
5068  return ReturnValue(pi_context{Event->Context});
5069  case PI_EVENT_INFO_COMMAND_TYPE:
5070  return ReturnValue(pi_cast<pi_uint64>(Event->CommandType));
5071  case PI_EVENT_INFO_COMMAND_EXECUTION_STATUS: {
5072  // Check to see if the event's Queue has an open command list due to
5073  // batching. If so, go ahead and close and submit it, because it is
5074  // possible that this is trying to query some event's status that
5075  // is part of the batch. This isn't strictly required, but it seems
5076  // like a reasonable thing to do.
5077  if (Event->Queue) {
5078  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
5079  std::scoped_lock lock(Event->Queue->Mutex);
5080  Event->Queue->executeOpenCommandListWithEvent(Event);
5081  }
5082 
5083  // TODO: We don't know if the status is queued, submitted or running.
5084  // For now return "running", as others are unlikely to be of
5085  // interest.
5086  pi_int32 Result = CL_RUNNING;
5087 
5088  // Make sure that we query a host-visible event only.
5089  // If one wasn't yet created then don't create it here as well, and
5090  // just conservatively return that event is not yet completed.
5091  auto HostVisibleEvent = Event->HostVisibleEvent;
5092  if (Event->Completed) {
5093  Result = CL_COMPLETE;
5094  } else if (HostVisibleEvent) {
5095  ze_result_t ZeResult;
5096  ZeResult =
5097  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeEventQueryStatus, (HostVisibleEvent->ZeEvent));
5098  if (ZeResult == ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS) {
5099  Result = CL_COMPLETE;
5100  }
5101  }
5102  return ReturnValue(pi_cast<pi_int32>(Result));
5103  }
5104  case PI_EVENT_INFO_REFERENCE_COUNT:
5105  return ReturnValue(pi_uint32{Event->RefCount});
5106  default:
5107  zePrint("Unsupported ParamName in piEventGetInfo: ParamName=%d(%x)\n",
5108  ParamName, ParamName);
5109  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
5110  }
5111 
5112  return PI_SUCCESS;
5113 }
5114 
5115 pi_result piEventGetProfilingInfo(pi_event Event, pi_profiling_info ParamName,
5116  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
5117  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
5118 
5119  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
5120 
5121  if (Event->Queue &&
5122  (Event->Queue->Properties & PI_QUEUE_PROFILING_ENABLE) == 0) {
5123  return PI_PROFILING_INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE;
5124  }
5125 
5126  uint64_t ZeTimerResolution =
5127  Event->Queue
5128  ? Event->Queue->Device->ZeDeviceProperties->timerResolution
5129  : Event->Context->Devices[0]->ZeDeviceProperties->timerResolution;
5130  // Get timestamp frequency
5131  const double ZeTimerFreq = 1E09 / ZeTimerResolution;
5132 
5133  ReturnHelper ReturnValue(ParamValueSize, ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet);
5134 
5135  ze_kernel_timestamp_result_t tsResult;
5136 
5137  switch (ParamName) {
5138  case PI_PROFILING_INFO_COMMAND_START: {
5139  ZE_CALL(zeEventQueryKernelTimestamp, (Event->ZeEvent, &tsResult));
5140  uint64_t ContextStartTime = tsResult.context.kernelStart * ZeTimerFreq;
5141  return ReturnValue(ContextStartTime);
5142  }
5143  case PI_PROFILING_INFO_COMMAND_END: {
5144  ZE_CALL(zeEventQueryKernelTimestamp, (Event->ZeEvent, &tsResult));
5145 
5146  uint64_t ContextStartTime = tsResult.context.kernelStart;
5147  uint64_t ContextEndTime = tsResult.context.kernelEnd;
5148  //
5149  // Handle a possible wrap-around (the underlying HW counter is < 64-bit).
5150  // Note, it will not report correct time if there were multiple wrap
5151  // arounds, and the longer term plan is to enlarge the capacity of the
5152  // HW timestamps.
5153  //
5154  if (ContextEndTime <= ContextStartTime) {
5155  pi_device Device = Event->Context->Devices[0];
5156  const uint64_t TimestampMaxValue =
5157  (1LL << Device->ZeDeviceProperties->kernelTimestampValidBits) - 1;
5158  ContextEndTime += TimestampMaxValue - ContextStartTime;
5159  }
5160  ContextEndTime *= ZeTimerFreq;
5161  return ReturnValue(ContextEndTime);
5162  }
5163  case PI_PROFILING_INFO_COMMAND_QUEUED:
5164  case PI_PROFILING_INFO_COMMAND_SUBMIT:
5165  // TODO: Support these when Level Zero supported is added.
5166  return ReturnValue(uint64_t{0});
5167  default:
5168  zePrint("piEventGetProfilingInfo: not supported ParamName\n");
5169  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
5170  }
5171 
5172  return PI_SUCCESS;
5173 }
5174 
5175 // Perform any necessary cleanup after an event has been signalled.
5176 // This currently recycles the associate command list, and also makes
5177 // sure to release any kernel that may have been used by the event.
5178 pi_result _pi_event::cleanup(pi_queue LockedQueue) {
5179  // The implementation of this is slightly tricky. The same event
5180  // can be referred to by multiple threads, so it is possible to
5181  // have a race condition between the read of fields of the event,
5182  // and reseting those fields in some other thread.
5183  // But, since the event is uniquely associated with the queue
5184  // for the event, we use the locking that we already have to do on the
5185  // queue to also serve as the thread safety mechanism for the
5186  // any of the Event's data members that need to be read/reset as
5187  // part of the cleanup operations.
5188  if (Queue) {
5189  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
5190  auto Lock = ((Queue == LockedQueue) ? std::unique_lock<pi_shared_mutex>()
5191  : std::unique_lock(Queue->Mutex));
5192 
5193  if (ZeCommandList) {
5194  // Event has been signalled: If the fence for the associated command list
5195  // is signalled, then reset the fence and command list and add them to the
5196  // available list for reuse in PI calls.
5197  if (Queue->RefCount > 0) {
5198  auto it = Queue->CommandListMap.find(ZeCommandList);
5199  if (it == Queue->CommandListMap.end()) {
5200  die("Missing command-list completition fence");
5201  }
5202 
5203  // It is possible that the fence was already noted as signalled and
5204  // reset. In that case the InUse flag will be false, and
5205  // we shouldn't query it, synchronize on it, or try to reset it.
5206  if (it->second.InUse) {
5207  // Workaround for VM_BIND mode.
5208  // Make sure that the command-list doing memcpy is reset before
5209  // non-USM host memory potentially involved in the memcpy is freed.
5210  //
5211  // NOTE: it is valid to wait for the fence here as long as we aren't
5212  // doing batching on the involved command-list. Today memcpy goes by
5213  // itself in a command list.
5214  //
5215  // TODO: this will unnecessarily(?) wait for non-USM memory buffers
5216  // too, so we might need to add a new command type to differentiate.
5217  //
5218  ze_result_t ZeResult =
5219  (CommandType == PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_COPY)
5220  ? ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeHostSynchronize, (it->second.ZeFence))
5221  : ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeFenceQueryStatus, (it->second.ZeFence));
5222 
5223  if (ZeResult == ZE_RESULT_SUCCESS) {
5224  Queue->resetCommandList(it, true);
5225  ZeCommandList = nullptr;
5226  }
5227  }
5228  }
5229  }
5230 
5231  // Release the kernel associated with this event if there is one.
5232  if (CommandType == PI_COMMAND_TYPE_NDRANGE_KERNEL && CommandData) {
5233  PI_CALL(piKernelRelease(pi_cast<pi_kernel>(CommandData)));
5234  CommandData = nullptr;
5235  }
5236 
5237  // If this event was the LastCommandEvent in the queue, being used
5238  // to make sure that commands were executed in-order, remove this.
5239  // If we don't do this, the event can get released and freed leaving
5240  // a dangling pointer to this event. It could also cause unneeded
5241  // already finished events to show up in the wait list.
5242  if (Queue->LastCommandEvent == this) {
5243  Queue->LastCommandEvent = nullptr;
5244  }
5245  }
5246 
5247  if (!CleanedUp) {
5248  CleanedUp = true;
5249  // Release this event since we explicitly retained it on creation.
5250  // NOTE: that this needs to be done only once for an event so
5251  // this is guarded with the CleanedUp flag.
5252  //
5253  PI_CALL(EventRelease(this, LockedQueue));
5254  }
5255 
5256  // Make a list of all the dependent events that must have signalled
5257  // because this event was dependent on them. This list will be appended
5258  // to as we walk it so that this algorithm doesn't go recursive
5259  // due to dependent events themselves being dependent on other events
5260  // forming a potentially very deep tree, and deep recursion. That
5261  // turned out to be a significant problem with the recursive code
5262  // that preceded this implementation.
5263 
5264  std::list<pi_event> EventsToBeReleased;
5265 
5266  WaitList.collectEventsForReleaseAndDestroyPiZeEventList(EventsToBeReleased);
5267 
5268  while (!EventsToBeReleased.empty()) {
5269  pi_event DepEvent = EventsToBeReleased.front();
5270  EventsToBeReleased.pop_front();
5271 
5272  DepEvent->WaitList.collectEventsForReleaseAndDestroyPiZeEventList(
5273  EventsToBeReleased);
5274  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled && DepEvent->Queue) {
5275  // DepEvent has finished, we can release the associated kernel if there is
5276  // one. This is the earliest place we can do this and it can't be done
5277  // twice, so it is safe. Lock automatically releases when this goes out of
5278  // scope.
5279  // TODO: this code needs to be moved out of the guard.
5280  auto Lock = ((DepEvent->Queue == LockedQueue)
5281  ? std::unique_lock<pi_shared_mutex>()
5282  : std::unique_lock(DepEvent->Queue->Mutex));
5283 
5284  if (DepEvent->CommandType == PI_COMMAND_TYPE_NDRANGE_KERNEL &&
5285  DepEvent->CommandData) {
5286  PI_CALL(piKernelRelease(pi_cast<pi_kernel>(DepEvent->CommandData)));
5287  DepEvent->CommandData = nullptr;
5288  }
5289  }
5290  PI_CALL(EventRelease(DepEvent, LockedQueue));
5291  }
5292 
5293  return PI_SUCCESS;
5294 }
5295 
5296 pi_result piEventsWait(pi_uint32 NumEvents, const pi_event *EventList) {
5297 
5298  if (NumEvents && !EventList) {
5299  return PI_INVALID_EVENT;
5300  }
5301  if (EventsScope == OnDemandHostVisibleProxy) {
5302  // Make sure to add all host-visible "proxy" event signals if needed.
5303  // This ensures that all signalling commands are submitted below and
5304  // thus proxy events can be waited without a deadlock.
5305  //
5306  for (uint32_t I = 0; I < NumEvents; I++) {
5307  ze_event_handle_t ZeHostVisibleEvent;
5308  if (auto Res =
5309  EventList[I]->getOrCreateHostVisibleEvent(ZeHostVisibleEvent))
5310  return Res;
5311  }
5312  }
5313  // Submit dependent open command lists for execution, if any
5314  for (uint32_t I = 0; I < NumEvents; I++) {
5315  auto Queue = EventList[I]->Queue;
5316  if (Queue) {
5317  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
5318  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
5319 
5320  if (Queue->RefCount > 0) {
5321  if (auto Res = Queue->executeAllOpenCommandLists())
5322  return Res;
5323  }
5324  }
5325  }
5326  for (uint32_t I = 0; I < NumEvents; I++) {
5327  if (!EventList[I]->Completed) {
5328  auto HostVisibleEvent = EventList[I]->HostVisibleEvent;
5329  if (!HostVisibleEvent)
5330  die("The host-visible proxy event missing");
5331 
5332  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent = HostVisibleEvent->ZeEvent;
5333  zePrint("ZeEvent = %#lx\n", pi_cast<std::uintptr_t>(ZeEvent));
5334  ZE_CALL(zeHostSynchronize, (ZeEvent));
5335  }
5336  // NOTE: we are cleaning up after the event here to free resources
5337  // sooner in case run-time is not calling piEventRelease soon enough.
5338  EventList[I]->cleanup();
5339  }
5340  return PI_SUCCESS;
5341 }
5342 
5343 pi_result piEventSetCallback(pi_event Event, pi_int32 CommandExecCallbackType,
5344  void (*PFnNotify)(pi_event Event,
5345  pi_int32 EventCommandStatus,
5346  void *UserData),
5347  void *UserData) {
5348  (void)Event;
5349  (void)CommandExecCallbackType;
5350  (void)PFnNotify;
5351  (void)UserData;
5352  die("piEventSetCallback: deprecated, to be removed");
5353  return PI_SUCCESS;
5354 }
5355 
5356 pi_result piEventSetStatus(pi_event Event, pi_int32 ExecutionStatus) {
5357  (void)Event;
5358  (void)ExecutionStatus;
5359  die("piEventSetStatus: deprecated, to be removed");
5360  return PI_SUCCESS;
5361 }
5362 
5363 pi_result piEventRetain(pi_event Event) {
5364  ++(Event->RefCount);
5365  return PI_SUCCESS;
5366 }
5367 
5368 pi_result piEventRelease(pi_event Event) {
5369  return EventRelease(Event, nullptr);
5370 }
5371 
5372 static pi_result EventRelease(pi_event Event, pi_queue LockedQueue) {
5373  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
5374  if (!Event->RefCount) {
5375  die("piEventRelease: called on a destroyed event");
5376  }
5377 
5378  if (--(Event->RefCount) == 0) {
5379  if (!Event->CleanedUp)
5380  Event->cleanup(LockedQueue);
5381 
5382  if (Event->CommandType == PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_UNMAP &&
5383  Event->CommandData) {
5384  // Free the memory allocated in the piEnqueueMemBufferMap.
5385  if (auto Res = ZeMemFreeHelper(Event->Context, Event->CommandData))
5386  return Res;
5387  Event->CommandData = nullptr;
5388  }
5389  if (Event->OwnZeEvent) {
5390  ZE_CALL(zeEventDestroy, (Event->ZeEvent));
5391  }
5392  // It is possible that host-visible event was never created.
5393  // In case it was check if that's different from this same event
5394  // and release a reference to it.
5395  if (Event->HostVisibleEvent && Event->HostVisibleEvent != Event) {
5396  // Decrement ref-count of the host-visible proxy event.
5397  PI_CALL(EventRelease(Event->HostVisibleEvent, LockedQueue));
5398  }
5399 
5400  auto Context = Event->Context;
5401  if (auto Res = Context->decrementUnreleasedEventsInPool(Event))
5402  return Res;
5403 
5404  // We intentionally incremented the reference counter when an event is
5405  // created so that we can avoid pi_queue is released before the associated
5406  // pi_event is released. Here we have to decrement it so pi_queue
5407  // can be released successfully.
5408  if (Event->Queue) {
5409  PI_CALL(QueueRelease(Event->Queue, LockedQueue));
5410  }
5411  delete Event;
5412  }
5413  return PI_SUCCESS;
5414 }
5415 
5416 pi_result piextEventGetNativeHandle(pi_event Event,
5417  pi_native_handle *NativeHandle) {
5418  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
5419  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
5420 
5421  auto *ZeEvent = pi_cast<ze_event_handle_t *>(NativeHandle);
5422  *ZeEvent = Event->ZeEvent;
5423 
5424  // Event can potentially be in an open command-list, make sure that
5425  // it is submitted for execution to avoid potential deadlock if
5426  // interop app is going to wait for it.
5427  if (Event->Queue) {
5428  std::scoped_lock lock(Event->Queue->Mutex);
5429  Event->Queue->executeOpenCommandListWithEvent(Event);
5430  }
5431  return PI_SUCCESS;
5432 }
5433 
5434 pi_result piextEventCreateWithNativeHandle(pi_native_handle NativeHandle,
5435  pi_context Context,
5436  bool OwnNativeHandle,
5437  pi_event *Event) {
5438  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
5439  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
5440  PI_ASSERT(NativeHandle, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
5441 
5442  auto ZeEvent = pi_cast<ze_event_handle_t>(NativeHandle);
5443  *Event = new _pi_event(ZeEvent, nullptr /* ZeEventPool */, Context,
5444  PI_COMMAND_TYPE_USER, OwnNativeHandle);
5445 
5446  // Assume native event is host-visible, or otherwise we'd
5447  // need to create a host-visible proxy for it.
5448  (*Event)->HostVisibleEvent = *Event;
5449 
5450  return PI_SUCCESS;
5451 }
5452 
5453 //
5454 // Sampler
5455 //
5456 pi_result piSamplerCreate(pi_context Context,
5457  const pi_sampler_properties *SamplerProperties,
5458  pi_sampler *RetSampler) {
5459 
5460  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
5461  PI_ASSERT(RetSampler, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
5462 
5463  // Have the "0" device in context to own the sampler. Rely on Level-Zero
5464  // drivers to perform migration as necessary for sharing it across multiple
5465  // devices in the context.
5466  //
5467  // TODO: figure out if we instead need explicit copying for acessing
5468  // the sampler from other devices in the context.
5469  //
5470  pi_device Device = Context->Devices[0];
5471 
5472  ze_sampler_handle_t ZeSampler;
5473  ZeStruct<ze_sampler_desc_t> ZeSamplerDesc;
5474 
5475  // Set the default values for the ZeSamplerDesc.
5476  ZeSamplerDesc.isNormalized = PI_TRUE;
5477  ZeSamplerDesc.addressMode = ZE_SAMPLER_ADDRESS_MODE_CLAMP;
5478  ZeSamplerDesc.filterMode = ZE_SAMPLER_FILTER_MODE_NEAREST;
5479 
5480  // Update the values of the ZeSamplerDesc from the pi_sampler_properties list.
5481  // Default values will be used if any of the following is true:
5482  // a) SamplerProperties list is NULL
5483  // b) SamplerProperties list is missing any properties
5484 
5485  if (SamplerProperties) {
5486  const pi_sampler_properties *CurProperty = SamplerProperties;
5487 
5488  while (*CurProperty != 0) {
5489  switch (*CurProperty) {
5490  case PI_SAMPLER_PROPERTIES_NORMALIZED_COORDS: {
5491  pi_bool CurValueBool = pi_cast<pi_bool>(*(++CurProperty));
5492 
5493  if (CurValueBool == PI_TRUE)
5494  ZeSamplerDesc.isNormalized = PI_TRUE;
5495  else if (CurValueBool == PI_FALSE)
5496  ZeSamplerDesc.isNormalized = PI_FALSE;
5497  else {
5498  zePrint("piSamplerCreate: unsupported "
5499  "PI_SAMPLER_NORMALIZED_COORDS value\n");
5500  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
5501  }
5502  } break;
5503 
5504  case PI_SAMPLER_PROPERTIES_ADDRESSING_MODE: {
5505  pi_sampler_addressing_mode CurValueAddressingMode =
5506  pi_cast<pi_sampler_addressing_mode>(
5507  pi_cast<pi_uint32>(*(++CurProperty)));
5508 
5509  // Level Zero runtime with API version 1.2 and lower has a bug:
5510  // ZE_SAMPLER_ADDRESS_MODE_CLAMP_TO_BORDER is implemented as "clamp to
5511  // edge" and ZE_SAMPLER_ADDRESS_MODE_CLAMP is implemented as "clamp to
5512  // border", i.e. logic is flipped. Starting from API version 1.3 this
5513  // problem is going to be fixed. That's why check for API version to set
5514  // an address mode.
5515  ze_api_version_t ZeApiVersion =
5516  Context->Devices[0]->Platform->ZeApiVersion;
5517  // TODO: add support for PI_SAMPLER_ADDRESSING_MODE_CLAMP_TO_EDGE
5518  switch (CurValueAddressingMode) {
5519  case PI_SAMPLER_ADDRESSING_MODE_NONE:
5520  ZeSamplerDesc.addressMode = ZE_SAMPLER_ADDRESS_MODE_NONE;
5521  break;
5522  case PI_SAMPLER_ADDRESSING_MODE_REPEAT:
5523  ZeSamplerDesc.addressMode = ZE_SAMPLER_ADDRESS_MODE_REPEAT;
5524  break;
5525  case PI_SAMPLER_ADDRESSING_MODE_CLAMP:
5526  ZeSamplerDesc.addressMode =
5527  ZeApiVersion < ZE_MAKE_VERSION(1, 3)
5528  ? ZE_SAMPLER_ADDRESS_MODE_CLAMP
5529  : ZE_SAMPLER_ADDRESS_MODE_CLAMP_TO_BORDER;
5530  break;
5531  case PI_SAMPLER_ADDRESSING_MODE_CLAMP_TO_EDGE:
5532  ZeSamplerDesc.addressMode =
5533  ZeApiVersion < ZE_MAKE_VERSION(1, 3)
5534  ? ZE_SAMPLER_ADDRESS_MODE_CLAMP_TO_BORDER
5535  : ZE_SAMPLER_ADDRESS_MODE_CLAMP;
5536  break;
5537  case PI_SAMPLER_ADDRESSING_MODE_MIRRORED_REPEAT:
5538  ZeSamplerDesc.addressMode = ZE_SAMPLER_ADDRESS_MODE_MIRROR;
5539  break;
5540  default:
5541  zePrint("piSamplerCreate: unsupported PI_SAMPLER_ADDRESSING_MODE "
5542  "value\n");
5543  zePrint("PI_SAMPLER_ADDRESSING_MODE=%d\n", CurValueAddressingMode);
5544  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
5545  }
5546  } break;
5547 
5548  case PI_SAMPLER_PROPERTIES_FILTER_MODE: {
5549  pi_sampler_filter_mode CurValueFilterMode =
5550  pi_cast<pi_sampler_filter_mode>(
5551  pi_cast<pi_uint32>(*(++CurProperty)));
5552 
5553  if (CurValueFilterMode == PI_SAMPLER_FILTER_MODE_NEAREST)
5554  ZeSamplerDesc.filterMode = ZE_SAMPLER_FILTER_MODE_NEAREST;
5555  else if (CurValueFilterMode == PI_SAMPLER_FILTER_MODE_LINEAR)
5556  ZeSamplerDesc.filterMode = ZE_SAMPLER_FILTER_MODE_LINEAR;
5557  else {
5558  zePrint("PI_SAMPLER_FILTER_MODE=%d\n", CurValueFilterMode);
5559  zePrint(
5560  "piSamplerCreate: unsupported PI_SAMPLER_FILTER_MODE value\n");
5561  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
5562  }
5563  } break;
5564 
5565  default:
5566  break;
5567  }
5568  CurProperty++;
5569  }
5570  }
5571 
5572  ZE_CALL(zeSamplerCreate, (Context->ZeContext, Device->ZeDevice,
5573  &ZeSamplerDesc, // TODO: translate properties
5574  &ZeSampler));
5575 
5576  try {
5577  *RetSampler = new _pi_sampler(ZeSampler);
5578  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
5579  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
5580  } catch (...) {
5581  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
5582  }
5583  return PI_SUCCESS;
5584 }
5585 
5586 pi_result piSamplerGetInfo(pi_sampler Sampler, pi_sampler_info ParamName,
5587  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
5588  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
5589  (void)Sampler;
5590  (void)ParamName;
5591  (void)ParamValueSize;
5592  (void)ParamValue;
5593  (void)ParamValueSizeRet;
5594 
5595  die("piSamplerGetInfo: not implemented");
5596  return {};
5597 }
5598 
5599 pi_result piSamplerRetain(pi_sampler Sampler) {
5600  PI_ASSERT(Sampler, PI_INVALID_SAMPLER);
5601 
5602  ++(Sampler->RefCount);
5603  return PI_SUCCESS;
5604 }
5605 
5606 pi_result piSamplerRelease(pi_sampler Sampler) {
5607  PI_ASSERT(Sampler, PI_INVALID_SAMPLER);
5608 
5609  if (--(Sampler->RefCount) == 0) {
5610  ZE_CALL(zeSamplerDestroy, (Sampler->ZeSampler));
5611  delete Sampler;
5612  }
5613  return PI_SUCCESS;
5614 }
5615 
5616 //
5617 // Queue Commands
5618 //
5619 pi_result piEnqueueEventsWait(pi_queue Queue, pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
5620  const pi_event *EventWaitList, pi_event *Event) {
5621 
5622  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
5623  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
5624 
5625  if (EventWaitList) {
5626  PI_ASSERT(NumEventsInWaitList > 0, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
5627 
5628  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
5629  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
5630 
5631  _pi_ze_event_list_t TmpWaitList = {};
5632  if (auto Res = TmpWaitList.createAndRetainPiZeEventList(
5633  NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList, Queue))
5634  return Res;
5635 
5636  // Get a new command list to be used on this call
5637  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList{};
5638  if (auto Res = Queue->Context->getAvailableCommandList(Queue, CommandList))
5639  return Res;
5640 
5641  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent = nullptr;
5642  auto Res = createEventAndAssociateQueue(Queue, Event, PI_COMMAND_TYPE_USER,
5643  CommandList);
5644  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
5645  return Res;
5646  ZeEvent = (*Event)->ZeEvent;
5647  (*Event)->WaitList = TmpWaitList;
5648 
5649  const auto &WaitList = (*Event)->WaitList;
5650  auto ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
5651  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendWaitOnEvents,
5652  (ZeCommandList, WaitList.Length, WaitList.ZeEventList));
5653 
5654  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendSignalEvent, (ZeCommandList, ZeEvent));
5655 
5656  // Execute command list asynchronously as the event will be used
5657  // to track down its completion.
5658  return Queue->executeCommandList(CommandList);
5659  }
5660 
5661  // If wait-list is empty, then this particular command should wait until
5662  // all previous enqueued commands to the command-queue have completed.
5663  //
5664  // TODO: find a way to do that without blocking the host.
5665 
5666  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
5667  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
5668 
5669  auto Res = createEventAndAssociateQueue(Queue, Event, PI_COMMAND_TYPE_USER,
5670  Queue->CommandListMap.end());
5671  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
5672  return Res;
5673 
5674  for (auto &ZeQueue : Queue->ComputeQueueGroup.ZeQueues) {
5675  if (ZeQueue)
5676  ZE_CALL(zeHostSynchronize, (ZeQueue));
5677  }
5678  for (auto &ZeQueue : Queue->CopyQueueGroup.ZeQueues) {
5679  if (ZeQueue)
5680  ZE_CALL(zeHostSynchronize, (ZeQueue));
5681  }
5682 
5683  Queue->LastCommandEvent = *Event;
5684 
5685  ZE_CALL(zeEventHostSignal, ((*Event)->ZeEvent));
5686  (*Event)->Completed = true;
5687  return PI_SUCCESS;
5688 }
5689 
5690 pi_result piEnqueueEventsWaitWithBarrier(pi_queue Queue,
5691  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
5692  const pi_event *EventWaitList,
5693  pi_event *Event) {
5694  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
5695  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
5696 
5697  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
5698  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
5699 
5700  _pi_ze_event_list_t TmpWaitList;
5701  if (auto Res = TmpWaitList.createAndRetainPiZeEventList(NumEventsInWaitList,
5702  EventWaitList, Queue))
5703  return Res;
5704 
5705  // Get a new command list to be used on this call
5706  bool OkToBatch = true;
5707  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList{};
5708  if (auto Res = Queue->Context->getAvailableCommandList(
5709  Queue, CommandList, false /*copy*/, OkToBatch))
5710  return Res;
5711 
5712  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent = nullptr;
5713  auto Res = createEventAndAssociateQueue(Queue, Event, PI_COMMAND_TYPE_USER,
5714  CommandList);
5715  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
5716  return Res;
5717  ZeEvent = (*Event)->ZeEvent;
5718  (*Event)->WaitList = TmpWaitList;
5719 
5720  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendBarrier,
5721  (CommandList->first, ZeEvent, (*Event)->WaitList.Length,
5722  (*Event)->WaitList.ZeEventList));
5723 
5724  // Execute command list asynchronously as the event will be used
5725  // to track down its completion.
5726  return Queue->executeCommandList(CommandList, false, OkToBatch);
5727 }
5728 
5729 pi_result piEnqueueMemBufferRead(pi_queue Queue, pi_mem Src,
5730  pi_bool BlockingRead, size_t Offset,
5731  size_t Size, void *Dst,
5732  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
5733  const pi_event *EventWaitList,
5734  pi_event *Event) {
5735  PI_ASSERT(Src, PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
5736  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
5737 
5738  std::shared_lock SrcLock(Src->Mutex, std::defer_lock);
5739  std::scoped_lock LockAll(SrcLock, Queue->Mutex);
5740  return enqueueMemCopyHelper(PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_READ, Queue, Dst,
5741  BlockingRead, Size,
5742  pi_cast<char *>(Src->getZeHandle()) + Offset,
5743  NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList, Event);
5744 }
5745 
5746 pi_result piEnqueueMemBufferReadRect(
5747  pi_queue Queue, pi_mem Buffer, pi_bool BlockingRead,
5748  pi_buff_rect_offset BufferOffset, pi_buff_rect_offset HostOffset,
5749  pi_buff_rect_region Region, size_t BufferRowPitch, size_t BufferSlicePitch,
5750  size_t HostRowPitch, size_t HostSlicePitch, void *Ptr,
5751  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList, const pi_event *EventWaitList,
5752  pi_event *Event) {
5753 
5754  PI_ASSERT(Buffer, PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
5755  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
5756 
5757  std::shared_lock SrcLock(Buffer->Mutex, std::defer_lock);
5758  std::scoped_lock LockAll(SrcLock, Queue->Mutex);
5759  return enqueueMemCopyRectHelper(
5760  PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_READ_RECT, Queue, Buffer->getZeHandle(),
5761  static_cast<char *>(Ptr), BufferOffset, HostOffset, Region,
5762  BufferRowPitch, HostRowPitch, BufferSlicePitch, HostSlicePitch,
5763  BlockingRead, NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList, Event);
5764 }
5765 
5766 } // extern "C"
5767 
5768 bool _pi_queue::useCopyEngine(bool PreferCopyEngine) const {
5769  return PreferCopyEngine && CopyQueueGroup.ZeQueues.size() > 0 &&
5770  (!isInOrderQueue() || UseCopyEngineForInOrderQueue);
5771 }
5772 
5773 // Shared by all memory read/write/copy PI interfaces.
5774 // PI interfaces must have queue's and destination buffer's mutexes locked for
5775 // exclusive use and source buffer's mutex locked for shared use on entry.
5776 static pi_result enqueueMemCopyHelper(pi_command_type CommandType,
5777  pi_queue Queue, void *Dst,
5778  pi_bool BlockingWrite, size_t Size,
5779  const void *Src,
5780  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
5781  const pi_event *EventWaitList,
5782  pi_event *Event, bool PreferCopyEngine) {
5783  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
5784  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
5785 
5786  _pi_ze_event_list_t TmpWaitList;
5787  if (auto Res = TmpWaitList.createAndRetainPiZeEventList(NumEventsInWaitList,
5788  EventWaitList, Queue))
5789  return Res;
5790 
5791  // Get a new command list to be used on this call
5792  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList{};
5793  bool UseCopyEngine = Queue->useCopyEngine(PreferCopyEngine);
5794 
5795  // We want to batch these commands to avoid extra submissions (costly)
5796  bool OkToBatch = true;
5797 
5798  if (auto Res = Queue->Context->getAvailableCommandList(
5799  Queue, CommandList, UseCopyEngine, OkToBatch))
5800  return Res;
5801 
5802  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent = nullptr;
5803  auto Res =
5804  createEventAndAssociateQueue(Queue, Event, CommandType, CommandList);
5805  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
5806  return Res;
5807  ZeEvent = (*Event)->ZeEvent;
5808  (*Event)->WaitList = TmpWaitList;
5809 
5810  const auto &ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
5811  const auto &WaitList = (*Event)->WaitList;
5812  if (WaitList.Length) {
5813 
5814  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendWaitOnEvents,
5815  (ZeCommandList, WaitList.Length, WaitList.ZeEventList));
5816  }
5817 
5818  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendMemoryCopy,
5819  (ZeCommandList, Dst, Src, Size, ZeEvent, 0, nullptr));
5820 
5821  zePrint("calling zeCommandListAppendMemoryCopy() with\n"
5822  " ZeEvent %#lx\n",
5823  pi_cast<std::uintptr_t>(ZeEvent));
5824  printZeEventList(WaitList);
5825 
5826  if (auto Res =
5827  Queue->executeCommandList(CommandList, BlockingWrite, OkToBatch))
5828  return Res;
5829 
5830  return PI_SUCCESS;
5831 }
5832 
5833 // Shared by all memory read/write/copy rect PI interfaces.
5834 // PI interfaces must have queue's and destination buffer's mutexes locked for
5835 // exclusive use and source buffer's mutex locked for shared use on entry.
5836 static pi_result enqueueMemCopyRectHelper(
5837  pi_command_type CommandType, pi_queue Queue, void *SrcBuffer,
5838  void *DstBuffer, pi_buff_rect_offset SrcOrigin,
5839  pi_buff_rect_offset DstOrigin, pi_buff_rect_region Region,
5840  size_t SrcRowPitch, size_t DstRowPitch, size_t SrcSlicePitch,
5841  size_t DstSlicePitch, pi_bool Blocking, pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
5842  const pi_event *EventWaitList, pi_event *Event, bool PreferCopyEngine) {
5843 
5844  PI_ASSERT(Region && SrcOrigin && DstOrigin && Queue, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
5845  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
5846 
5847  _pi_ze_event_list_t TmpWaitList;
5848  if (auto Res = TmpWaitList.createAndRetainPiZeEventList(NumEventsInWaitList,
5849  EventWaitList, Queue))
5850  return Res;
5851 
5852  // Get a new command list to be used on this call
5853  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList{};
5854  bool UseCopyEngine = Queue->useCopyEngine(PreferCopyEngine);
5855  // We want to batch these commands to avoid extra submissions (costly)
5856  bool OkToBatch = true;
5857  if (auto Res = Queue->Context->getAvailableCommandList(
5858  Queue, CommandList, UseCopyEngine, OkToBatch))
5859  return Res;
5860 
5861  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent = nullptr;
5862  auto Res =
5863  createEventAndAssociateQueue(Queue, Event, CommandType, CommandList);
5864  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
5865  return Res;
5866  ZeEvent = (*Event)->ZeEvent;
5867  (*Event)->WaitList = TmpWaitList;
5868 
5869  const auto &ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
5870  const auto &WaitList = (*Event)->WaitList;
5871 
5872  if (WaitList.Length) {
5873  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendWaitOnEvents,
5874  (ZeCommandList, WaitList.Length, WaitList.ZeEventList));
5875  }
5876  zePrint("calling zeCommandListAppendMemoryCopy() with\n"
5877  " ZeEvent %#lx\n",
5878  pi_cast<std::uintptr_t>(ZeEvent));
5879  printZeEventList(WaitList);
5880 
5881  uint32_t SrcOriginX = pi_cast<uint32_t>(SrcOrigin->x_bytes);
5882  uint32_t SrcOriginY = pi_cast<uint32_t>(SrcOrigin->y_scalar);
5883  uint32_t SrcOriginZ = pi_cast<uint32_t>(SrcOrigin->z_scalar);
5884 
5885  uint32_t SrcPitch = SrcRowPitch;
5886  if (SrcPitch == 0)
5887  SrcPitch = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Region->width_bytes);
5888 
5889  if (SrcSlicePitch == 0)
5890  SrcSlicePitch = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Region->height_scalar) * SrcPitch;
5891 
5892  uint32_t DstOriginX = pi_cast<uint32_t>(DstOrigin->x_bytes);
5893  uint32_t DstOriginY = pi_cast<uint32_t>(DstOrigin->y_scalar);
5894  uint32_t DstOriginZ = pi_cast<uint32_t>(DstOrigin->z_scalar);
5895 
5896  uint32_t DstPitch = DstRowPitch;
5897  if (DstPitch == 0)
5898  DstPitch = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Region->width_bytes);
5899 
5900  if (DstSlicePitch == 0)
5901  DstSlicePitch = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Region->height_scalar) * DstPitch;
5902 
5903  uint32_t Width = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Region->width_bytes);
5904  uint32_t Height = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Region->height_scalar);
5905  uint32_t Depth = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Region->depth_scalar);
5906 
5907  const ze_copy_region_t ZeSrcRegion = {SrcOriginX, SrcOriginY, SrcOriginZ,
5908  Width, Height, Depth};
5909  const ze_copy_region_t ZeDstRegion = {DstOriginX, DstOriginY, DstOriginZ,
5910  Width, Height, Depth};
5911 
5912  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendMemoryCopyRegion,
5913  (ZeCommandList, DstBuffer, &ZeDstRegion, DstPitch, DstSlicePitch,
5914  SrcBuffer, &ZeSrcRegion, SrcPitch, SrcSlicePitch, nullptr, 0,
5915  nullptr));
5916 
5917  zePrint("calling zeCommandListAppendMemoryCopyRegion()\n");
5918 
5919  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendBarrier, (ZeCommandList, ZeEvent, 0, nullptr));
5920 
5921  zePrint("calling zeCommandListAppendBarrier() with Event %#lx\n",
5922  pi_cast<std::uintptr_t>(ZeEvent));
5923 
5924  if (auto Res = Queue->executeCommandList(CommandList, Blocking, OkToBatch))
5925  return Res;
5926 
5927  return PI_SUCCESS;
5928 }
5929 
5930 extern "C" {
5931 
5932 pi_result piEnqueueMemBufferWrite(pi_queue Queue, pi_mem Buffer,
5933  pi_bool BlockingWrite, size_t Offset,
5934  size_t Size, const void *Ptr,
5935  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
5936  const pi_event *EventWaitList,
5937  pi_event *Event) {
5938 
5939  PI_ASSERT(Buffer, PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
5940  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
5941 
5942  std::scoped_lock Lock(Queue->Mutex, Buffer->Mutex);
5943  return enqueueMemCopyHelper(PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_WRITE, Queue,
5944  pi_cast<char *>(Buffer->getZeHandle()) +
5945  Offset, // dst
5946  BlockingWrite, Size,
5947  Ptr, // src
5948  NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList, Event);
5949 }
5950 
5951 pi_result piEnqueueMemBufferWriteRect(
5952  pi_queue Queue, pi_mem Buffer, pi_bool BlockingWrite,
5953  pi_buff_rect_offset BufferOffset, pi_buff_rect_offset HostOffset,
5954  pi_buff_rect_region Region, size_t BufferRowPitch, size_t BufferSlicePitch,
5955  size_t HostRowPitch, size_t HostSlicePitch, const void *Ptr,
5956  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList, const pi_event *EventWaitList,
5957  pi_event *Event) {
5958 
5959  PI_ASSERT(Buffer, PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
5960  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
5961 
5962  std::scoped_lock Lock(Queue->Mutex, Buffer->Mutex);
5963  return enqueueMemCopyRectHelper(
5964  PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_WRITE_RECT, Queue,
5965  const_cast<char *>(static_cast<const char *>(Ptr)), Buffer->getZeHandle(),
5966  HostOffset, BufferOffset, Region, HostRowPitch, BufferRowPitch,
5967  HostSlicePitch, BufferSlicePitch, BlockingWrite, NumEventsInWaitList,
5968  EventWaitList, Event);
5969 }
5970 
5971 pi_result piEnqueueMemBufferCopy(pi_queue Queue, pi_mem SrcBuffer,
5972  pi_mem DstBuffer, size_t SrcOffset,
5973  size_t DstOffset, size_t Size,
5974  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
5975  const pi_event *EventWaitList,
5976  pi_event *Event) {
5977  PI_ASSERT(SrcBuffer && DstBuffer, PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
5978  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
5979 
5980  std::shared_lock SrcLock(SrcBuffer->Mutex, std::defer_lock);
5981  std::scoped_lock LockAll(SrcLock, DstBuffer->Mutex, Queue->Mutex);
5982 
5983  // Copy engine is preferred only for host to device transfer.
5984  // Device to device transfers run faster on compute engines.
5985  bool PreferCopyEngine = (SrcBuffer->OnHost || DstBuffer->OnHost);
5986 
5987  // Temporary option added to use copy engine for D2D copy
5988  PreferCopyEngine |= UseCopyEngineForD2DCopy;
5989 
5990  return enqueueMemCopyHelper(
5991  PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_COPY, Queue,
5992  pi_cast<char *>(DstBuffer->getZeHandle()) + DstOffset,
5993  false, // blocking
5994  Size, pi_cast<char *>(SrcBuffer->getZeHandle()) + SrcOffset,
5995  NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList, Event, PreferCopyEngine);
5996 }
5997 
5998 pi_result piEnqueueMemBufferCopyRect(
5999  pi_queue Queue, pi_mem SrcBuffer, pi_mem DstBuffer,
6000  pi_buff_rect_offset SrcOrigin, pi_buff_rect_offset DstOrigin,
6001  pi_buff_rect_region Region, size_t SrcRowPitch, size_t SrcSlicePitch,
6002  size_t DstRowPitch, size_t DstSlicePitch, pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
6003  const pi_event *EventWaitList, pi_event *Event) {
6004  PI_ASSERT(SrcBuffer && DstBuffer, PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
6005  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
6006 
6007  std::shared_lock SrcLock(SrcBuffer->Mutex, std::defer_lock);
6008  std::scoped_lock LockAll(SrcLock, DstBuffer->Mutex, Queue->Mutex);
6009 
6010  // Copy engine is preferred only for host to device transfer.
6011  // Device to device transfers run faster on compute engines.
6012  bool PreferCopyEngine = (SrcBuffer->OnHost || DstBuffer->OnHost);
6013  return enqueueMemCopyRectHelper(
6014  PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_COPY_RECT, Queue, SrcBuffer->getZeHandle(),
6015  DstBuffer->getZeHandle(), SrcOrigin, DstOrigin, Region, SrcRowPitch,
6016  DstRowPitch, SrcSlicePitch, DstSlicePitch,
6017  false, // blocking
6018  NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList, Event, PreferCopyEngine);
6019 }
6020 
6021 } // extern "C"
6022 
6023 // PI interfaces must have queue's and buffer's mutexes locked on entry.
6024 static pi_result
6025 enqueueMemFillHelper(pi_command_type CommandType, pi_queue Queue, void *Ptr,
6026  const void *Pattern, size_t PatternSize, size_t Size,
6027  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
6028  const pi_event *EventWaitList, pi_event *Event) {
6029  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
6030  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
6031  // Pattern size must be a power of two.
6032  PI_ASSERT((PatternSize > 0) && ((PatternSize & (PatternSize - 1)) == 0),
6033  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6034 
6035  _pi_ze_event_list_t TmpWaitList;
6036  if (auto Res = TmpWaitList.createAndRetainPiZeEventList(NumEventsInWaitList,
6037  EventWaitList, Queue))
6038  return Res;
6039 
6040  auto &Device = Queue->Device;
6041 
6042  // Performance analysis on a simple SYCL data "fill" test shows copy engine
6043  // is faster than compute engine for such operations.
6044  //
6045  bool PreferCopyEngine = true;
6046 
6047  // Make sure that pattern size matches the capability of the copy queues.
6048  // Check both main and link groups as we don't known which one will be used.
6049  //
6050  if (Device->hasCopyEngine()) {
6051  if (Device->hasMainCopyEngine() &&
6052  Device->QueueGroup[_pi_device::queue_group_info_t::MainCopy]
6053  .ZeProperties.maxMemoryFillPatternSize < PatternSize) {
6054  PreferCopyEngine = false;
6055  }
6056  if (Device->hasLinkCopyEngine() &&
6057  Device->QueueGroup[_pi_device::queue_group_info_t::LinkCopy]
6058  .ZeProperties.maxMemoryFillPatternSize < PatternSize) {
6059  PreferCopyEngine = false;
6060  }
6061  }
6062 
6063  bool UseCopyEngine = Queue->useCopyEngine(PreferCopyEngine);
6064  if (!UseCopyEngine) {
6065  // Pattern size must fit the compute queue capabilities.
6066  PI_ASSERT(PatternSize <=
6067  Device->QueueGroup[_pi_device::queue_group_info_t::Compute]
6068  .ZeProperties.maxMemoryFillPatternSize,
6069  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6070  }
6071 
6072  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList{};
6073  // We want to batch these commands to avoid extra submissions (costly)
6074  bool OkToBatch = true;
6075  if (auto Res = Queue->Context->getAvailableCommandList(
6076  Queue, CommandList, UseCopyEngine, OkToBatch))
6077  return Res;
6078 
6079  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent = nullptr;
6080  auto Res =
6081  createEventAndAssociateQueue(Queue, Event, CommandType, CommandList);
6082  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
6083  return Res;
6084  ZeEvent = (*Event)->ZeEvent;
6085  (*Event)->WaitList = TmpWaitList;
6086 
6087  const auto &ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
6088  const auto &WaitList = (*Event)->WaitList;
6089 
6090  if (WaitList.Length) {
6091  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendWaitOnEvents,
6092  (ZeCommandList, WaitList.Length, WaitList.ZeEventList));
6093  }
6094 
6095  ZE_CALL(
6096  zeCommandListAppendMemoryFill,
6097  (ZeCommandList, Ptr, Pattern, PatternSize, Size, ZeEvent, 0, nullptr));
6098 
6099  zePrint("calling zeCommandListAppendMemoryFill() with\n"
6100  " ZeEvent %#lx\n",
6101  pi_cast<pi_uint64>(ZeEvent));
6102  printZeEventList(WaitList);
6103 
6104  // Execute command list asynchronously, as the event will be used
6105  // to track down its completion.
6106  if (auto Res = Queue->executeCommandList(CommandList, false, OkToBatch))
6107  return Res;
6108 
6109  return PI_SUCCESS;
6110 }
6111 
6112 extern "C" {
6113 
6114 pi_result piEnqueueMemBufferFill(pi_queue Queue, pi_mem Buffer,
6115  const void *Pattern, size_t PatternSize,
6116  size_t Offset, size_t Size,
