6117  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
6118  const pi_event *EventWaitList,
6119  pi_event *Event) {
6120 
6121  PI_ASSERT(Buffer, PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
6122  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
6123 
6124  std::scoped_lock Lock(Queue->Mutex, Buffer->Mutex);
6125  return enqueueMemFillHelper(PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_FILL, Queue,
6126  pi_cast<char *>(Buffer->getZeHandle()) + Offset,
6127  Pattern, PatternSize, Size, NumEventsInWaitList,
6128  EventWaitList, Event);
6129 }
6130 
6131 static pi_result USMHostAllocImpl(void **ResultPtr, pi_context Context,
6132  pi_usm_mem_properties *Properties,
6133  size_t Size, pi_uint32 Alignment);
6134 
6135 pi_result piEnqueueMemBufferMap(pi_queue Queue, pi_mem Buffer,
6136  pi_bool BlockingMap, pi_map_flags MapFlags,
6137  size_t Offset, size_t Size,
6138  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
6139  const pi_event *EventWaitList, pi_event *Event,
6140  void **RetMap) {
6141 
6142  // TODO: we don't implement read-only or write-only, always read-write.
6143  // assert((map_flags & PI_MAP_READ) != 0);
6144  // assert((map_flags & PI_MAP_WRITE) != 0);
6145  PI_ASSERT(Buffer, PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
6146  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
6147  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
6148 
6149  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent = nullptr;
6150 
6151  {
6152  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
6153  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
6154 
6155  _pi_ze_event_list_t TmpWaitList;
6156  if (auto Res = TmpWaitList.createAndRetainPiZeEventList(
6157  NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList, Queue))
6158  return Res;
6159 
6160  auto Res = createEventAndAssociateQueue(Queue, Event,
6161  PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_MAP,
6162  Queue->CommandListMap.end());
6163  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
6164  return Res;
6165  ZeEvent = (*Event)->ZeEvent;
6166  (*Event)->WaitList = TmpWaitList;
6167  }
6168 
6169  // TODO: Level Zero is missing the memory "mapping" capabilities, so we are
6170  // left to doing new memory allocation and a copy (read) on discrete devices.
6171  // For integrated devices, we have allocated the buffer in host memory so no
6172  // actions are needed here except for synchronizing on incoming events.
6173  // A host-to-host copy is done if a host pointer had been supplied during
6174  // buffer creation on integrated devices.
6175  //
6176  // TODO: for discrete, check if the input buffer is already allocated
6177  // in shared memory and thus is accessible from the host as is.
6178  // Can we get SYCL RT to predict/allocate in shared memory
6179  // from the beginning?
6180 
6181  // For integrated devices the buffer has been allocated in host memory.
6182  if (Buffer->OnHost) {
6183  // Wait on incoming events before doing the copy
6184  PI_CALL(piEventsWait(NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList));
6185 
6186  if (Queue->isInOrderQueue()) {
6187  pi_event TmpLastCommandEvent = nullptr;
6188 
6189  {
6190  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
6191  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
6192  TmpLastCommandEvent = Queue->LastCommandEvent;
6193  }
6194 
6195  if (TmpLastCommandEvent != nullptr) {
6196  PI_CALL(piEventsWait(1, &TmpLastCommandEvent));
6197  }
6198  }
6199 
6200  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
6201  std::scoped_lock Guard(Buffer->Mutex);
6202  if (Buffer->MapHostPtr) {
6203  *RetMap = Buffer->MapHostPtr + Offset;
6204  if (!Buffer->HostPtrImported &&
6205  !(MapFlags & PI_MAP_WRITE_INVALIDATE_REGION))
6206  memcpy(*RetMap, pi_cast<char *>(Buffer->getZeHandle()) + Offset, Size);
6207  } else {
6208  *RetMap = pi_cast<char *>(Buffer->getZeHandle()) + Offset;
6209  }
6210 
6211  auto Res = Buffer->Mappings.insert({*RetMap, {Offset, Size}});
6212  // False as the second value in pair means that mapping was not inserted
6213  // because mapping already exists.
6214  if (!Res.second) {
6215  zePrint("piEnqueueMemBufferMap: duplicate mapping detected\n");
6216  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
6217  }
6218 
6219  // Signal this event
6220  ZE_CALL(zeEventHostSignal, (ZeEvent));
6221  (*Event)->Completed = true;
6222  return PI_SUCCESS;
6223  }
6224 
6225  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
6226  std::scoped_lock Lock(Queue->Mutex, Buffer->Mutex);
6227 
6228  // For discrete devices we need a command list
6229  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList{};
6230  if (auto Res = Queue->Context->getAvailableCommandList(Queue, CommandList))
6231  return Res;
6232 
6233  // Set the commandlist in the event
6234  if (Event) {
6235  (*Event)->ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
6236  CommandList->second.append(*Event);
6237  PI_CALL(piEventRetain(*Event));
6238  }
6239 
6240  if (Buffer->MapHostPtr) {
6241  *RetMap = Buffer->MapHostPtr + Offset;
6242  } else {
6243  if (auto Res = ZeHostMemAllocHelper(RetMap, Queue->Context, Size))
6244  return Res;
6245  }
6246  const auto &ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
6247  const auto &WaitList = (*Event)->WaitList;
6248 
6249  if (WaitList.Length) {
6250  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendWaitOnEvents,
6251  (ZeCommandList, WaitList.Length, WaitList.ZeEventList));
6252  }
6253 
6254  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendMemoryCopy,
6255  (ZeCommandList, *RetMap,
6256  pi_cast<char *>(Buffer->getZeHandle()) + Offset, Size, ZeEvent, 0,
6257  nullptr));
6258 
6259  if (auto Res = Queue->executeCommandList(CommandList, BlockingMap))
6260  return Res;
6261 
6262  auto Res = Buffer->Mappings.insert({*RetMap, {Offset, Size}});
6263  // False as the second value in pair means that mapping was not inserted
6264  // because mapping already exists.
6265  if (!Res.second) {
6266  zePrint("piEnqueueMemBufferMap: duplicate mapping detected\n");
6267  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
6268  }
6269  return PI_SUCCESS;
6270 }
6271 
6272 pi_result piEnqueueMemUnmap(pi_queue Queue, pi_mem MemObj, void *MappedPtr,
6273  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
6274  const pi_event *EventWaitList, pi_event *Event) {
6275  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
6276  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
6277 
6278  // TODO: handle the case when user does not care to follow the event
6279  // of unmap completion.
6280  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
6281 
6282  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent = nullptr;
6283  {
6284  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
6285  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
6286 
6287  _pi_ze_event_list_t TmpWaitList;
6288  if (auto Res = TmpWaitList.createAndRetainPiZeEventList(
6289  NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList, Queue))
6290  return Res;
6291 
6292  auto Res = createEventAndAssociateQueue(Queue, Event,
6293  PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_UNMAP,
6294  Queue->CommandListMap.end());
6295  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
6296  return Res;
6297  ZeEvent = (*Event)->ZeEvent;
6298  (*Event)->WaitList = TmpWaitList;
6299  }
6300 
6301  _pi_mem::Mapping MapInfo = {};
6302  {
6303  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
6304  std::scoped_lock Guard(MemObj->Mutex);
6305  auto It = MemObj->Mappings.find(MappedPtr);
6306  if (It == MemObj->Mappings.end()) {
6307  zePrint("piEnqueueMemUnmap: unknown memory mapping\n");
6308  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
6309  }
6310  MapInfo = It->second;
6311  MemObj->Mappings.erase(It);
6312 
6313  // NOTE: we still have to free the host memory allocated/returned by
6314  // piEnqueueMemBufferMap, but can only do so after the above copy
6315  // is completed. Instead of waiting for It here (blocking), we shall
6316  // do so in piEventRelease called for the pi_event tracking the unmap.
6317  // In the case of an integrated device, the map operation does not allocate
6318  // any memory, so there is nothing to free. This is indicated by a nullptr.
6319  if (Event)
6320  (*Event)->CommandData =
6321  (MemObj->OnHost ? nullptr
6322  : (MemObj->MapHostPtr ? nullptr : MappedPtr));
6323  }
6324 
6325  // For integrated devices the buffer is allocated in host memory.
6326  if (MemObj->OnHost) {
6327  // Wait on incoming events before doing the copy
6328  PI_CALL(piEventsWait(NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList));
6329 
6330  if (Queue->isInOrderQueue()) {
6331  pi_event TmpLastCommandEvent = nullptr;
6332 
6333  {
6334  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
6335  std::shared_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
6336  TmpLastCommandEvent = Queue->LastCommandEvent;
6337  }
6338 
6339  if (TmpLastCommandEvent != nullptr) {
6340  PI_CALL(piEventsWait(1, &TmpLastCommandEvent));
6341  }
6342  }
6343 
6344  std::scoped_lock Guard(MemObj->Mutex);
6345  if (MemObj->MapHostPtr)
6346  memcpy(pi_cast<char *>(MemObj->getZeHandle()) + MapInfo.Offset, MappedPtr,
6347  MapInfo.Size);
6348 
6349  // Signal this event
6350  ZE_CALL(zeEventHostSignal, (ZeEvent));
6351  (*Event)->Completed = true;
6352  return PI_SUCCESS;
6353  }
6354 
6355  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
6356  std::scoped_lock Lock(Queue->Mutex, MemObj->Mutex);
6357 
6358  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList{};
6359  if (auto Res = Queue->Context->getAvailableCommandList(Queue, CommandList))
6360  return Res;
6361 
6362  // Set the commandlist in the event
6363  (*Event)->ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
6364  CommandList->second.append(*Event);
6365  PI_CALL(piEventRetain(*Event));
6366 
6367  const auto &ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
6368  if ((*Event)->WaitList.Length) {
6369  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendWaitOnEvents,
6370  (ZeCommandList, (*Event)->WaitList.Length,
6371  (*Event)->WaitList.ZeEventList));
6372  }
6373 
6374  // TODO: Level Zero is missing the memory "mapping" capabilities, so we are
6375  // left to doing copy (write back to the device).
6376  //
6377  // NOTE: Keep this in sync with the implementation of
6378  // piEnqueueMemBufferMap/piEnqueueMemImageMap.
6379 
6380  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendMemoryCopy,
6381  (ZeCommandList,
6382  pi_cast<char *>(MemObj->getZeHandle()) + MapInfo.Offset, MappedPtr,
6383  MapInfo.Size, ZeEvent, 0, nullptr));
6384 
6385  // Execute command list asynchronously, as the event will be used
6386  // to track down its completion.
6387  if (auto Res = Queue->executeCommandList(CommandList))
6388  return Res;
6389 
6390  return PI_SUCCESS;
6391 }
6392 
6393 pi_result piMemImageGetInfo(pi_mem Image, pi_image_info ParamName,
6394  size_t ParamValueSize, void *ParamValue,
6395  size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
6396  (void)Image;
6397  (void)ParamName;
6398  (void)ParamValueSize;
6399  (void)ParamValue;
6400  (void)ParamValueSizeRet;
6401 
6402  die("piMemImageGetInfo: not implemented");
6403  return {};
6404 }
6405 
6406 } // extern "C"
6407 
6408 static pi_result getImageRegionHelper(pi_mem Mem, pi_image_offset Origin,
6409  pi_image_region Region,
6410  ze_image_region_t &ZeRegion) {
6411 
6412  PI_ASSERT(Mem, PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
6413  PI_ASSERT(Origin, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6414 
6415 #ifndef NDEBUG
6416  PI_ASSERT(Mem->isImage(), PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
6417  auto Image = static_cast<_pi_image *>(Mem);
6418  ze_image_desc_t &ZeImageDesc = Image->ZeImageDesc;
6419 
6420  PI_ASSERT((ZeImageDesc.type == ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_1D && Origin->y == 0 &&
6421  Origin->z == 0) ||
6422  (ZeImageDesc.type == ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_1DARRAY && Origin->z == 0) ||
6423  (ZeImageDesc.type == ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_2D && Origin->z == 0) ||
6424  (ZeImageDesc.type == ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_3D),
6425  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6426 
6427  PI_ASSERT(Region->width && Region->height && Region->depth, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6428  PI_ASSERT(
6429  (ZeImageDesc.type == ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_1D && Region->height == 1 &&
6430  Region->depth == 1) ||
6431  (ZeImageDesc.type == ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_1DARRAY && Region->depth == 1) ||
6432  (ZeImageDesc.type == ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_2D && Region->depth == 1) ||
6433  (ZeImageDesc.type == ZE_IMAGE_TYPE_3D),
6434  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6435 #endif // !NDEBUG
6436 
6437  uint32_t OriginX = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Origin->x);
6438  uint32_t OriginY = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Origin->y);
6439  uint32_t OriginZ = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Origin->z);
6440 
6441  uint32_t Width = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Region->width);
6442  uint32_t Height = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Region->height);
6443  uint32_t Depth = pi_cast<uint32_t>(Region->depth);
6444 
6445  ZeRegion = {OriginX, OriginY, OriginZ, Width, Height, Depth};
6446 
6447  return PI_SUCCESS;
6448 }
6449 
6450 // Helper function to implement image read/write/copy.
6451 // PI interfaces must have queue's and destination image's mutexes locked for
6452 // exclusive use and source image's mutex locked for shared use on entry.
6453 static pi_result enqueueMemImageCommandHelper(
6454  pi_command_type CommandType, pi_queue Queue,
6455  const void *Src, // image or ptr
6456  void *Dst, // image or ptr
6457  pi_bool IsBlocking, pi_image_offset SrcOrigin, pi_image_offset DstOrigin,
6458  pi_image_region Region, size_t RowPitch, size_t SlicePitch,
6459  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList, const pi_event *EventWaitList,
6460  pi_event *Event, bool PreferCopyEngine = false) {
6461  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
6462  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
6463 
6464  _pi_ze_event_list_t TmpWaitList;
6465  if (auto Res = TmpWaitList.createAndRetainPiZeEventList(NumEventsInWaitList,
6466  EventWaitList, Queue))
6467  return Res;
6468 
6469  // Get a new command list to be used on this call
6470  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList{};
6471  bool UseCopyEngine = Queue->useCopyEngine(PreferCopyEngine);
6472  // We want to batch these commands to avoid extra submissions (costly)
6473  bool OkToBatch = true;
6474  if (auto Res = Queue->Context->getAvailableCommandList(
6475  Queue, CommandList, UseCopyEngine, OkToBatch))
6476  return Res;
6477 
6478  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent = nullptr;
6479  auto Res =
6480  createEventAndAssociateQueue(Queue, Event, CommandType, CommandList);
6481  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
6482  return Res;
6483  ZeEvent = (*Event)->ZeEvent;
6484  (*Event)->WaitList = TmpWaitList;
6485 
6486  const auto &ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
6487  const auto &WaitList = (*Event)->WaitList;
6488 
6489  if (WaitList.Length) {
6490  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendWaitOnEvents,
6491  (ZeCommandList, WaitList.Length, WaitList.ZeEventList));
6492  }
6493  if (CommandType == PI_COMMAND_TYPE_IMAGE_READ) {
6494  pi_mem SrcMem = pi_cast<pi_mem>(const_cast<void *>(Src));
6495 
6496  ze_image_region_t ZeSrcRegion;
6497  auto Result = getImageRegionHelper(SrcMem, SrcOrigin, Region, ZeSrcRegion);
6498  if (Result != PI_SUCCESS)
6499  return Result;
6500 
6501  // TODO: Level Zero does not support row_pitch/slice_pitch for images yet.
6502  // Check that SYCL RT did not want pitch larger than default.
6503  (void)RowPitch;
6504  (void)SlicePitch;
6505 #ifndef NDEBUG
6506  PI_ASSERT(SrcMem->isImage(), PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
6507 
6508  auto SrcImage = static_cast<_pi_image *>(SrcMem);
6509  const ze_image_desc_t &ZeImageDesc = SrcImage->ZeImageDesc;
6510  PI_ASSERT(
6511  RowPitch == 0 ||
6512  // special case RGBA image pitch equal to region's width
6513  (ZeImageDesc.format.layout == ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_LAYOUT_32_32_32_32 &&
6514  RowPitch == 4 * 4 * ZeSrcRegion.width) ||
6515  (ZeImageDesc.format.layout == ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_LAYOUT_16_16_16_16 &&
6516  RowPitch == 4 * 2 * ZeSrcRegion.width) ||
6517  (ZeImageDesc.format.layout == ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_LAYOUT_8_8_8_8 &&
6518  RowPitch == 4 * ZeSrcRegion.width),
6519  PI_INVALID_IMAGE_SIZE);
6520  PI_ASSERT(SlicePitch == 0 || SlicePitch == RowPitch * ZeSrcRegion.height,
6521  PI_INVALID_IMAGE_SIZE);
6522 #endif // !NDEBUG
6523 
6524  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendImageCopyToMemory,
6525  (ZeCommandList, Dst,
6526  pi_cast<ze_image_handle_t>(SrcMem->getZeHandle()), &ZeSrcRegion,
6527  ZeEvent, 0, nullptr));
6528  } else if (CommandType == PI_COMMAND_TYPE_IMAGE_WRITE) {
6529  pi_mem DstMem = pi_cast<pi_mem>(Dst);
6530  ze_image_region_t ZeDstRegion;
6531  auto Result = getImageRegionHelper(DstMem, DstOrigin, Region, ZeDstRegion);
6532  if (Result != PI_SUCCESS)
6533  return Result;
6534 
6535  // TODO: Level Zero does not support row_pitch/slice_pitch for images yet.
6536  // Check that SYCL RT did not want pitch larger than default.
6537 #ifndef NDEBUG
6538  PI_ASSERT(DstMem->isImage(), PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
6539 
6540  auto DstImage = static_cast<_pi_image *>(DstMem);
6541  const ze_image_desc_t &ZeImageDesc = DstImage->ZeImageDesc;
6542  PI_ASSERT(
6543  RowPitch == 0 ||
6544  // special case RGBA image pitch equal to region's width
6545  (ZeImageDesc.format.layout == ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_LAYOUT_32_32_32_32 &&
6546  RowPitch == 4 * 4 * ZeDstRegion.width) ||
6547  (ZeImageDesc.format.layout == ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_LAYOUT_16_16_16_16 &&
6548  RowPitch == 4 * 2 * ZeDstRegion.width) ||
6549  (ZeImageDesc.format.layout == ZE_IMAGE_FORMAT_LAYOUT_8_8_8_8 &&
6550  RowPitch == 4 * ZeDstRegion.width),
6551  PI_INVALID_IMAGE_SIZE);
6552  PI_ASSERT(SlicePitch == 0 || SlicePitch == RowPitch * ZeDstRegion.height,
6553  PI_INVALID_IMAGE_SIZE);
6554 #endif // !NDEBUG
6555 
6556  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendImageCopyFromMemory,
6557  (ZeCommandList, pi_cast<ze_image_handle_t>(DstMem->getZeHandle()),
6558  Src, &ZeDstRegion, ZeEvent, 0, nullptr));
6559  } else if (CommandType == PI_COMMAND_TYPE_IMAGE_COPY) {
6560  pi_mem SrcImage = pi_cast<pi_mem>(const_cast<void *>(Src));
6561  pi_mem DstImage = pi_cast<pi_mem>(Dst);
6562 
6563  ze_image_region_t ZeSrcRegion;
6564  auto Result =
6565  getImageRegionHelper(SrcImage, SrcOrigin, Region, ZeSrcRegion);
6566  if (Result != PI_SUCCESS)
6567  return Result;
6568  ze_image_region_t ZeDstRegion;
6569  Result = getImageRegionHelper(DstImage, DstOrigin, Region, ZeDstRegion);
6570  if (Result != PI_SUCCESS)
6571  return Result;
6572 
6573  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendImageCopyRegion,
6574  (ZeCommandList, pi_cast<ze_image_handle_t>(DstImage->getZeHandle()),
6575  pi_cast<ze_image_handle_t>(SrcImage->getZeHandle()), &ZeDstRegion,
6576  &ZeSrcRegion, ZeEvent, 0, nullptr));
6577  } else {
6578  zePrint("enqueueMemImageUpdate: unsupported image command type\n");
6579  return PI_INVALID_OPERATION;
6580  }
6581 
6582  if (auto Res = Queue->executeCommandList(CommandList, IsBlocking, OkToBatch))
6583  return Res;
6584 
6585  return PI_SUCCESS;
6586 }
6587 
6588 extern "C" {
6589 
6590 pi_result piEnqueueMemImageRead(pi_queue Queue, pi_mem Image,
6591  pi_bool BlockingRead, pi_image_offset Origin,
6592  pi_image_region Region, size_t RowPitch,
6593  size_t SlicePitch, void *Ptr,
6594  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
6595  const pi_event *EventWaitList,
6596  pi_event *Event) {
6597  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
6598 
6599  std::shared_lock SrcLock(Image->Mutex, std::defer_lock);
6600  std::scoped_lock LockAll(SrcLock, Queue->Mutex);
6601  return enqueueMemImageCommandHelper(
6602  PI_COMMAND_TYPE_IMAGE_READ, Queue,
6603  Image, // src
6604  Ptr, // dst
6605  BlockingRead,
6606  Origin, // SrcOrigin
6607  nullptr, // DstOrigin
6608  Region, RowPitch, SlicePitch, NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList, Event);
6609 }
6610 
6611 pi_result piEnqueueMemImageWrite(pi_queue Queue, pi_mem Image,
6612  pi_bool BlockingWrite, pi_image_offset Origin,
6613  pi_image_region Region, size_t InputRowPitch,
6614  size_t InputSlicePitch, const void *Ptr,
6615  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
6616  const pi_event *EventWaitList,
6617  pi_event *Event) {
6618 
6619  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
6620 
6621  std::scoped_lock Lock(Queue->Mutex, Image->Mutex);
6622  return enqueueMemImageCommandHelper(PI_COMMAND_TYPE_IMAGE_WRITE, Queue,
6623  Ptr, // src
6624  Image, // dst
6625  BlockingWrite,
6626  nullptr, // SrcOrigin
6627  Origin, // DstOrigin
6628  Region, InputRowPitch, InputSlicePitch,
6629  NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList,
6630  Event);
6631 }
6632 
6633 pi_result
6634 piEnqueueMemImageCopy(pi_queue Queue, pi_mem SrcImage, pi_mem DstImage,
6635  pi_image_offset SrcOrigin, pi_image_offset DstOrigin,
6636  pi_image_region Region, pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
6637  const pi_event *EventWaitList, pi_event *Event) {
6638 
6639  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
6640 
6641  std::shared_lock SrcLock(SrcImage->Mutex, std::defer_lock);
6642  std::scoped_lock LockAll(SrcLock, DstImage->Mutex, Queue->Mutex);
6643  // Copy engine is preferred only for host to device transfer.
6644  // Device to device transfers run faster on compute engines.
6645  bool PreferCopyEngine = (SrcImage->OnHost || DstImage->OnHost);
6646  return enqueueMemImageCommandHelper(
6647  PI_COMMAND_TYPE_IMAGE_COPY, Queue, SrcImage, DstImage,
6648  false, // is_blocking
6649  SrcOrigin, DstOrigin, Region,
6650  0, // row pitch
6651  0, // slice pitch
6652  NumEventsInWaitList, EventWaitList, Event, PreferCopyEngine);
6653 }
6654 
6655 pi_result piEnqueueMemImageFill(pi_queue Queue, pi_mem Image,
6656  const void *FillColor, const size_t *Origin,
6657  const size_t *Region,
6658  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
6659  const pi_event *EventWaitList,
6660  pi_event *Event) {
6661  (void)Image;
6662  (void)FillColor;
6663  (void)Origin;
6664  (void)Region;
6665  (void)NumEventsInWaitList;
6666  (void)EventWaitList;
6667  (void)Event;
6668 
6669  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
6670 
6671  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
6672  std::scoped_lock Lock(Queue->Mutex, Image->Mutex);
6673 
6674  die("piEnqueueMemImageFill: not implemented");
6675  return {};
6676 }
6677 
6678 pi_result piMemBufferPartition(pi_mem Buffer, pi_mem_flags Flags,
6679  pi_buffer_create_type BufferCreateType,
6680  void *BufferCreateInfo, pi_mem *RetMem) {
6681 
6682  PI_ASSERT(Buffer && !Buffer->isImage() &&
6683  !(static_cast<_pi_buffer *>(Buffer))->isSubBuffer(),
6684  PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT);
6685 
6686  PI_ASSERT(BufferCreateType == PI_BUFFER_CREATE_TYPE_REGION &&
6687  BufferCreateInfo && RetMem,
6688  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6689 
6690  std::shared_lock Guard(Buffer->Mutex);
6691 
6692  if (Flags != PI_MEM_FLAGS_ACCESS_RW) {
6693  die("piMemBufferPartition: Level-Zero implements only read-write buffer,"
6694  "no read-only or write-only yet.");
6695  }
6696 
6697  auto Region = (pi_buffer_region)BufferCreateInfo;
6698 
6699  PI_ASSERT(Region->size != 0u, PI_INVALID_BUFFER_SIZE);
6700  PI_ASSERT(Region->origin <= (Region->origin + Region->size),
6701  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6702 
6703  try {
6704  *RetMem =
6705  new _pi_buffer(Buffer->Context,
6706  pi_cast<char *>(Buffer->getZeHandle()) +
6707  Region->origin /* Level Zero memory handle */,
6708  nullptr /* Host pointer */, Buffer /* Parent buffer */,
6709  Region->origin /* Sub-buffer origin */,
6710  Region->size /*Sub-buffer size*/);
6711  } catch (const std::bad_alloc &) {
6712  return PI_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY;
6713  } catch (...) {
6714  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
6715  }
6716 
6717  return PI_SUCCESS;
6718 }
6719 
6720 pi_result piEnqueueNativeKernel(pi_queue Queue, void (*UserFunc)(void *),
6721  void *Args, size_t CbArgs,
6722  pi_uint32 NumMemObjects, const pi_mem *MemList,
6723  const void **ArgsMemLoc,
6724  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
6725  const pi_event *EventWaitList,
6726  pi_event *Event) {
6727  (void)UserFunc;
6728  (void)Args;
6729  (void)CbArgs;
6730  (void)NumMemObjects;
6731  (void)MemList;
6732  (void)ArgsMemLoc;
6733  (void)NumEventsInWaitList;
6734  (void)EventWaitList;
6735  (void)Event;
6736 
6737  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
6738 
6739  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
6740  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
6741 
6742  die("piEnqueueNativeKernel: not implemented");
6743  return {};
6744 }
6745 
6746 // Function gets characters between delimeter's in str
6747 // then checks if they are equal to the sub_str.
6748 // returns true if there is at least one instance
6749 // returns false if there are no instances of the name
6750 static bool is_in_separated_string(const std::string &str, char delimiter,
6751  const std::string &sub_str) {
6752  size_t beg = 0;
6753  size_t length = 0;
6754  for (const auto &x : str) {
6755  if (x == delimiter) {
6756  if (str.substr(beg, length) == sub_str)
6757  return true;
6758 
6759  beg += length + 1;
6760  length = 0;
6761  continue;
6762  }
6763  length++;
6764  }
6765  if (length != 0)
6766  if (str.substr(beg, length) == sub_str)
6767  return true;
6768 
6769  return false;
6770 }
6771 
6772 // TODO: Check if the function_pointer_ret type can be converted to void**.
6773 pi_result piextGetDeviceFunctionPointer(pi_device Device, pi_program Program,
6774  const char *FunctionName,
6775  pi_uint64 *FunctionPointerRet) {
6776  (void)Device;
6777  PI_ASSERT(Program, PI_INVALID_PROGRAM);
6778 
6779  std::shared_lock Guard(Program->Mutex);
6780  if (Program->State != _pi_program::Exe) {
6781  return PI_INVALID_PROGRAM_EXECUTABLE;
6782  }
6783 
6784  ze_result_t ZeResult =
6785  ZE_CALL_NOCHECK(zeModuleGetFunctionPointer,
6786  (Program->ZeModule, FunctionName,
6787  reinterpret_cast<void **>(FunctionPointerRet)));
6788 
6789  // zeModuleGetFunctionPointer currently fails for all
6790  // kernels regardless of if the kernel exist or not
6791  // with ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT
6792  // TODO: remove when this is no longer the case
6793  // If zeModuleGetFunctionPointer returns invalid argument,
6794  // fallback to searching through kernel list and return
6795  // PI_FUNCTION_ADDRESS_IS_NOT_AVAILABLE if the function exists
6796  // or PI_INVALID_KERNEL_NAME if the function does not exist.
6797  // FunctionPointerRet should always be 0
6798  if (ZeResult == ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT) {
6799  size_t Size;
6800  *FunctionPointerRet = 0;
6801  PI_CALL(piProgramGetInfo(Program, PI_PROGRAM_INFO_KERNEL_NAMES, 0, nullptr,
6802  &Size));
6803 
6804  std::string ClResult(Size, ' ');
6805  PI_CALL(piProgramGetInfo(Program, PI_PROGRAM_INFO_KERNEL_NAMES,
6806  ClResult.size(), &ClResult[0], nullptr));
6807 
6808  // Get rid of the null terminator and search for kernel_name
6809  // If function can be found return error code to indicate it
6810  // exists
6811  ClResult.pop_back();
6812  if (is_in_separated_string(ClResult, ';', std::string(FunctionName)))
6813  return PI_FUNCTION_ADDRESS_IS_NOT_AVAILABLE;
6814 
6815  return PI_INVALID_KERNEL_NAME;
6816  }
6817 
6818  if (ZeResult == ZE_RESULT_ERROR_INVALID_FUNCTION_NAME) {
6819  *FunctionPointerRet = 0;
6820  return PI_INVALID_KERNEL_NAME;
6821  }
6822 
6823  return mapError(ZeResult);
6824 }
6825 
6826 static bool ShouldUseUSMAllocator() {
6827  // Enable allocator by default if it's not explicitly disabled
6828  return std::getenv("SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_DISABLE_USM_ALLOCATOR") == nullptr;
6829 }
6830 
6831 static const bool UseUSMAllocator = ShouldUseUSMAllocator();
6832 
6833 static pi_result USMDeviceAllocImpl(void **ResultPtr, pi_context Context,
6834  pi_device Device,
6835  pi_usm_mem_properties *Properties,
6836  size_t Size, pi_uint32 Alignment) {
6837  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
6838  PI_ASSERT(Device, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
6839 
6840  // Check that incorrect bits are not set in the properties.
6841  PI_ASSERT(!Properties ||
6842  (*Properties == PI_MEM_ALLOC_FLAGS && *(Properties + 2) == 0),
6843  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6844 
6845  // TODO: translate PI properties to Level Zero flags
6846  ZeStruct<ze_device_mem_alloc_desc_t> ZeDesc;
6847  ZeDesc.flags = 0;
6848  ZeDesc.ordinal = 0;
6849 
6850  ZeStruct<ze_relaxed_allocation_limits_exp_desc_t> RelaxedDesc;
6851  if (Size > Device->ZeDeviceProperties->maxMemAllocSize) {
6852  // Tell Level-Zero to accept Size > maxMemAllocSize
6853  RelaxedDesc.flags = ZE_RELAXED_ALLOCATION_LIMITS_EXP_FLAG_MAX_SIZE;
6854  ZeDesc.pNext = &RelaxedDesc;
6855  }
6856 
6857  ZE_CALL(zeMemAllocDevice, (Context->ZeContext, &ZeDesc, Size, Alignment,
6858  Device->ZeDevice, ResultPtr));
6859 
6860  PI_ASSERT(Alignment == 0 ||
6861  reinterpret_cast<std::uintptr_t>(*ResultPtr) % Alignment == 0,
6862  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6863 
6864  return PI_SUCCESS;
6865 }
6866 
6867 static pi_result USMSharedAllocImpl(void **ResultPtr, pi_context Context,
6868  pi_device Device,
6869  pi_usm_mem_properties *Properties,
6870  size_t Size, pi_uint32 Alignment) {
6871  (void)Properties;
6872  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
6873  PI_ASSERT(Device, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
6874 
6875  // TODO: translate PI properties to Level Zero flags
6876  ZeStruct<ze_host_mem_alloc_desc_t> ZeHostDesc;
6877  ZeHostDesc.flags = 0;
6878  ZeStruct<ze_device_mem_alloc_desc_t> ZeDevDesc;
6879  ZeDevDesc.flags = 0;
6880  ZeDevDesc.ordinal = 0;
6881 
6882  ZeStruct<ze_relaxed_allocation_limits_exp_desc_t> RelaxedDesc;
6883  if (Size > Device->ZeDeviceProperties->maxMemAllocSize) {
6884  // Tell Level-Zero to accept Size > maxMemAllocSize
6885  RelaxedDesc.flags = ZE_RELAXED_ALLOCATION_LIMITS_EXP_FLAG_MAX_SIZE;
6886  ZeDevDesc.pNext = &RelaxedDesc;
6887  }
6888 
6889  ZE_CALL(zeMemAllocShared, (Context->ZeContext, &ZeDevDesc, &ZeHostDesc, Size,
6890  Alignment, Device->ZeDevice, ResultPtr));
6891 
6892  PI_ASSERT(Alignment == 0 ||
6893  reinterpret_cast<std::uintptr_t>(*ResultPtr) % Alignment == 0,
6894  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6895 
6896  return PI_SUCCESS;
6897 }
6898 
6899 static pi_result USMHostAllocImpl(void **ResultPtr, pi_context Context,
6900  pi_usm_mem_properties *Properties,
6901  size_t Size, pi_uint32 Alignment) {
6902  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
6903 
6904  // Check that incorrect bits are not set in the properties.
6905  PI_ASSERT(!Properties ||
6906  (*Properties == PI_MEM_ALLOC_FLAGS && *(Properties + 2) == 0),
6907  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6908 
6909  // TODO: translate PI properties to Level Zero flags
6910  ZeStruct<ze_host_mem_alloc_desc_t> ZeHostDesc;
6911  ZeHostDesc.flags = 0;
6912  ZE_CALL(zeMemAllocHost,
6913  (Context->ZeContext, &ZeHostDesc, Size, Alignment, ResultPtr));
6914 
6915  PI_ASSERT(Alignment == 0 ||
6916  reinterpret_cast<std::uintptr_t>(*ResultPtr) % Alignment == 0,
6917  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
6918 
6919  return PI_SUCCESS;
6920 }
6921 
6922 static pi_result USMFreeImpl(pi_context Context, void *Ptr) {
6923  ZE_CALL(zeMemFree, (Context->ZeContext, Ptr));
6924  return PI_SUCCESS;
6925 }
6926 
6927 // Exception type to pass allocation errors
6928 class UsmAllocationException {
6929  const pi_result Error;
6930 
6931 public:
6932  UsmAllocationException(pi_result Err) : Error{Err} {}
6933  pi_result getError() const { return Error; }
6934 };
6935 
6936 pi_result USMSharedMemoryAlloc::allocateImpl(void **ResultPtr, size_t Size,
6937  pi_uint32 Alignment) {
6938  return USMSharedAllocImpl(ResultPtr, Context, Device, nullptr, Size,
6939  Alignment);
6940 }
6941 
6942 pi_result USMSharedReadOnlyMemoryAlloc::allocateImpl(void **ResultPtr,
6943  size_t Size,
6944  pi_uint32 Alignment) {
6945  return USMSharedAllocImpl(ResultPtr, Context, Device, nullptr, Size,
6946  Alignment);
6947 }
6948 
6949 pi_result USMDeviceMemoryAlloc::allocateImpl(void **ResultPtr, size_t Size,
6950  pi_uint32 Alignment) {
6951  return USMDeviceAllocImpl(ResultPtr, Context, Device, nullptr, Size,
6952  Alignment);
6953 }
6954 
6955 pi_result USMHostMemoryAlloc::allocateImpl(void **ResultPtr, size_t Size,
6956  pi_uint32 Alignment) {
6957  return USMHostAllocImpl(ResultPtr, Context, nullptr, Size, Alignment);
6958 }
6959 
6960 SystemMemory::MemType USMSharedMemoryAlloc::getMemTypeImpl() {
6961  return SystemMemory::Shared;
6962 }
6963 
6964 SystemMemory::MemType USMDeviceMemoryAlloc::getMemTypeImpl() {
6965  return SystemMemory::Device;
6966 }
6967 
6968 SystemMemory::MemType USMHostMemoryAlloc::getMemTypeImpl() {
6969  return SystemMemory::Host;
6970 }
6971 
6972 void *USMMemoryAllocBase::allocate(size_t Size) {
6973  void *Ptr = nullptr;
6974 
6975  auto Res = allocateImpl(&Ptr, Size, sizeof(void *));
6976  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS) {
6977  throw UsmAllocationException(Res);
6978  }
6979 
6980  return Ptr;
6981 }
6982 
6983 void *USMMemoryAllocBase::allocate(size_t Size, size_t Alignment) {
6984  void *Ptr = nullptr;
6985 
6986  auto Res = allocateImpl(&Ptr, Size, Alignment);
6987  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS) {
6988  throw UsmAllocationException(Res);
6989  }
6990  return Ptr;
6991 }
6992 
6993 void USMMemoryAllocBase::deallocate(void *Ptr) {
6994  auto Res = USMFreeImpl(Context, Ptr);
6995  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS) {
6996  throw UsmAllocationException(Res);
6997  }
6998 }
6999 
7000 SystemMemory::MemType USMMemoryAllocBase::getMemType() {
7001  return getMemTypeImpl();
7002 }
7003 
7004 pi_result piextUSMDeviceAlloc(void **ResultPtr, pi_context Context,
7005  pi_device Device,
7006  pi_usm_mem_properties *Properties, size_t Size,
7007  pi_uint32 Alignment) {
7008  // L0 supports alignment up to 64KB and silently ignores higher values.
7009  // We flag alignment > 64KB as an invalid value.
7010  if (Alignment > 65536)
7011  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7012 
7013  pi_platform Plt = Device->Platform;
7014  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> ContextsLock(Plt->ContextsMutex,
7015  std::defer_lock);
7016  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
7017  // Lock the mutex which is guarding contexts container in the platform.
7018  // This prevents new kernels from being submitted in any context while we
7019  // are in the process of allocating a memory, this is needed to properly
7020  // capture allocations by kernels with indirect access.
7021  ContextsLock.lock();
7022  // We are going to defer memory release if there are kernels with indirect
7023  // access, that is why explicitly retain context to be sure that it is
7024  // released after all memory allocations in this context are released.
7025  PI_CALL(piContextRetain(Context));
7026  }
7027 
7028  if (!UseUSMAllocator ||
7029  // L0 spec says that allocation fails if Alignment != 2^n, in order to
7030  // keep the same behavior for the allocator, just call L0 API directly and
7031  // return the error code.
7032  ((Alignment & (Alignment - 1)) != 0)) {
7033  pi_result Res = USMDeviceAllocImpl(ResultPtr, Context, Device, Properties,
7034  Size, Alignment);
7035  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
7036  // Keep track of all memory allocations in the context
7037  Context->MemAllocs.emplace(std::piecewise_construct,
7038  std::forward_as_tuple(*ResultPtr),
7039  std::forward_as_tuple(Context));
7040  }
7041  return Res;
7042  }
7043 
7044  try {
7045  auto It = Context->DeviceMemAllocContexts.find(Device);
7046  if (It == Context->DeviceMemAllocContexts.end())
7047  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7048 
7049  *ResultPtr = It->second.allocate(Size, Alignment);
7050  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
7051  // Keep track of all memory allocations in the context
7052  Context->MemAllocs.emplace(std::piecewise_construct,
7053  std::forward_as_tuple(*ResultPtr),
7054  std::forward_as_tuple(Context));
7055  }
7056 
7057  } catch (const UsmAllocationException &Ex) {
7058  *ResultPtr = nullptr;
7059  return Ex.getError();
7060  } catch (...) {
7061  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
7062  }
7063 
7064  return PI_SUCCESS;
7065 }
7066 
7067 pi_result piextUSMSharedAlloc(void **ResultPtr, pi_context Context,
7068  pi_device Device,
7069  pi_usm_mem_properties *Properties, size_t Size,
7070  pi_uint32 Alignment) {
7071  // See if the memory is going to be read-only on the device.
7072  bool DeviceReadOnly = false;
7073  // Check that incorrect bits are not set in the properties.
7074  if (Properties) {
7075  PI_ASSERT(*(Properties) == PI_MEM_ALLOC_FLAGS && *(Properties + 2) == 0,
7076  PI_INVALID_VALUE);
7077  DeviceReadOnly = *(Properties + 1) & PI_MEM_ALLOC_DEVICE_READ_ONLY;
7078  }
7079 
7080  // L0 supports alignment up to 64KB and silently ignores higher values.
7081  // We flag alignment > 64KB as an invalid value.
7082  if (Alignment > 65536)
7083  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7084 
7085  pi_platform Plt = Device->Platform;
7086  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> ContextsLock(Plt->ContextsMutex,
7087  std::defer_lock);
7088  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
7089  // Lock the mutex which is guarding contexts container in the platform.
7090  // This prevents new kernels from being submitted in any context while we
7091  // are in the process of allocating a memory, this is needed to properly
7092  // capture allocations by kernels with indirect access.
7093  ContextsLock.lock();
7094  // We are going to defer memory release if there are kernels with indirect
7095  // access, that is why explicitly retain context to be sure that it is
7096  // released after all memory allocations in this context are released.
7097  PI_CALL(piContextRetain(Context));
7098  }
7099 
7100  if (!UseUSMAllocator ||
7101  // L0 spec says that allocation fails if Alignment != 2^n, in order to
7102  // keep the same behavior for the allocator, just call L0 API directly and
7103  // return the error code.
7104  ((Alignment & (Alignment - 1)) != 0)) {
7105  pi_result Res = USMSharedAllocImpl(ResultPtr, Context, Device, Properties,
7106  Size, Alignment);
7107  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
7108  // Keep track of all memory allocations in the context
7109  Context->MemAllocs.emplace(std::piecewise_construct,
7110  std::forward_as_tuple(*ResultPtr),
7111  std::forward_as_tuple(Context));
7112  }
7113  return Res;
7114  }
7115 
7116  try {
7117  auto &Allocator = (DeviceReadOnly ? Context->SharedReadOnlyMemAllocContexts
7118  : Context->SharedMemAllocContexts);
7119  auto It = Allocator.find(Device);
7120  if (It == Allocator.end())
7121  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7122 
7123  *ResultPtr = It->second.allocate(Size, Alignment);
7124  if (DeviceReadOnly) {
7125  Context->SharedReadOnlyAllocs.insert(*ResultPtr);
7126  }
7127  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
7128  // Keep track of all memory allocations in the context
7129  Context->MemAllocs.emplace(std::piecewise_construct,
7130  std::forward_as_tuple(*ResultPtr),
7131  std::forward_as_tuple(Context));
7132  }
7133  } catch (const UsmAllocationException &Ex) {
7134  *ResultPtr = nullptr;
7135  return Ex.getError();
7136  } catch (...) {
7137  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
7138  }
7139 
7140  return PI_SUCCESS;
7141 }
7142 
7143 pi_result piextUSMHostAlloc(void **ResultPtr, pi_context Context,
7144  pi_usm_mem_properties *Properties, size_t Size,
7145  pi_uint32 Alignment) {
7146  // L0 supports alignment up to 64KB and silently ignores higher values.
7147  // We flag alignment > 64KB as an invalid value.
7148  if (Alignment > 65536)
7149  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7150 
7151  pi_platform Plt = Context->Devices[0]->Platform;
7152  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> ContextsLock(Plt->ContextsMutex,
7153  std::defer_lock);
7154  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
7155  // Lock the mutex which is guarding contexts container in the platform.
7156  // This prevents new kernels from being submitted in any context while we
7157  // are in the process of allocating a memory, this is needed to properly
7158  // capture allocations by kernels with indirect access.
7159  ContextsLock.lock();
7160  // We are going to defer memory release if there are kernels with indirect
7161  // access, that is why explicitly retain context to be sure that it is
7162  // released after all memory allocations in this context are released.
7163  PI_CALL(piContextRetain(Context));
7164  }
7165 
7166  if (!UseUSMAllocator ||
7167  // L0 spec says that allocation fails if Alignment != 2^n, in order to
7168  // keep the same behavior for the allocator, just call L0 API directly and
7169  // return the error code.
7170  ((Alignment & (Alignment - 1)) != 0)) {
7171  pi_result Res =
7172  USMHostAllocImpl(ResultPtr, Context, Properties, Size, Alignment);
7173  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
7174  // Keep track of all memory allocations in the context
7175  Context->MemAllocs.emplace(std::piecewise_construct,
7176  std::forward_as_tuple(*ResultPtr),
7177  std::forward_as_tuple(Context));
7178  }
7179  return Res;
7180  }
7181 
7182  // There is a single allocator for Host USM allocations, so we don't need to
7183  // find the allocator depending on context as we do for Shared and Device
7184  // allocations.
7185  try {
7186  *ResultPtr = Context->HostMemAllocContext->allocate(Size, Alignment);
7187  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
7188  // Keep track of all memory allocations in the context
7189  Context->MemAllocs.emplace(std::piecewise_construct,
7190  std::forward_as_tuple(*ResultPtr),
7191  std::forward_as_tuple(Context));
7192  }
7193  } catch (const UsmAllocationException &Ex) {
7194  *ResultPtr = nullptr;
7195  return Ex.getError();
7196  } catch (...) {
7197  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
7198  }
7199 
7200  return PI_SUCCESS;
7201 }
7202 
7203 // Helper function to deallocate USM memory, if indirect access support is
7204 // enabled then a caller must lock the platform-level mutex guarding the
7205 // container with contexts because deallocating the memory can turn RefCount of
7206 // a context to 0 and as a result the context being removed from the list of
7207 // tracked contexts.
7208 static pi_result USMFreeHelper(pi_context Context, void *Ptr) {
7209  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled) {
7210  auto It = Context->MemAllocs.find(Ptr);
7211  if (It == std::end(Context->MemAllocs)) {
7212  die("All memory allocations must be tracked!");
7213  }
7214  if (--(It->second.RefCount) != 0) {
7215  // Memory can't be deallocated yet.
7216  return PI_SUCCESS;
7217  }
7218 
7219  // Reference count is zero, it is ok to free memory.
7220  // We don't need to track this allocation anymore.
7221  Context->MemAllocs.erase(It);
7222  }
7223 
7224  if (!UseUSMAllocator) {
7225  pi_result Res = USMFreeImpl(Context, Ptr);
7226  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled)
7227  PI_CALL(ContextReleaseHelper(Context));
7228  return Res;
7229  }
7230 
7231  // Query the device of the allocation to determine the right allocator context
7232  ze_device_handle_t ZeDeviceHandle;
7233  ZeStruct<ze_memory_allocation_properties_t> ZeMemoryAllocationProperties;
7234 
7235  // Query memory type of the pointer we're freeing to determine the correct
7236  // way to do it(directly or via an allocator)
7237  ZE_CALL(zeMemGetAllocProperties,
7238  (Context->ZeContext, Ptr, &ZeMemoryAllocationProperties,
7239  &ZeDeviceHandle));
7240 
7241  // If memory type is host release from host pool
7242  if (ZeMemoryAllocationProperties.type == ZE_MEMORY_TYPE_HOST) {
7243  try {
7244  Context->HostMemAllocContext->deallocate(Ptr);
7245  } catch (const UsmAllocationException &Ex) {
7246  return Ex.getError();
7247  } catch (...) {
7248  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
7249  }
7250  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled)
7251  PI_CALL(ContextReleaseHelper(Context));
7252  return PI_SUCCESS;
7253  }
7254 
7255  // Points out an allocation in SharedReadOnlyMemAllocContexts
7256  auto SharedReadOnlyAllocsIterator = Context->SharedReadOnlyAllocs.end();
7257 
7258  if (!ZeDeviceHandle) {
7259  // The only case where it is OK not have device identified is
7260  // if the memory is not known to the driver. We should not ever get
7261  // this either, probably.
7262  PI_ASSERT(ZeMemoryAllocationProperties.type == ZE_MEMORY_TYPE_UNKNOWN,
7263  PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
7264  } else {
7265  pi_device Device;
7266  if (Context->Devices.size() == 1) {
7267  Device = Context->Devices[0];
7268  PI_ASSERT(Device->ZeDevice == ZeDeviceHandle, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
7269  } else {
7270  // All devices in the context are of the same platform.
7271  auto Platform = Context->Devices[0]->Platform;
7272  Device = Platform->getDeviceFromNativeHandle(ZeDeviceHandle);
7273  PI_ASSERT(Device, PI_INVALID_DEVICE);
7274  }
7275 
7276  auto DeallocationHelper =
7277  [Context, Device,
7278  Ptr](std::unordered_map<pi_device, USMAllocContext> &AllocContextMap) {
7279  try {
7280  auto It = AllocContextMap.find(Device);
7281  if (It == AllocContextMap.end())
7282  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7283 
7284  // The right context is found, deallocate the pointer
7285  It->second.deallocate(Ptr);
7286  } catch (const UsmAllocationException &Ex) {
7287  return Ex.getError();
7288  }
7289 
7290  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled)
7291  PI_CALL(ContextReleaseHelper(Context));
7292  return PI_SUCCESS;
7293  };
7294 
7295  switch (ZeMemoryAllocationProperties.type) {
7296  case ZE_MEMORY_TYPE_SHARED:
7297  // Distinguish device_read_only allocations since they have own pool.
7298  SharedReadOnlyAllocsIterator = Context->SharedReadOnlyAllocs.find(Ptr);
7299  return DeallocationHelper(SharedReadOnlyAllocsIterator !=
7300  Context->SharedReadOnlyAllocs.end()
7301  ? Context->SharedReadOnlyMemAllocContexts
7302  : Context->SharedMemAllocContexts);
7303  case ZE_MEMORY_TYPE_DEVICE:
7304  return DeallocationHelper(Context->DeviceMemAllocContexts);
7305  default:
7306  // Handled below
7307  break;
7308  }
7309  }
7310 
7311  pi_result Res = USMFreeImpl(Context, Ptr);
7312  if (SharedReadOnlyAllocsIterator != Context->SharedReadOnlyAllocs.end()) {
7313  Context->SharedReadOnlyAllocs.erase(SharedReadOnlyAllocsIterator);
7314  }
7315  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled)
7316  PI_CALL(ContextReleaseHelper(Context));
7317  return Res;
7318 }
7319 
7320 pi_result piextUSMFree(pi_context Context, void *Ptr) {
7321  pi_platform Plt = Context->Devices[0]->Platform;
7322  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> ContextsLock(Plt->ContextsMutex,
7323  std::defer_lock);
7324  if (IndirectAccessTrackingEnabled)
7325  ContextsLock.lock();
7326  return USMFreeHelper(Context, Ptr);
7327 }
7328 
7329 pi_result piextKernelSetArgPointer(pi_kernel Kernel, pi_uint32 ArgIndex,
7330  size_t ArgSize, const void *ArgValue) {
7331 
7332  PI_CALL(piKernelSetArg(Kernel, ArgIndex, ArgSize, ArgValue));
7333  return PI_SUCCESS;
7334 }
7335 
7347 pi_result piextUSMEnqueueMemset(pi_queue Queue, void *Ptr, pi_int32 Value,
7348  size_t Count, pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitlist,
7349  const pi_event *EventsWaitlist,
7350  pi_event *Event) {
7351  if (!Ptr) {
7352  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7353  }
7354 
7355  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
7356 
7357  std::scoped_lock Lock(Queue->Mutex);
7358  return enqueueMemFillHelper(
7359  // TODO: do we need a new command type for USM memset?
7360  PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_FILL, Queue, Ptr,
7361  &Value, // It will be interpreted as an 8-bit value,
7362  1, // which is indicated with this pattern_size==1
7363  Count, NumEventsInWaitlist, EventsWaitlist, Event);
7364 }
7365 
7366 // Helper function to check if a pointer is a device pointer.
7367 static bool IsDevicePointer(pi_context Context, const void *Ptr) {
7368  ze_device_handle_t ZeDeviceHandle;
7369  ZeStruct<ze_memory_allocation_properties_t> ZeMemoryAllocationProperties;
7370 
7371  // Query memory type of the pointer
7372  ZE_CALL(zeMemGetAllocProperties,
7373  (Context->ZeContext, Ptr, &ZeMemoryAllocationProperties,
7374  &ZeDeviceHandle));
7375 
7376  return (ZeMemoryAllocationProperties.type == ZE_MEMORY_TYPE_DEVICE);
7377 }
7378 
7379 pi_result piextUSMEnqueueMemcpy(pi_queue Queue, pi_bool Blocking, void *DstPtr,
7380  const void *SrcPtr, size_t Size,
7381  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitlist,
7382  const pi_event *EventsWaitlist,
7383  pi_event *Event) {
7384 
7385  if (!DstPtr) {
7386  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7387  }
7388 
7389  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
7390 
7391  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
7392 
7393  // Device to Device copies are found to execute slower on copy engine
7394  // (versus compute engine).
7395  bool PreferCopyEngine = !IsDevicePointer(Queue->Context, SrcPtr) ||
7396  !IsDevicePointer(Queue->Context, DstPtr);
7397 
7398  // Temporary option added to use copy engine for D2D copy
7399  PreferCopyEngine |= UseCopyEngineForD2DCopy;
7400 
7401  return enqueueMemCopyHelper(
7402  // TODO: do we need a new command type for this?
7403  PI_COMMAND_TYPE_MEM_BUFFER_COPY, Queue, DstPtr, Blocking, Size, SrcPtr,
7404  NumEventsInWaitlist, EventsWaitlist, Event, PreferCopyEngine);
7405 }
7406 
7416 pi_result piextUSMEnqueuePrefetch(pi_queue Queue, const void *Ptr, size_t Size,
7417  pi_usm_migration_flags Flags,
7418  pi_uint32 NumEventsInWaitList,
7419  const pi_event *EventWaitList,
7420  pi_event *Event) {
7421 
7422  // flags is currently unused so fail if set
7423  PI_ASSERT(Flags == 0, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
7424  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
7425  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
7426 
7427  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
7428  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
7429 
7435  _pi_ze_event_list_t TmpWaitList;
7436  if (auto Res = TmpWaitList.createAndRetainPiZeEventList(NumEventsInWaitList,
7437  EventWaitList, Queue))
7438  return Res;
7439 
7440  // Get a new command list to be used on this call
7441  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList{};
7442  // TODO: Change UseCopyEngine argument to 'true' once L0 backend
7443  // support is added
7444  if (auto Res = Queue->Context->getAvailableCommandList(
7445  Queue, CommandList, false /* UseCopyEngine */))
7446  return Res;
7447 
7448  // TODO: do we need to create a unique command type for this?
7449  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent = nullptr;
7450  auto Res = createEventAndAssociateQueue(Queue, Event, PI_COMMAND_TYPE_USER,
7451  CommandList);
7452  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
7453  return Res;
7454  ZeEvent = (*Event)->ZeEvent;
7455  (*Event)->WaitList = TmpWaitList;
7456 
7457  const auto &WaitList = (*Event)->WaitList;
7458  const auto &ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
7459  if (WaitList.Length) {
7460  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendWaitOnEvents,
7461  (ZeCommandList, WaitList.Length, WaitList.ZeEventList));
7462  }
7463  // TODO: figure out how to translate "flags"
7464  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendMemoryPrefetch, (ZeCommandList, Ptr, Size));
7465 
7466  // TODO: Level Zero does not have a completion "event" with the prefetch API,
7467  // so manually add command to signal our event.
7468  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendSignalEvent, (ZeCommandList, ZeEvent));
7469 
7470  if (auto Res = Queue->executeCommandList(CommandList, false))
7471  return Res;
7472 
7473  return PI_SUCCESS;
7474 }
7475 
7484 pi_result piextUSMEnqueueMemAdvise(pi_queue Queue, const void *Ptr,
7485  size_t Length, pi_mem_advice Advice,
7486  pi_event *Event) {
7487  PI_ASSERT(Queue, PI_INVALID_QUEUE);
7488  PI_ASSERT(Event, PI_INVALID_EVENT);
7489 
7490  // Lock automatically releases when this goes out of scope.
7491  std::scoped_lock lock(Queue->Mutex);
7492 
7493  auto ZeAdvice = pi_cast<ze_memory_advice_t>(Advice);
7494 
7495  _pi_ze_event_list_t TmpWaitList;
7496  if (auto Res = TmpWaitList.createAndRetainPiZeEventList(0, nullptr, Queue))
7497  return Res;
7498 
7499  // Get a new command list to be used on this call
7500  pi_command_list_ptr_t CommandList{};
7501  // UseCopyEngine is set to 'false' here.
7502  // TODO: Additional analysis is required to check if this operation will
7503  // run faster on copy engines.
7504  if (auto Res = Queue->Context->getAvailableCommandList(
7505  Queue, CommandList, false /* UseCopyEngine */))
7506  return Res;
7507 
7508  // TODO: do we need to create a unique command type for this?
7509  ze_event_handle_t ZeEvent = nullptr;
7510  auto Res = createEventAndAssociateQueue(Queue, Event, PI_COMMAND_TYPE_USER,
7511  CommandList);
7512  if (Res != PI_SUCCESS)
7513  return Res;
7514  ZeEvent = (*Event)->ZeEvent;
7515  (*Event)->WaitList = TmpWaitList;
7516 
7517  const auto &ZeCommandList = CommandList->first;
7518  const auto &WaitList = (*Event)->WaitList;
7519 
7520  if (WaitList.Length) {
7521  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendWaitOnEvents,
7522  (ZeCommandList, WaitList.Length, WaitList.ZeEventList));
7523  }
7524 
7525  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendMemAdvise,
7526  (ZeCommandList, Queue->Device->ZeDevice, Ptr, Length, ZeAdvice));
7527 
7528  // TODO: Level Zero does not have a completion "event" with the advise API,
7529  // so manually add command to signal our event.
7530  ZE_CALL(zeCommandListAppendSignalEvent, (ZeCommandList, ZeEvent));
7531 
7532  Queue->executeCommandList(CommandList, false);
7533  return PI_SUCCESS;
7534 }
7535 
7552 pi_result piextUSMGetMemAllocInfo(pi_context Context, const void *Ptr,
7553  pi_mem_info ParamName, size_t ParamValueSize,
7554  void *ParamValue, size_t *ParamValueSizeRet) {
7555  PI_ASSERT(Context, PI_INVALID_CONTEXT);
7556 
7557  ze_device_handle_t ZeDeviceHandle;
7558  ZeStruct<ze_memory_allocation_properties_t> ZeMemoryAllocationProperties;
7559 
7560  ZE_CALL(zeMemGetAllocProperties,
7561  (Context->ZeContext, Ptr, &ZeMemoryAllocationProperties,
7562  &ZeDeviceHandle));
7563 
7564  ReturnHelper ReturnValue(ParamValueSize, ParamValue, ParamValueSizeRet);
7565  switch (ParamName) {
7566  case PI_MEM_ALLOC_TYPE: {
7567  pi_usm_type MemAllocaType;
7568  switch (ZeMemoryAllocationProperties.type) {
7569  case ZE_MEMORY_TYPE_UNKNOWN:
7570  MemAllocaType = PI_MEM_TYPE_UNKNOWN;
7571  break;
7572  case ZE_MEMORY_TYPE_HOST:
7573  MemAllocaType = PI_MEM_TYPE_HOST;
7574  break;
7575  case ZE_MEMORY_TYPE_DEVICE:
7576  MemAllocaType = PI_MEM_TYPE_DEVICE;
7577  break;
7578  case ZE_MEMORY_TYPE_SHARED:
7579  MemAllocaType = PI_MEM_TYPE_SHARED;
7580  break;
7581  default:
7582  zePrint("piextUSMGetMemAllocInfo: unexpected usm memory type\n");
7583  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7584  }
7585  return ReturnValue(MemAllocaType);
7586  }
7587  case PI_MEM_ALLOC_DEVICE:
7588  if (ZeDeviceHandle) {
7589  // All devices in the context are of the same platform.
7590  auto Platform = Context->Devices[0]->Platform;
7591  auto Device = Platform->getDeviceFromNativeHandle(ZeDeviceHandle);
7592  return Device ? ReturnValue(Device) : PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7593  } else {
7594  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7595  }
7596  case PI_MEM_ALLOC_BASE_PTR: {
7597  void *Base;
7598  ZE_CALL(zeMemGetAddressRange, (Context->ZeContext, Ptr, &Base, nullptr));
7599  return ReturnValue(Base);
7600  }
7601  case PI_MEM_ALLOC_SIZE: {
7602  size_t Size;
7603  ZE_CALL(zeMemGetAddressRange, (Context->ZeContext, Ptr, nullptr, &Size));
7604  return ReturnValue(Size);
7605  }
7606  default:
7607  zePrint("piextUSMGetMemAllocInfo: unsupported ParamName\n");
7608  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7609  }
7610  return PI_SUCCESS;
7611 }
7612 
7613 pi_result piKernelSetExecInfo(pi_kernel Kernel, pi_kernel_exec_info ParamName,
7614  size_t ParamValueSize, const void *ParamValue) {
7615  (void)ParamValueSize;
7616  PI_ASSERT(Kernel, PI_INVALID_KERNEL);
7617  PI_ASSERT(ParamValue, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
7618 
7619  if (ParamName == PI_USM_INDIRECT_ACCESS &&
7620  *(static_cast<const pi_bool *>(ParamValue)) == PI_TRUE) {
7621  // The whole point for users really was to not need to know anything
7622  // about the types of allocations kernel uses. So in DPC++ we always
7623  // just set all 3 modes for each kernel.
7624  ze_kernel_indirect_access_flags_t IndirectFlags =
7625  ZE_KERNEL_INDIRECT_ACCESS_FLAG_HOST |
7626  ZE_KERNEL_INDIRECT_ACCESS_FLAG_DEVICE |
7627  ZE_KERNEL_INDIRECT_ACCESS_FLAG_SHARED;
7628  ZE_CALL(zeKernelSetIndirectAccess, (Kernel->ZeKernel, IndirectFlags));
7629  } else {
7630  zePrint("piKernelSetExecInfo: unsupported ParamName\n");
7631  return PI_INVALID_VALUE;
7632  }
7633 
7634  return PI_SUCCESS;
7635 }
7636 
7637 pi_result piextProgramSetSpecializationConstant(pi_program Prog,
7638  pi_uint32 SpecID, size_t,
7639  const void *SpecValue) {
7640  std::scoped_lock Guard(Prog->Mutex);
7641 
7642  // Remember the value of this specialization constant until the program is
7643  // built. Note that we only save the pointer to the buffer that contains the
7644  // value. The caller is responsible for maintaining storage for this buffer.
7645  //
7646  // NOTE: SpecSize is unused in Level Zero, the size is known from SPIR-V by
7647  // SpecID.
7648  Prog->SpecConstants[SpecID] = SpecValue;
7649 
7650  return PI_SUCCESS;
7651 }
7652 
7653 pi_result piPluginInit(pi_plugin *PluginInit) {
7654  PI_ASSERT(PluginInit, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
7655 
7656  // TODO: handle versioning/targets properly.
7657  size_t PluginVersionSize = sizeof(PluginInit->PluginVersion);
7658 
7659  PI_ASSERT(strlen(_PI_H_VERSION_STRING) < PluginVersionSize, PI_INVALID_VALUE);
7660 
7661  strncpy(PluginInit->PluginVersion, _PI_H_VERSION_STRING, PluginVersionSize);
7662 
7663 #define _PI_API(api) \
7664  (PluginInit->PiFunctionTable).api = (decltype(&::api))(&api);
7665 #include <CL/sycl/detail/pi.def>
7666 
7667  return PI_SUCCESS;
7668 }
7669 
7670 pi_result piextPluginGetOpaqueData(void *opaque_data_param,
7671  void **opaque_data_return) {
7672  (void)opaque_data_param;
7673  (void)opaque_data_return;
7674  return PI_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
7675 }
7676 
7677 // SYCL RT calls this api to notify the end of plugin lifetime.
7678 // It can include all the jobs to tear down resources before
7679 // the plugin is unloaded from memory.
7680 pi_result piTearDown(void *PluginParameter) {
7681  (void)PluginParameter;
7682  bool LeakFound = false;
7683  // reclaim pi_platform objects here since we don't have piPlatformRelease.
7684  for (pi_platform &Platform : *PiPlatformsCache) {
7685  delete Platform;
7686  }
7687  delete PiPlatformsCache;
7688  delete PiPlatformsCacheMutex;
7689 
7690  // Print the balance of various create/destroy native calls.
7691  // The idea is to verify if the number of create(+) and destroy(-) calls are
7692  // matched.
7693  if (ZeDebug & ZE_DEBUG_CALL_COUNT) {
7694  // clang-format off
7695  //
7696  // The format of this table is such that each row accounts for a
7697  // specific type of objects, and all elements in the raw except the last
7698  // one are allocating objects of that type, while the last element is known
7699  // to deallocate objects of that type.
7700  //
7701  std::vector<std::vector<const char *>> CreateDestroySet = {
7702  {"zeContextCreate", "zeContextDestroy"},
7703  {"zeCommandQueueCreate", "zeCommandQueueDestroy"},
7704  {"zeModuleCreate", "zeModuleDestroy"},
7705  {"zeKernelCreate", "zeKernelDestroy"},
7706  {"zeEventPoolCreate", "zeEventPoolDestroy"},
7707  {"zeCommandListCreateImmediate", "zeCommandListCreate", "zeCommandListDestroy"},
7708  {"zeEventCreate", "zeEventDestroy"},
7709  {"zeFenceCreate", "zeFenceDestroy"},
7710  {"zeImageCreate", "zeImageDestroy"},
7711  {"zeSamplerCreate", "zeSamplerDestroy"},
7712  {"zeMemAllocDevice", "zeMemAllocHost", "zeMemAllocShared", "zeMemFree"},
7713  };
7714 
7715  // A sample output aimed below is this:
7716  // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
7717  // zeContextCreate = 1 \---> zeContextDestroy = 1
7718  // zeCommandQueueCreate = 1 \---> zeCommandQueueDestroy = 1
7719  // zeModuleCreate = 1 \---> zeModuleDestroy = 1
7720  // zeKernelCreate = 1 \---> zeKernelDestroy = 1
7721  // zeEventPoolCreate = 1 \---> zeEventPoolDestroy = 1
7722  // zeCommandListCreateImmediate = 1 |
7723  // zeCommandListCreate = 1 \---> zeCommandListDestroy = 1 ---> LEAK = 1
7724  // zeEventCreate = 2 \---> zeEventDestroy = 2
7725  // zeFenceCreate = 1 \---> zeFenceDestroy = 1
7726  // zeImageCreate = 0 \---> zeImageDestroy = 0
7727  // zeSamplerCreate = 0 \---> zeSamplerDestroy = 0
7728  // zeMemAllocDevice = 0 |
7729  // zeMemAllocHost = 1 |
7730  // zeMemAllocShared = 0 \---> zeMemFree = 1
7731  //
7732  // clang-format on
7733 
7734  fprintf(stderr, "ZE_DEBUG=%d: check balance of create/destroy calls\n",
7735  ZE_DEBUG_CALL_COUNT);
7736  fprintf(stderr,
7737  "----------------------------------------------------------\n");
7738  for (const auto &Row : CreateDestroySet) {
7739  int diff = 0;
7740  for (auto I = Row.begin(); I != Row.end();) {
7741  const char *ZeName = *I;
7742  const auto &ZeCount = (*ZeCallCount)[*I];
7743 
7744  bool First = (I == Row.begin());
7745  bool Last = (++I == Row.end());
7746 
7747  if (Last) {
7748  fprintf(stderr, " \\--->");
7749  diff -= ZeCount;
7750  } else {
7751  diff += ZeCount;
7752  if (!First) {
7753  fprintf(stderr, " | \n");
7754  }
7755  }
7756 
7757  fprintf(stderr, "%30s = %-5d", ZeName, ZeCount);
7758  }
7759 
7760  if (diff) {
7761  LeakFound = true;
7762  fprintf(stderr, " ---> LEAK = %d", diff);
7763  }
7764  fprintf(stderr, "\n");
7765  }
7766 
7767  ZeCallCount->clear();
7768  delete ZeCallCount;
7769  ZeCallCount = nullptr;
7770  }
7771  if (LeakFound)
7772  return PI_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT;
7773  return PI_SUCCESS;
7774 }
7775 
7776 } // extern "C"
